address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Pleasant 10 min walk along the sea front to the Water Bus. restaurants etc. Hotel was comfortable breakfast was good - quite a variety. Room aircon didn't work very well. Take mosquito repelant!

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Really lovely hotel. Stayed on the very top floor and were surprised by a Jacuzzi bath we didn't know we were getting! Staff were friendly and helpful and the included breakfast was great! Great location and great value for money. Didn't want to leave!

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights in October. The hotel staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Assisted in booking tickets for the opera. The rooms were clean and comfortable- good shower, light and airy rooms with windows you could open wide. Beds were comfortable. Plenty of choice for breakfast.Spa at hotel nearby which we used while we were there.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights in October. The hotel staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Assisted in booking tickets for the opera. The rooms were clean and comfortable- good shower, light and airy rooms with windows you could open wide. Beds were comfortable. Plenty of choice for breakfast.Spa at hotel nearby which we used while we were there.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: We loved staying on the island of Lido! You need to take a water is from Venice to get there. From the train station, a boat ride takes 45 minutes but has beautiful views along the way. Hotel is an EASY walk from the boat dock. The room was very clean and the breakfast was plentiful. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Lovely view out onto the lagoon. Excellent view. Staff were welcoming and helpful.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: It was ok hotel is nice from in and out but room was small we paid for double bed bat they atteched 2 single bed

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. My wife and I had a room with a terrace over looking the water...it was a great view! I will look to stay at this hotel my next time in Venice...very pleased.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Nice hotel , with very friendly staff and helpful - great choice for breakfast , something for everyone.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: DON'T stay here unless you're less than 2 feet tall or like sleeping with centipedes. Our 4th floor room was an attic with a vaulted ceiling that angles down to 3ft. The bed is only accessible from one side. If you placed your head in the skylight on the other side you might able sit up. The bathtub was impractical with broken shower head. We moved to the 1st floor the next day and within minutes found a centipede on the wall and15 flies. We asked for a broom to get rid of the centipede. Later in the day the receptionist said she gave us something to control the bugs. We never complained about the drain flies so she must have noticed a problem. That night we spent 2 hrs catching 6 centipedes in our room. 2 came from throw pillows. We asked reception for a new room or hotel but there supposedly weren't any hotels with open rooms and if we wanted leave we would have to pay for transportation and both hotels. The next morning we went to reception to tell them about the bug problem. We barely said anything before the woman apologized and said they didn't put the bugs in the room on purpose so we should just go about our day and forget it. She added that she often goes on vacation with her children and sometimes things happen, so she tries to make the best of everything and not start a war. Adding, a few euros isn't going to make anything go away so we should just go enjoy the day because more we talk the less time we have.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: We had absolutely no problems whatsoever with this hotel and were very pleasantly surprised by the quality considering the low price. The dcor of the room was pleasant and flawless, unlike many of the Venice hotels I've stayed in. The breakfast buffet was delicious too. And to finish all this off, the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. In terms of location, the hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Lido waterbus stop, then a boat takes around 15 mins to get into Venice. We didn't find this a problem at all - we knew this was going to be the case so had pre-booked transport tickets to save money. The surrounding Lido is pleasant and worth an explore in a spare couple of hours. In conclusion, I would book this again due to the fantastic quality of the hotel, despite the trade-off of not being in Venice itself.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Lovely hotel, 10 min walk to the water bus stop on lido. Away from the madness of Venice, but close enough to be there in less than 20 minutes.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Das Hotel liegt auf der Insel Lido neben Venedig, direkt am Meer mit Blick auf Venedig. Lido kann man sehr gut mit den Booten erreichen. Vom Bootsanlegeplatz sind es ca. 400 m zum Hotel an der Kste entlang. Den Weg mussten wir zu Fu zurcklegen, da keine Busse wegen einer Baustelle dorthin fahren. Wir wurden sehr freundlich empfangen, berhaupt war das Personal im Hotel sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Das Zimmer war gemtlich eingerichtet, das Bad relativ gro und alles sehr sauber und ordentlich. Auch mit dem Frhstcksbffet waren wir sehr zufrieden - gute Qualitt und relativ groe Auswahl. Wir waren rundherum zufrieden und wrden das Hotel sofort wieder buchen.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Located on the Lido I would recommend this hotel if you require a little piece and quiet after the busy day's in Venice, facility's good, staff very friendly and very helpful. I requested flowers for the room as it was one of my wife's special birthday's, and yes they ordered exactly as requested, can't ask for more. Rooms are a little on the small side but in line with most European hotels of this standard so wasn't a surprise or a problem, room and bathroom was cleaned every day with fresh towels supplied each day. Buffet breakfast had various options to suit most peoples taste but It was a surprise to see sausage, bacon and scrambled eggs available, must have been put on to satisfy us Brits! We stayed during late September so the Lido is probably quieter at that time however we felt very safe walking around late at night back to the hotel but taxis are available if you feel a little vulnerable. Restaurants and coffee bars are located in the main commercial area close to the Waterbus stations and tend to be slightly cheaper than in Venice. We had a water taxi (think luxury speed boat!) from the airport to the hotel and back again, quite an experience, a little costly but well worth it, a lot quicker and less hassle than the Waterbus. Venice was very busy during the day time, St Marks Square at night is a must, fantastic atmosphere. All in all we had a great time in Venice, it can be a little expensive so don't ponder over the bills to much, just pay up with a smile!

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Great stay...close to ferry.food not so good nearby

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Stayed with parents, wife twin toddlers in two triple rooms. The hotel is easy to reach and the rooms were well placed well furnished. The best feature was extremely friendly helpful staff, particularly Ms. Annalucia Ms. Anna who were always ready to listen help out with big smiles. The breakfasts were very good, with good spread and the guests were made welcome to sit and eat at leisure (more important when you are with toddlers!) Would surely go back to Venice would happily stay again at Russo Palace.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: This hotel is in Lido which is a better choice than staying in crowded Venice. The water bus is very convenient and it takes only few more stops to the main attractions in Venice. We received excellent service - many thanks to Anna and Donnatella who made us feel at home.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: It was a 10 min+ walk to water bus, would have liked it closer. Located on the water on Lido island, away from the rush of Venice

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Room was tiny-bed saggy-bAthroom door didn't work. Good breakfast and convenient location. Wouldn't return or recommend.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL WITH DIRECTIONS, KNOWING ALL THE RIGHT PLACES TO VISIT AND WHERE TO EAT TH BEST FOOD IN THE AREA. The Front Desk Receptionists were extremely helpful ..especially Sabrina who made us feel very welcomed to Lido....We will be back next year for sure!

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: No shower but jets in the bathtub and my room was slanted but made it work

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Really enjoyed the stay, about a 10min walk to the main waterbus station. Had the perfect quiet location and staff were really friendly!!

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Walls extremely thin, you can hear everything. Excessive hoovering every morning outside bedroom. There. Is a bar, but no one to tend it.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: If you're looking for a hotel where the action is, go elsewhere. The hotel is on the Lido, which is about a 10-15 minute waterbus ride away from Venice. However, if you're looking for a place on the Lido, this is a well-priced option. The staff was great with handling/recommending dinner reservations, even during an insane Carnevale weekend. The doors are a little thin and since the building is old, the soundproofing needs improvement. The quarters are cramped, but the room comes with breakfast. If we wanted to stay on the Lido again, this would be a good option, but next time I think we'll opt for a place closer to the action. Recommended.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Hotel facilities are good and breakfast ample. Econmy rooms have sloping roof so tall guests mind your head We stayed in one and it was fine, the occational bump but for the price you cant really complain.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Friendly reception very helpful. Hotel has pleasant views and is about ten minute walk to main water bus terminal to take you any direction. We used the spa one day. Good saunas but relaxation area noisy and small. Some lovely restaurants close by and cheaper than in Venice.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: It was a bit far from city center

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Great hotel, staff where amazing and the location and views make this a great Base to visit Venice!

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Close to Venice and decent hotel, breakfast was okay with no too much selection but has everything you need.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: beautiful views of Venice in the lovely relaxed calmer area of Lido Di Venezia. Gorgeous sunsets and very easy to access Venice, rather than satying in the hustle and bustle. Close to only beaches in Venice. Staff were so helpful, especially Ivan and the lady we met on the desk each morning.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: This is a great little hotel. We had a wonderful view from the room and patio. Good size. Breakfast was great even had North American breakfast foods. Only issue was the two twin beds pushed together. That was very uncomfortable.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Nice staff. Nice location. We booked two nights at Russo hotel on Lido strip and two nights in the very center of Venice. This is a good balance. Lido is a bit further but it feels more local and is more relaxing too, it gave us a taste of Dolce Vita. We didn't see it on the hotel description but they offered us a taxi boat ride to Murano with another couple for free. The boat ride was very pleasant, they dropped us in a glass blowing factory shop, the glass making demonstration was nice and there was very little pressure to buy. Internet was free for 20 minutes/day but a bit slow like everywhere in Venice. So in short a good pick, good value for money.

address: Riviera San Nicol 11/a, 30126
name: Hotel Russo Palace
reviews.text: Nice and clean. Rooms are spacious with air conditioning. Good selection of breakfast. Within easy reach of San Marco. Quite location.

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: We had a wonderful, relaxing time. The staff were completely attentive and accommodating. We had a corner king room with a kitchen, two patios and a deluxe bathroom. You had to drive into town but they said that Uber is available if you need it. This was our first visit to Palm Springs and hopefully not our last! It really... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: We were in Palm Springs on the day the temperature was 123 degrees! Despite that, we had a wonderful stay because of the Little Paradise hotel. The staff were friendly and accommodating, and all of the little complimentary touches were so nice, like a bottle of wine for us in the fridge, sun care products near the pool, and a... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: We arrived in Palm Springs not sure what to expect....it's a quiet kinda place in 'low season'....we drove down what appeared to be a residential street...parked up at a wooden gate and weren't sure what to expect. What awaited took us back in amazement...the room is spacious with an air of decadence...the welcome wine and comprehensive breakfast was more than... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: This place really is a little paradise!! A beautiful boutique style hotel with EVERYTHING meticulously thought out to make our vacation perfect. Saltwater pool, fresh fruit, BEST showerhead I've ever experienced, I can go on and on. The bed was so comfortable and we slept like babies. Victor did a wonderful job and Judy was just lovely and personable!

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights at Little Paradise boutique hotel on a mother-daughter trip. Wonderful and relaxing experience. Clean and newly redone rooms that are well equipped and spacious. Perfect location off the main street in a quiet neighborhood that is close to downtown Palm Springs. The pool area has a nice gas fire pit area and lots of comfy chaise lounges... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: This little hotel surpassed all my expectations. The rooms are well equiped with a little kitchenette, fridge was filled with croissants, 3 bottles of water, soda and much more. The room was very clean and the bathroom was equiped with a top notch shower. I would definately recommend this place to anyone visiting or passing trough Palm Springs. The reception... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: If you want peaceful and relaxing look no further. Although set up like a single floor motel it is hardly anything but. The rooms are very nice with a full kitchen. They provide some breakfast items, snacks and bottles of spring water. You can bring in anything you like to enjoy at the pool or in your room. By the... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: All the reviews are great and agree on this fine little place. I'd also like to add the wonderful service you will find here with Victor and staff who seem to want to do anything and everything to make you happy. The king beds here are just amazing. We seldom run into beds this comfy. The room has a large... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: We went for a relaxing weekend as an offshoot of a family visit. This was a great place to go with a nice room and a view of the mountains from just outside. The ONLY thing we didn't like was that the sun dropped below the mountains too early and the temperature dropped along with it. Maybe you can fix... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: We were on a business trip to Anaheim and, afterwards, drove to Palm Springs for a relaxing weekend. It turned out that this hotel was the perfect place! We arrived late and were pleasantly surprised upon checking in to see that, not only were the accommodations incredibly thoughtful and comfortable, but the refrigerator came stocked with croissants, bagels, cream cheese,... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: Victor and Judy were truly accommodating hosts, especially when we had to cut our stay short due to illness. Everything that has been written by other reviewers was spot on. It is more like a small inn or bed breakfast (with the breakfast left in the fridge in your room) than a hotel. There are eight guest rooms around... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: If you want to relax, want a quiet atmosphere, cozy setting.. this is the place. It is definitely a smaller, boutique-type hotel and it feels that way. So that's good for some and maybe not as much for others. The room is great, very pretty. Very impressive large, new Curved HD TV. So that's nice! The small kitchen is also... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights and it was delightful. Lovely comfortable,well lit, great shower and bathroom,kitchen with microwave,fridge etc and very functional room. Ten hotels on this trip but this one seems to have thought of everything. Peaceful yet near the main streets with lovely shopping, art and some great restaurants. Good local transport but downtown is walkable but a bit over... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: New everything would be great from the moment we came through the gate. Nine excellent, high quality rooms each with a small kitchen/diner and terrific shower room including twin wash basins. Each room faces onto the pool with plenty of sun loungers, towels, shaded areas and comfortable seating. Rooms furnished to extremely high standard and beds have the finest linen... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: Spend four days there and would have prolonged our stay if they only had a room available. Welcoming host, all rooms around the patio / pool. This place breathes tranquility and relaxation. Since you normally travel by car in this country anyways, everything is close by.

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: I'm going to keep this fairly short but what I will say is if you are going to stay in Palm Springs please stay here. It's not right on the main drag but it's in a lovely residential area, no noise, ample parking and just so peaceful. Only 5 in an Uber to the main strip with the bars and... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: We had unit 4 on the east side of the complex for 3 nights - very quiet, very comfortable bed, nice amenities in room - killer shower!! pool was large, heated, wonderful - Judy hope I got that right made us fresh orange and banana smoothies when we were in the pool - breakfast in fridge was just ok, little... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in this beautiful hotel. This place is very clean, rooms have all been recently upgraded. Big comfortable bed, nice kitchen with granite countertops, fridge, Keurig coffee maker, and even a two burner stove. Bathrooms are big with granite countertops, two sinks, and a huge shower. Pool area is gorgeous and the owner and staff make you feel... More

address: 435 E Avenida Olancha, 92264
name: Little Paradise Hotel
reviews.text: This place is just perfect for everyone looking for some rest in lovely and warm Palm Springs. The host welcomed us very very friendly, explaining us what we could find where. The private kitchen had our breakfast and a complimentary bottle of wine. The room (call it the appartment) had everything and was very well decorated and had an outside... More

reviews.text: Little Paradise is called a hotel, but it is more of a motel tucked away in a nice neighborhood district with similar styled single story boutique motels/hotels. This is not your large chain full service hotel but a nice hideaway with just a few rooms surrounding a warm salt water swimming pool. There is no on-site restaurant but you get... More

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The room was fine and the mattress was very comfortable. Unfortunately, I arrived while the front entrance was under-construction. There was not sufficient signage to find out how to enter the building. I would have left, had I not already had a reservation through Hotels.com.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Reprehensible three days without maid service despite telling the management after it had happened the first time. I would not recommend this hotel for this reason.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The pictures on the web site were more expensive looking then the reality. We were told we had one of the best rooms, besides staring at cargo containers, the TV would not work so they changed our room. It was not well furnished and we could not regulate the air conditioner (way too warm for sleeping). The continental breakfast was good and the staff was very nice and helpful. The linens were harsh and uncomfortable. Sorry, but this was not at all what I expected and it was certainly unacceptable.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The didn't tell me they were gonna run my credit card for accidental for a 100 charge. They just told me they had to double check my ID and the credit card that was used.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: I stayed here with some girlfriends for a wine tasting getaway. The staff pointed out some great wineries and restaurants and were very friendly.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel. Very clean and service was great. This is a must stay and if I'm in need of a hotel in the Livermore area, this is the place to stay.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The room was big and the hotel staff were nice, but I couldn't get over the smelly linens. When I lay down on the bed, all I could smell was dirty old sweat socks! I don't think they ever used detergent or fabric softener to wash the linens!They were that horrible! I had to spray the linens with perfume so I wouldn't smell them 'au naturel' while I'm sleeping! I'm never going to stay in this hotel ever again!

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Nice place no complaints, one thing they didn't tell me,is they put a 100 hold on your card that stays for a couple days after you check out. I know this is not rare but any place that does has told me. I ended up calling trying to get it refunded. The breakfast in morning was pretty good, they had a full buffet not just some pakage pastries. Leave your swimsuit at home though the pool is small very small.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Great stay for our night downtown Livermore at Bankhead Theater concert. Birthday celebration for friend. The most comfortable bed ever! Nice patio where we spent our morning catching up. Hotel under construction did not bother us.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Perfect for my family to relax for the Easter weekend and for my girlfriend's Livermore 1/2 marathon!

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The hotel was great. There was little construction going on which altered where they served breakfast, but it didn't bother us any.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Having never been to Livermore, imagine my shock when the 2nd floor balcony room overlooked a parking lot and a gas station with a Jack in the Box thrown in for good measure. I thought I was staying in wine country. It would also have been nice to know that it is under construction. Granted I should have done more research but it was a last minute decision to go. The only good thing I could say is the bed was comfortable. If you are looking for a hotel right off of a freeway this one fits the bill, although way overpriced.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The bathroom sink splashes water, need to be fixed. The bathtub/shower make loud noises. Other than that, it was a good stay.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Great

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Nice in/out along the freeway. I thought it was a little high for what it was.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Beds and pillows were nice. And the television was good as well. The pool was closed.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The breakfast in the morning was delicious with a good selection of food and beverages. We will definitely stay here again and refer friends and family too.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Close to freeway on/off ramp. enjoyed the stay

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: This hotel was promoted as being in the wine country. However, it was a block from the freeway. When we asked the desk clerk about this, she pointed her finger toward the door and said, It's about 4 miles that way. We had a great view of Jack in the Box parking lot. When we first entered our room and kicked off our shoes, we found ourselves stepping on numerous sand burrs left on the carpet. After working out and returning to our room at 9am, there was no hot water for the shower. The breakfast was adequate and the housekeeping staff were friendly.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Came for concert at Wente. Last time I traveled to area the accomodations had a shuttle service. That would be a nice amenity if you could add it. Great clean place to stay.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Only problem we had was that we were not informed of the teen basketball tournament going on in the city. As a result, lots of kids, the room next to ours had the TV blaring until midnight and then on again a 5 am. We went to the lobby for our full breakfast at 10:15 and there was nothing left. We pickup a beagle and coffee and went to our room. They should have planned ahead for all the teens to eat all the food. There was 45 minutes left for breakfast time but nothing to eat. Outside of that, our stay was very nice. The gentleman at the front desk was especially cordial and accommodating.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: It was cold in the room. We couldn't get the heater on easily for some reason but then when the heat temperature finally came on we were sweating in the middle of the night. I would like a better thermostat or better direction. The hot breakfast was great!!!

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: All the rooms have been recently renovated. They are in the process of renovating the lobby area. The room was new and clean. The beds were very comfortable. The bed linen looks new too. Its also nice to have electrical sockets at desk level and plenty of them. The breakfast was so so... eggs, sausages and hashbrown (no fruits) but barely edible.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: Let's face it, this is NOT in the Livermore 'wine country'....you can throw a rock from your room to busy InterState 580 and never come close to a vine or vineyard!

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: It was OK . they paid for the ice I purached.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: I must say the GM at this hotel Catherine is the bomb! She was very attentive and helpful. The hotel was very clean and the staff were all very nice to us from the moment we walked in the door. I would stay here every time I'm in California. Thanks again Cat!

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The hotel was great, but the Buffet Breakfast was the worst I have ever had! The bacon taste like cardboard, eggs and sausage were cold, Pastries were hard and very little fruit. The only thing hot and worth eating was fixing yourself a waffle at the waffle machine if you didn't mind waiting in line for it.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551

reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise! We are use to staying at expensive four star hotels but needed to complete a quick business trip and we were so delighted with this hotel. All newly remodeled, pleasant professional staff, and the hot breakfast was a perfect addition. Highly recommend and you will not be disappointed!

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful. We were very impressed by the dcor everything was clean and felt very upscale. The hotel is located near the freeway. There is a gas station, fast food, and shopping nearby. We were in town for a family event so we didn't do much exploring, but there seemed to be many amenities right in the area. The best part was the proximity to downtown Livermore. Wonderful shopping and dining opportunities, and only 5 minutes away. Also, the wineries are within a 10 minute drive. All in all, a wonderful place to stay and lots to do in the area.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551

reviews.text: The room was clean, spacious, and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were in Livermore for a two-day stay, and it was a nice quiet retreat in the midst of family chaos.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551

reviews.text: All was great, until the heater/AC came on. It sounded like a vacuum cleaner every time it turned on. Waking me up over and over. The room would get to hot then to cold. Had a horrible night sleep. Vroom -- Vroom. Clean, friendly, comfy bed, all ruined by a Motel-6 quality wall unit.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: There's nothing wrong with the hotel except that there are flood lights shining in your window while you sleep and the curtains don't close. I really like the furniture The bedding was clean the pillows are great. Next time I will ask for a room with windows on the other side.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very nice. Staff was very helpful, especially with accommodating us when we asked to check in early. The problem was with cleanliness. And the pool was full of leaves and dirt on the bottom. Otherwise, our room would have been great. Very large with everything you need for a comfortable stay. Nice large screen tv as well - made my husband happy.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551

reviews.text: Mediocre. The carpets and elevator reek of sour wine. Evidently they have regular wine Thursdays here. Service was somewhat lacking. I requested a wakeup call, they didn't do it. Finally, the free breakfast was on the poor side. Daddy, this bacon tastes like tuna.

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551

address: 1700 N Livermore Ave, 94551
name: Hawthorn Suites By Wyndham Livermore Wine Country
reviews.text: I live somewhat local in Redwood City, but it's far enough away that after spending the evening with High School Friends, having a 30th gathering wasn't an official reunion, at a local beer pub, we didn't want to chance driving home after having a few beers. We made the reservation Friday night, and honestly, was apprehensive because of some of the reviews. Pleasantly surprised! The place was clean, it's had a facelift and looks good. The bathroom tub could use an update...but I have stayed in the W in downtown Chicago and the tub was worse and room was horrible. I'd take this room over that one any day! The breakfast the next morning was good. Nothing to write home about, but it offers a great selection and the eggs weren't watered down. Sausage was good...bacon...well, that looked and smelled like a dog treat. Passed on that one. But the coffee was decent and overall, was very pleased with our last minute choice to stay there...would do it again and would recommend others! It was 1/2 mile from the pub and right at the freeway, so leaving was easy, too.

If I was back in town for work, I'd stay here again for sure.

name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: The staff at the Fairfield Inn were amazing. They arranged a cab for us, offered us hot tea after a late night arrival on a very cold evening, they check in on us the next day to make sure we were settled and had everything we needed. They made sure our stay at their hotel was comfortable. An extra thank you to Candice, Bea, and Donna. Thank you ladies for going above and beyond. Great breakfast in the morning too!!

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: Easily accessible in spite of traffic on 17. Clean. Bath a teensy bit small but still acceptable. We had a king bed - that's all they had available, but the two doubles may have been a little tight. We did use a rollaway cot for our son (5'10, 150lbs) and wound up putting the mattress on the floor the second night as the frame was simply too small for a teenage boy!

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: I often stay at Hampton Inns but one was not conveniently located so I opted for this Fairfield Inn near Bingham ton because it seemed to be about the same quality although a little pricier. What a mistake ! The motel, although the room was clean and comfortable, was very unattractive and way overpriced for the amenities. I would have walked out but I had a no cancellation reservation. When I mentioned the unattractiveness to the desk clerk she acknowledged the problem and very nicely explained that the place was due for a major overhaul. So. if the management knew it was not up to snuff why the high rate. This experience guarantees that I will avoid Fairfield in the future and recommend that other travelers stay away also

Definitely would recommend to family friends and will absolutely stay again!

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before a 5k Color Run. The room was very clean - but my son did find a skittle under the bed, wedged into the corner. I think it's his goal to find 'anything' when he enters a hotel room. The beds were very comfy as were the pillows, and we were even able to enjoy the pool for a while. All in all this was a very nice hotel and the staff was great. They didn't even cringe when we walked back in after the run covered in wild colors :-)

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: Clean comfortable room with pleasant staff. No problems.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: We stayed at this property to attend an event about 20 miles away. It's close to the highway, which was convenient for us. Room was quite comfortable and had relatively new furnishings. However, upon arrival we were greeted by a large roll away bed standing on end (i.e., it blocked part of the entry and wouldn't have fit in room if it were set up). When I went to front desk to see about having it removed, I had to wait about 10 minutes for desk person who apparently was only staff person on duty and was working desk and dealing with room issues - she went with me to room to remove bed. Also, lobby was a little iffy - lobby restroom was not clean and, there was a carpet runner in the lobby that was really several pieces of leftover wall-to-wall remnants that had been hand cut - a bit tacky and a tripping hazard. Finally, a couple had a huge, screaming fight in the middle of the night, which I found quite disturbing because I was concerned it could turn violent - not hotel's fault but still... Would return but probably only if there is no other option.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: appears to be recently remodelled, rooms were clean and new and very pleasant

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: The room we had was roomy and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was a basic offering but much appreciated. The toilet tank had a small leak, but was only evident the morning of checkout.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: The only complaint was trying to regulate the heat/cooling system.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: Nice, clean and new motel. Wish the bathroom was a bit bigger. Wife did a quick turn and bruised her hip o the metal door latch.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: Nice Hotel, close to Applebees, which delivered right to your room. The continental breakfast was also very good.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: Good experience and very convenient to where I needed to be. Hotel was quiet and staff polite and helpful. Conveniently located between two restaurants that serve decent food at reasonable prices. Only downside was that hotel room was a bit dusty... not unclean but bedside lamp had dust on base. Very well out-fitted with outlets, however, which is needed these days. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: From the moment of check in we were pleased. Greeted cordially (not fake) we were asked if we would need anything additional (we were 6 adults and 5 children under the age of 6 renting 3 rooms). They had already put our rooms nearby (even when requested at other hotels in advance this seems to be a HUGE request and usually not done) We have stayed at other hotels in the area but your rooms are spacious and beds are wonderful. We will continue to return here anytime we are in the area.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: We were thrilled with everything from the cleanliness to the top notch breakfast to the kindness of everyone but, the very first person we met. She was the first person we approached behind the counter when we arrived. Later we learned that she was handling both the desk and the Housekeeping roles that night. If I were to judge the facility by this one person, I would have been disappointed in her lack of hospitality in answering our questions: no smile, no patience...cranky. However the rest of our stay, and we did add an extra night, more than made up for it. This was my first getaway in 4 years on ANY kind of vacation/family celebration, so I was really hoping for a good time. I really enjoyed the cleanliness, as I own a cleaning service here in MD. Thank you so much for an overall excellent stay!!!

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: The staff was indifferent to my stay. For example, almost had to convince the front desk to go through the effort to sell me another night stay. I almost went to another hotel because it seemed too much trouble to check me out and then check me back in. Not likely to return.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: Travel mid point stop over

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: I had never stayed at a Fairfield Inn. I was very impressed with the staff., they were excellent. The rooms were great and the service was even better. Would definitely recommend anyone looking for a hotel to stay at a Fairfield Inn.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States
name: Fairfield Inn By Marriott Binghamton
reviews.text: Very friendly staff and excellent breakfast choices. I question that the comforter was not double sheeted but had a light weight searsucker spread on it. Also, we received half used bottle of shampoo.

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States

address: 864 Upper, Front St, Binghamton, NY 13905, United States

Upon my request, both were replaced and we were offered a different room, but inspection of this room included holes in both the sheets and blanket. Disgusting. If I hadn't booked on line I would have insisted on my money back. We would never recommend this hotel to anyone!

reviews.text: From 30/9-2/10, I was on amazing corporate trip at EQ. Every arrangement was spectacular. The ambiance, food, services, utilities, & especially the staff. They made me feel pampered! My heart was truly happy & full. I felt heavy to go home!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: The security personnel was very helpful at the car park. Easy parking. Check in was a breeze. Loved the room - spacious, thick barhroom slippers, comfy bed, good view, separate toilet, bathtub, complimentary minibar, nespresso machine, plenty of drinking water, on demand movies.. i had some time to spare and asked a staff about the most expensive room in the hotel. Guess what? He offered to show me 🌝 had the opportunity to see the Presidential Suite, the AHA Suite and the Executive Suite. Impeccable. I enjoyed lunch at Etoille - fresh juices, wrap, hot food. Sky 51 has the best view. Took lots of pictures - day and night 😆 Must try the signature smoky cocktail at Blue. Strong and good. 👍 Special mention to Chef Paddy and Has at Nipah who were ever ready to…

Not left behind the housekeeping ( a guy with specky) with a great service,helpful kakak cleaner I guess when I ask for prayer room. Everybody are very nice. Tq for the great service EQ! Keep it up.

These are among the staff name that I recalled. I can remember all the names as all are the best. Thumbs up EQ for making our trip a memorable one!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia

reviews.text: i happy to stay at EQ hotel for 3D2N with great service provided by EQ hotel.. All the facilities is fantastic like Himalaya Salt Sauna, Monsun Rain and the pool with great panorama. Also they are have commited staffs as well like Aizad & Dino.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I stayed at EQ KL from 30 Sep to 2 Oct 2022 as part of a corporate event. During my stay, my company held several meetings and most of our meals were in the hotel. Everything went well and I'm pleased the way things turned out. I'd like to credit a few EQ staff for this: Jana, who is the epitome of "under promise over achieve", coordinated our corporate stay and events beautifully. I'd like to say a big thanks to him. I'd also like to say well done to Anas, the restaurant manager of Sabayon, who also worked with me to provide my team a wonderful fine dining experience. Lastly, a thumbs up to the tall Indian bellman (sorry forgot his name) for always putting in his best efforts to ensure all our storage and baggage needs were met.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: All staff very friendly! good customer service, very helpful.. specially Aizad. All best & keep up the good hospitality Aizad! The deluxe king room, for me is the best.. the food, the view esp at sky 51.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: My friend and I had an absolutely enjoyable stay here. If there's one thing about this hotel that stands above the rest, it's their impeccable service. I loved how we both were practically escorted from the moment we stepped out of the car until we checked in. The members of staff are warm, welcoming and ever attentive to all our needs. Huge shoutout to Affan for being kind enough to let us extend our check out time! This is actually my 2nd time staying here and I definitely would love to return for another stay.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: one of the best hotels I stayed in KL, rooms r awesome with a good amount of space. The breakfast spread is vast. The swimming pool and jacuzzi are located in a nice place. The best part of the rooftop bar which is a must-visit during sunset.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: EQ KL is a fantastic hotel for business travellers and holiday makers! This hotel is new, modern and located at the heart of KLCC with beautiful rooms and facilities including the stunning sky bar and restaurant, SKY51 and the beautiful infinite pool on level 29. Furthermore, all the staff who I encountered during my stay were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Although I have visited KL many times this year, this is the very first time I stayed at EQ KL. However, I will be definitely coming back to EQ KL.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my fiancé and parents for a week. I can boldly say that EQ Hotel was the best hotel that I have stayed in during the last ten years of my many trips to the countries. Apart from the fact that the location of the hotel was excellent, it was considered a first-class hotel in terms of reception, hospitality, polite staff and coordination. I had requested a handddicaped room due to my disability. The room was really big and completely wheelchair accessible. The hotel had arranged for me a disabled lift and it was in the room before we arrived. I would like to thank Ms. Sharifah Nor and Mr. Dino Zainal for helping me so much before and during my stay at the hotel. As I said, the hotel is first-class in every way and it is absolutely worth the money you…

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Anna are kind and enthusiastic, and thank you to tawi are so helpful. Nice view of the swimming pool, all the facilities are so clean and good. Thank you to all the staff there, Will come back again. Thankss

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: This was my 3 stay in 2022 and EQ still exceeded my expectations. Room is super nice, clean and modern; as with the whole hotel ambience. What set them apart from their competitors; is their EXCELLENT customer service. This 5 stars service was consistent across the hotel from reservation, to concierge, to reception and housekeeping; and this is what pull me back here again and again. Keep up the great hospitality EQ.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: The EQ exceeded our expectations. We were kindly upgraded to a Petronas Tower View deluxe room as we arrived early and our standard deluxe room wasn't ready. The rooms are clean and modern with a wide array of amenities including coffee machine, a good range of toiletries, powerful hair dryer and free hair brush. The bath is freestanding and quite some size! The windows have electric blinds which are a great addition as they can be controlled from the bed. The free mini bar contains water and soft drinks as well as some small snacks. Breakfast was the highlight, with Malaysian, Indian, Chinese and western choices as well as some gorgeous pastries. The gym has brand new equipment and the pool offers amazing vjews if KL Tower. Sky51 is also well worth a visit. If we were to return…

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Had a good staycation two nights in EQ Kuala Lumpur for the birthday celebration.Great location and the hospitality of the hotel. Love the room of the infinity king with kl tower view and also complimentary of cake and simple decoration. The staff Aslina was supportive and friendly. Definitely will come back for next visit.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Especcialy indi is a very good man. He will do anything in his power to help you to enjoy your days/weeks in this luxurious hotel. Everything is perfect. Clean, service good, price is normal! Relaxed and very serious for any one!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Thank you Ain, Steven and Affan on the front desk of EQ Hotel who assisted me to buy food from outside and also found the sentimental cap. Trio form 11 Sept 2022 to 14 Sept 2022. My deepest appreciation. Kind regards Alan :)

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We have the honour to spend a night at the amazing EQ hotel, Kuala Lumpur. The ambiance was good and the lamb from the Nipah restaurant was excellent. Credit goes the chef! On the next morning we decided to take a dip at the infinity pool level 29. All went well until I spotted a guest who smoke. I signaled the pool staff and he just nodded his head. I went up to him and asked him why he did not take action?. To my dismay he was not dare enough to approach and warn the smoker. Why was no action taken? Do smoker gets special privileg in a non smoking area?Despite my likeable towards the hotel the mood turns gloomy. Please look in to this matter.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I would fly to Kuala Lumpur for this hotel! Elegant modern designed hotel, the service and atmosphere is great! The rooftop bar, pool, gym, spa are amazing I would just wished the international breakfast options would be better as options & quality

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Positives Nice swimming pool at level 29 Central location next to cbd / many other hotels / landmarks Great breakfast with enough choices for everyone Minor Things to improve Bathroom lock was not working Washbasin water was a bit hot even with extreme cold setting Stains on furniture including table Bunch of wires coming from tv

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Excellent stay at the EQ. Location, facilities (especially the great gym/ spa and pool area where you can watch the sunset we’re excellent. I cannot express my gratitude to the wonderful concierges Tawi (who helped me get my backpack from Quatar) and Faizal for his friendly, caring persona. I would give it 4.5 stars if I could - only “negatives” were not being allowed on Sky bar without smart shoes and trousers (I had smart shorts and shoes) and service could have been better eating dinner at the downstairs buffet. All in all a wonderful hotel and good price point - thanks EQ

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We had an amazing stay at EQ hotel. we love the views and design, but most of all, we are very impressed by the impeccable service. We would like to especially thank Mr Irwan Yusuf for his excellent and high standard of professionalism as he made us feel very welcomed as loyal iprefer members. We took many photos at the infinity pool, enjoyed the well-equipped sauna and the guided workout at the gym by the personal trainer. We will definitely come back again!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Me and my family stayed at the EQ for 4 nights and were left awestruck by everything from the warm service to the beautiful, plush lobby. The rooms were amazing. They went far above expectations however, one thing I would change is having the toilet separate to the sink, shower and bath since the bathroom might be occupied when you need to use the toilet meaning you’re unable to wash your hands until the bathroom becomes vacant. The views from the room are indescribably magical, especially at night. The staff were always extremely helpful and attentive with anything. In particular, there was a lovely member of staff called Monica who complimented me and my family and called us all so pretty. We always felt the staff were friendly and welcoming. We visited the gym a few times and…

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights for business The view is amazing, I was quite impressed with quality of the staff. Food and drinks were good too. Breakfast is excellent quantity/quality. I will definitely come again.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: My 4 night stay at EQ Hotel was a luxurious, decadent break. The hotel is beautifully appointed. The swimming pool and parlour amenities are world class, and the service is second to none. A special shout out to Faizal who provided excellent service to me above and beyond what I could have expected. He is an asset to the EQ. My room was gorgeous and so comfortable. The bath was amazing and deep; the toiletries divine. It was an added bonus to have the mini bar of juices, soda and iced tea refilled daily - this was included in my package and helped keep me hydrated in the wonderful KL heat. Also I couldn't write a review without commenting on the view! Absolutely stunning views from this incredible hotel.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the EQ Hotel. The room is elegant and nicely furnished, we like the interior design, the breakfast buffet has ample choice of good quality Malaysian and continental dishes and the facilities (pool and gym) are on par with a top 5 star hotel. Special thanks to Gerard, Aslina and Naim who made our stay memorable. We will definitely come back!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Our second time visit to EQ KL, this time we are celebrating mum and #gengkakitravel Leo birthday. The check in / out was smooth and fast as the information were already in system. The disable amenities requested were already paced inside both Studio suite & Premier King Club. We are a company by Ms. Radikha & Anis to our room. The night we are celebrating birthday at Nipah, there were 16 of us that night, the foods were good but the most importance is the gathering of our travel group since MCO. The chef on the other hand pit extra miles in put his recommendation on dishes suitable for mum, she sample seabass singgang / sweet sour, stir fried stim vegetables and pumpkin masak lemak. The in room dining breakfast was great, from portion to taste all are perfect. …

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I’m a hotel connoisseur. Stayed at many5 stars hotels and here are the goods and bads. The hotel overall was nice. Staffs were nice. Room was great. VERY GOOD GYM. best hotel gym I have stayed at. So big and many free weights. (If staff could escort you to ur room, it’d be excellent). Location is perfect. You can walk to many places. the room service has a lot of room for improvement. The tea was from tea bag. The char gui tiao was over cooked. The coconut rice was mushy. I would not order room service again if I stayed again. The coffee shop downstairs has bad service. Waiters barely acknowledge you. Would I stay again? If they change the room service provider, then I’ll come back.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Not impressed. Suprised its No1 Pros: Nice pool and spa Nice gym, bar Nice room with complimentary soft drinks Cons Small restaurant serving mediocre food. Food was cold. Key to room kept not working No info given re hotel facilities and in room 2 towels and glasses given for 3 people. Had to keep callinf housekeeping Should have stayed at first choice of Shangr La

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: EQ Kuala Lumpur provides impressed service in overall. Besides strategic location, nice view from the hotel, friendly staff, very comfortable room, great restaurants, car park which provides "safe" kind of feelings to guest. Highly recommend.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We always come back to EQ hotel because the service is exceptional, great restaurants, nice staff, and comfortable rooms. Never fails to meet our expectation. Shout out to Azwan for his excellent service.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Am very impressed with the service we received from the greeters at the lobby to housekeeping.Have to specially shout out to housekeeping for superb and fast service when my kid stained the bedsheets accidentally and we asked if they could send a new bedsheet up as we spot cleaned it but it was wet. Not only were they up within 10 mins, they did a full change of bedding in 5 mins. Thank you so much! We will definitely come again.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: satisfied with overall 2 days 1-night stay. The view is amazing and really enjoyed everything. I was impressed with all the staff that I met in the hotel. They make us feel good and welcome to stay there, especially Shafika(customer service) and Anna(Managers).

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We are happy to stay in Kuala Lumpur for short trip and hotel nice and clear the staff very friendly and helping for all special had to thanks Anna Fareeda Assistant Club Manager for all the detail booking also thank you so much Naim for all helping Thank you so much

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We had a great 4 night stay at EQ. Modern and luxurious rooms with an excellent gym and swimming pool. 5* service throughout with particular mention to Razu, our housekeeper in Room 3516. Only slight negative comment I would make are regarding the rather antiquated rules regarding dress code at the rooftop bar. Only high heels alowed for women for example which I thought was slightly ridiculous!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Best lunch buffet, good location and venue for meeting with nice and big portion of tea snacks, and it is one of the few hotels in Malaysia that has go green mission - use less paper and no plastic bottles. Overall, we went there for business events, the ambience and the environment are very professional, high class and elegant.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Dear EQ General Manager, It is time for me to go back to Hong Kong after almost 3 months spent at EQ. I deeply thank to ALL your staff for the incredible kindness, high professionalism and warm care shown to me every single day of my stay. Entrance and Front Desk staff, along with Restaurants, Housekeeping, SPA/Gym ‘s teams and all the rest of the personnel have been simple amazing and very well trained!!! You ALL were able to turn my long business trip into a memorable great experience. ALL the EQ’s staff were literally able to make me feel AT HOME. I will never forget that and will always promote EQ as the best place to stay in KL among all my colleagues as well as personal network. Last but not least, the EQ’s gym is the BEST I have ever seen in a hotel. I will most…

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We stayed in their Premier king room with both KLCC and KL towers view - fantastic views to wake up to. The room was very clean, staff was very friendly as well. We were here for our anniversary and the hotel surprised us with a mini cake in the room. We were also allowed a late check-out so we were able to enjoy the next morning by the pool. We checked out the bar as well, it was a bar with quite a view but nothing too spectacular. We much enjoyed our time in the room instead :P It was a fun staycation, we would definitely return :)

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Well presented and Immaculate in every way. Everything feels luxurious and sophisticated from rooms, beds and surrounds. The location is faultless with everything from Pavillion to KLCC within minutes walk. Pool and breakfast are both excellent. The Blue rooftop bar is a must to check out (but note that dress code applies)

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: This is our 1st stayed in Premier King Infinity Room, the view was spectacular with KL tower and KLCC twin tower. They had the room decorated with ballon's, fruits and a slice of cake. The room are super comfortable and stylish. Awesome complimentary mini bars & friendly staff. We enjoy staying in this hotel & surely will come again to stay this hotel.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We, family of 5 stayed in two queen bed room for 2 nights. Pros: 1. Modern, comfy room with plenty of space for kids to roam around 2. Pool water doesnt taste like chlorinated water so thumbs up! 3. Tip top concierge especially Rusydi who goes above and beyond to arrange taxi for us 4. Complimentary mini bar 5. Super friend staff Things to improve: 1. More food selection for breakfast e.g. kuih muih Melayu 2. Plates need to be cleaned properly as some got stain My rating: Location: 5/5 Service: 5/5 Cleanliness: 4.5/5 Would I stay here again: YES

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: This is a late review but i felt i should write it regardless. My 3 nights stay in EQ on June was turmoil of emotions as i was alone managing the kids while husband was away at conference. Nevertheless the team was extremely helpful and kind and was always there looking out for us. They even let us have late check out as we had an emergency situation. Thank you so much for your hospitality and execellent service. Special thanks goes out to En Nazim and Pn Azlina Will definitely come back again. Keep up the great work!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Our experience with EQ was excellent from the very beginning till the last day of our stay. The rooms are super comfortable and stylish, we had the view to Petronas twin towers. Outstanding service, delicious breakfast! The hotel is placed at the very heart of the city, with all the people always ready to help. Absolutely recommended!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We had our family gathering here. 8 rooms (deluxe queen double) and buffet dinner & breakfast at Nipah. Excellent services, pleasant and friendly staff entertaining our large group of families. Suitable for family gathering. Big rooms and great buffet spread. We definitely had fun. Kids enjoyed their stay and pools. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Soecial thanks to Miss Radhika from reservation department and also to Miss Hamsiah from Nipah, for your kind assistance and EQ hospitality - from the concierge, reception, staff at Nipah and to all staff of EQ. Thumbs up!!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Very positively surprised by the quality of the room. Large, confortable with a superb view on KL tower. Big shower, great mattress, nicely decorated on a modern and cozy style. For once in a hotel room lights were easy to operate and all curtains are also automatic which is great. Complementary mini bar with quality coffee machine. I used also the fitness center which is top notch. The desk and desk chair are super confortable for business purpose related work with good quality internet. Didn’t had breakfast or dinner but had a drink at the rooftop bar with a stunning view. Location is also premium. Will stay her again for sure.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We stayed at EQ hotel for two nights, our room was premier king infinity. first, the room: It has the best view for me in Kuala Lumpur. I stayed in about 3 hotels around the same area that defines as 5 stars hotel without mention names, but to me: EQ hotel (premier king infinity room) has the best view, because from the room I can see the twin towers and kuala lumpur tower as well, and all the wall are glass even in the bathroom. Second, the hospitality: I am speechless about the hospitality because I can’t find a word to describe how they were. They will make you feel that you are the only guest in the hotel. From my experience, you may find in each hotel in Kuala Lumpur same view and you will like one more than the other, but there isn’t the same level of the hospitality as…

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I decided to try out the spa service at EQ hotel where i took the facial + full body massage. Suffice to say, it was a deeply relaxing and wholesome experience. The service was top notch with a beautiful ambience and the masseuse was skillful. Then, I enjoyed a sauna session and a tropical shower experience, which is unique to EQ. Their service is top notch and I really felt pampered the whole time there.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights at EQ KL and I must say that we chose the perfect hotel in the area! The hotel is nice and clean with beautiful exterior and interior design. The staff was very attentive and took care of my needs since day 1. Special mention to Aslina, Rushydi, Adree, Haziq and the staff who was on duty at the entrance of the hotel (not the valet) on Thursday night - 16 July I did not catch his name. The view from the room was fantastic too! I will definitely come back and stay with EQ again if I am visiting the area. - Room 4519 (15/6-18/6)

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Classy luxury hotel. Attentive staff and clean, luxurious room with great view. Nice breakfast area with good range of food. Guests need to wear (one hand) disposable gloves when taking from the buffet area (good hygiene practice). Clean room and multi item toiletries. Good tv connections with free movies. Nice luxurious dining area.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: This is an amazing hotel, in the centre of KL. We stayed in one of the Corner Premium rooms which had amazing views over the KL skyline including from the bathtub! Staff were unfailingly kind and professional. I had one issue regarding an issue with an extra bed we required for our room but it was quickly resolved and the manager went to huge lengths to apologise. Breakfast buffet was very good and I must mention the staff there who not only quickly learned our names but also which drink we preferred to have at breakfast. This is quite a feat given the large numbers of guests passing through the hotel. The hotel is very close to a monorail station and only a few minutes walk from KLCC and The Pavilion. I would absolutely recommend EQ for anyone wanting to stay in KL.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We spent a night there on our last day in Malaysia and it ended our trip perfectly! Upon arriving, staff were friendly and attentive. Check in was smooth and was served with a cold tea and towel. We booked a King Infinity room which had amazing views of the KL tower however had an onstructed view of the Petronas Twin Towers however was still a marvel to have in your view when lying in bed. Location of the hotel was close to Bukit Bintang (nightlife) but also shopping centres! A little disappointed that breakfast wasn’t included with the stay however still an amazing stay!! Would recommend for people who likes a classy place that is far enough from the hustle and bustle however is within walking distance of main amenities

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Stayed in the hotel at end May 2022. The hotel is new with spacious and modern designed room, good quality interior finishing. It provide the best quality toiletries among all 5-star hotels that I have stayed. Good and proactive services from all staff. While having breakfast, as I was busy eating for quite a while, the restaurant staff proactively asked if my coffee had turned cold and if i want to replace with a new cup of hot coffee. Definitely an excellent hotel for travel to KL. However, the hotel is quite a long walking distance from KLCC and Bukit Bintang.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Have enjoyed a very nice stay at EQ! The moment I arrived, I have received the warm welcoming from every EQ staffs! And I met Aslina at Front Desk, she has explained everything to me in details, from breakfast to swimming pool, all are clearly explained. And thanks for the welcome drink, I like it! Room is spacious and with Twin Tower view. Shower and bathtub are both available. Complimentary mini bar, coffee machine, you can find everything you need in your room. Wifi is stable, I have video conference with my colleagues and the connection is good. And the infinity swimming pool is super good! Large enough, and the view is perfect (can see the KL Tower). Lastly, Blue on 51/F is a MUST visit! Night view is superb. Can see the Twin Tower. Vibe is good too, relax and chill.…

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Everything was good about this hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the food was amazing and the staff were very courteous and accommodating. Front desk Aslina and Asni were very helpful and pleasant to speak with! Oh ya, the infinity pool was incredible. Definitely coming back to EQ KL. Highly recommended!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights for both business and leisure. Our 39th floor room couldn't be any better. View was just spectacular and then we went up to the Blue51 sky bar and that was even more awesome. KL is a beautiful and unique city with skyscrappers surrounded by the mountains in the background. Love the auto black out curtain blinds and all the amenities that comes along with the room. Staff were very helpful, friendly, service minded and they make an effort to remember your name too. Food and drinks were equally good. Everyone from the door man to the room attendant made our stay really relaxing and enjoyable. We will have to go back and try the pool which we didn't manage to.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: This is the definition of perfection! The staff is so genuine and friendly, the hotel and the rooms are modern and very nice looking, the facilities are great and the view from the rooms are stunning. This is by far the best hotel that I have ever visited and is well worth the money! If you want to stay at the best hotel in KL, this is the one to go for!!!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We very much enjoyed our stay in EQ, each staff that we met was very polite and eager to help. The faculties were tip top. We will definitely come back for future visits. I highly recommend this hotel

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Our room at Hotel EQ was impressive and comfortable. The view was amazing from the 43rd floor! The facilities (swimming pool, gym) are well equipped, clean and quiet. We also paid for a massage at the spa - at the end we declared it one of the best massages we'd ever experienced. Service was fantastic as well. Would definitely stay here again!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We stayed at the EQ on our first international holiday from Australia since boarder closures and COVID. We were absolutely blown away by the hotel from the second we stepped through the door. The staff display exemplary professionalism, service, and support. The gym, pool, rooms, views, and location are all perfect at the EQ. It is situated within walking distance to the pavilion shopping centre, petronas towers, the tram station, and good food spots. We will certainly choose the EQ for our next stay in KL as we were beyond happy with our stay.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Recently stayed in KL for a short holiday with the family and was really impressed with the service that was rendered by Ms Radhika and team at EQ KL. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were super comfortable. Linen and bath towels all fresh and nice. There was a good selection of in room movies on-demand to choose from. That kept the children busy too apart from the fast and secure WiFi connection that was available to the guests We ordered in room dining and we must say that the prices of the food is competitive so it is definitely worth a try. The food came within 30 minutes of making an order and mind you it was usually a large order for my family that had 8 hungry hippos. Servings were large and the dishes were all yummy. We returned empty plates only. The pool…

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: 16th years ago, we choose this hotel as the bride's 'home' for the sending off for the wedding reception. This hotel got even bigger and better on their facilities. Great pool, view and sky bar too. The children loved every minute spent here ! Amazing hospitality!! Surely will come again !!

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Besides the beautiful gym, sauna, and pool, what made my experience at EQ Hotel stand out was the wonderful service from the staff. Special thanks to Chef Ali for his hospitality and Kiki for showing me around at Sky51.

address: Equatorial Plaza Jalan Sultan Ismail, Kuala Lumpur 50250 Malaysia
name: EQ Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel few times and it always makes me kept coming back. The warm welcome and service by the staff especially Ms Aslina makes me feel welcome. Every time I visited EQ she will always greet me with her warm smile. I love how spacious and clean the room and how EQ team will decorate my room to make my stay unforgettable.
