reviews.text: I read the reviews for this hotel only days out from visiting and started worrying as there were so many negative reviews. Well I'm glad that I didn't cancel and rebook someplace else as this hotel was absolutely lovely. Yes the rooms are small but they are nowhere near as tiny as some have implied. The breakfast is basic but it does the job just fine. The location is amazing and the rooftop bar was a chill place to hang out I'd definitely stay here again

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I was looking for a centrally located hotel and Tripadvisor nailed it! I hadn't heard about Sanctuary before and I will definitely be a return visitor. Friendly staff, lovely rooms, fun roof-top restaurant. I was in town during Climate Week and it was the perfect location - out of the fray but walkable to all events. Definitely recommend this!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Location 10/10, Staff 10/10, Room 10/10, Facilities 10/10. Rather than tell you about it, go and experience it yourself, it won’t disappoint. Thankyou to all the Staff at The Sanctuary Hotel. Wish we could of stayed longer, Thankyou again to all the Staff

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: rooms ok, bed good, no coffee/tea in room. Few mins from Time Square, loads of good bars n food place on door step. If your going download the Sightseeing App on ya phone saves you loads. Hot dogs, and huge flats, as the wife called them.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Great little hotel in a good location with a breakfast buffet included, comfy clean rooms. Reception, bellboys, maid service were all excellent. If you are looking for a good hotel in a central location then I’d recommend this hotel. Added bonus of two restaurants including a rooftop one.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Recently stayed in the Sanctuary for 5 nights. The location of the hotel is perfect, a lot of the main attractions are easy to reach from here. From check in to check out, all members of staff we encountered were more than helpful. Corridors were very dark which we found a bit unusual. There was a continental breakfast provided each morning (bagels, pastries, yogurts, cold boiled eggs, Avocado, fruit) tea and coffee. Tea and Coffee was available all day also although we did find the water was somewhat lukewarm in the evening time. The Haven Rooftop - I’d HIGHLY recommend you prebook this prior to your arrival at the hotel if you know you’d like to dine there a night. We initially booked for the evening of our arrival however as they had a private booking, they asked if i would…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We had booked the Sanctuary Hotel for our second visit to New York as the Roosevelt where we stayed previously had closed. Personally, I felt that its standards would be difficult to match. How wrong I was, they were exceeded! The Sanctuary is excellent, with efficient and very polite staff in all areas, nothing was too much trouble. The complimentary breakfast was very good with a variety of options, and coffee was available at all times. We had dinner, one evening, in the rooftop Haven restaurant and it didn’t disappoint. The lobster roll is superb! If we return to New York for a third time, I’ll definitely be staying here again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sanctuary with my daughter for her 16th birthday weekend. We both had a great experience and would definitely recommend the hotel. Although just a couple minutes from the busy Times Square district the hotel was a true Sanctuary. Only 9 floors and almost hidden from sight, you are greeted by a friendly doorman and walk through an amazing front door. The staff was all welcoming. I had sent a message to the hotel prior to arrival about it being my daughter's birthday and Allie arranged for chocolate cake to be sent up to our room. The rooms are small, but the high ceiling in our room made it feel larger. The shower was great. I am not sure if our room was typical, but we did not have much of a view from our window...one downside of a smaller hotel surrounded by…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We went in September 22 for a 50 birthday. We picked as a boutique hotel and by uk standard it isn’t. Like many other reviews the rooms are small and look tired and worn out (e.g. bed corners damaged) but are clean There is no kettle in the room. Yes you can get tea/coffee in the foyer and we used everyday but the water was lukewarm and been there a long time over the day For the $25 daily room tax you do get breakfast but you eat on plastic plates with plastic cutlery and paper cups Like many others advise the roof top is hard to get a seat in. We went twice and the staff were quite rude so we left. One thing that isn’t good is that the roof top bar is open to the public and at most times there are many people in the lobby queuing waiting for the lift. That does not give…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Checking in was a fiasco taking an inordinate amount of time and multiple staff looking and poking at their screens resulting in my having to put two holding deposits down on my card as their system failed to recognise the first one and the staff insisting I put through another one despite my showing them one had already gone through in my bank account. Now waiting for a refund/ release. The hotel decor is very dark, macabre and basic. Everything is tired, worn with wall paper peeling off the walls, scratched doors. Chipped tiles in the shower cubicles, cracked sinks, missing fixings, stick on hooks, seats with missing buttons which injure you if you sat on them. The lifts are archaic like something from the Adams family and at times I was seriously concerned they would…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Pictures are very misleading - the hotel is actually dirty and not well maintained. Rooms are minuscule depressing boxes. While centrally located for tourists looking to stay in Times Square, there are FAR better options in other parts of the city for less. Would never ever stay here again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed at Sanctuary for my daughters 30th. Great location right on Times Square. Staff very helpful and friendly , would defo recommend Vincent, William and Miguel Thank you great customer service !!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I've stayed in many NYC hotels over the last 30 years. For me and my husband this was excellent because our room was sooooooo quiet and they have the proper shades and window coverings so that you can blackout all light. We could not have cared less that the room was small, they make excellent use of a small space....we're only there to basically sleep and be in a great location to all the museums, shows, etc. The staff was great, the place was totally clean. Will definitely return.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Do not believe the reviews for this hotel. Rooms are dreadful, very very small, not clean and everything is so dark. (I am pretty sure dark to hide the mess). As residents can’t even use the hotel bar as they rent it out for private functions. I was sent to the bar 4 doors down. Staff were not organised. One blamed the other but there was zero care for residents. No water to drink in the room and NO place to even buy a bottle. (Remember bar shut to residents and no room service). Honestly - worst hotel I have ever stayed in in NYC and will never be back. Finally - iron is so dirty it marked my shirt - that’s basics that need sorting. Told the concierge and reaction was non-plus. Have to wait on housekeeping coming in to sort! Dreadful dreadful - avoid.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel was great! MUCH more than I expected for around $200/night. Hotel staff was beyond friendly and helpful. The room was tastefully decorated and very clean (some furnishings a bit worn, but in a way that just indicates that this is a well-used hotel.) The bed was extremely comfortable. Continental breakfast was good (pastries, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt). Literally steps from Times Square, and about a block from the two shows we saw as well as Rockefeller Plaza. Subway access a couple of blocks away. Would ABSOLUTELY stay here again!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I originally booked the Redbury Hotel for my partners 30rh birthday but due to covid and staffing they rearranged our booking to the sanctuary. We arrived New years eve and enjoyed 4 nights in this beautiful hotel. Location is fab! I was pregnant at the time so made use of the tubes at the end of our road. The hotel is right in the middle of times square which was perfect for bringing in the new year amd your just a short walk to the main attractions top of the rock and central park. We visited a show whilst there and again was in walking distance from the hotel so perfect location. I didn't pay for breakfast but I mentioned at check in we were here for a 30th and they upgraded our room and gave us complimentary breakfast. The rooms are so comfy and modern with a…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We decided to take a quick getaway to NYC and see a taping of a show at the Fox news building. I found the Sanctuary was close, reasonable & had a rooftop restaurant/bar. So, I booked for 2 nights. Honestly, I couldn't of asked for a better location. Half a block from the center of Times Square, the show at Fox was literally, directly across the street and great restaurants all around. The room was small, but it is NYC. It was modern, quiet & clean. The only complaint would be the door to the toilet weighed a ton and was so difficult to close, we opted to just use the curtain for the entire bathroom area, not a game changer by any means. Continental breakfast was included & was what you would normally expect. Coffee was very good, think it was Starbucks. My biggest…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Great property perfect location highly recommend! Close to all major attractions in NYC…. Great staff at property. I will stay again for a pleasure trip. Half block from Broadway 1/2 price TKTS!!! Walking distance to great restaurants and theater.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We are at this hotel just now, we felt compelled to write this review as soon as possible, from the minute we arrived the friendly door men Doug (the taxi man) and Rashid made us feel so welcome, the hotel is a super chic boutique hotel with an excellent rooftop bar, with restaurants and the amazing Haven. I am a travel agent in the UK and I will be recommending this hotel to all my clients, rooms are spotlessly clean, modern. Doug and Rashid who both work long hours always make time to chat and advise all visitors, they are very much an asset to the image of the Hotel. Looking forward to visiting again hopefully soon, thank you to all staff

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: stayed here for a week 9th may , loved everything about hotel and staff . So friendly and helpful , ideal location for exploring New York as it's just off timesquare . The rooms have large comfy beds and free toiletries , free grab and go breakfast set us up for the day , bagels , cereals , boiled eggs , pastries , all nice and fresh . Would deffinetley stay here again (when my husband lets me book again with my mate lol) love love love love it thankyou xxx

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I had a 2-night stay at the hotel, and our check-in process was the worst that I have ever experienced at any hotel. Terrible, slow and rude customer service at the front desk. One desk person made a snide comment about my appearance, and when I politely asked if our room was available after waiting 30 minutes for it in the lobby (at the normal check in time), another front desk person told me that their policy is that the room is available anytime after 3PM, not AT 3PM, which makes no sense at all. The lobby was full of people waiting for their rooms, which took much longer than we had planned or expected. The manager was right next to the front desk person as he made me feel like I was asking for something wayyyy over the top to have a room ready that I reserved, at the…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel was great, room while not large was extremely well done. The people were great very helpful and extremely welcoming. The only downside to our trip was that the A/C did not work. There is a great roof top bar and separate sushi restaurant.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: My stay at Sanctuary was terrific! Location is outstanding. Service is very good. William was consistently helpful and looking to assist. Yes, the rooms are fairly small. But if you do your research, you know that going in. And the price was quite competitive for a nice hotel in this location.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed June 7-10. The only reason I gave an average rating is the doormen were very friendly and helpful. The room is very small and the windows let no natural light in but that is not why I rate it low. They advertise stocked mini bar in the room. They don't have that however having an empty mini fridge is nice because you have to walk the CVS or Walgreens to purchase anything you might want to drink even water. In the reception area they do have small plastic cups in which you can get a little drink of water. We could not go to the rooftop restaurants because they were booked our entire stay. They cater to non guests. If you arrive back to the hotel as the non guests are waiting to go upstairs you will have to wait behind them to get the elevator. We were told we could go…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and very clean. We appreciated the complimentary upgrade we got and really loved the room we stayed in. The location is perfect - just a few steps away from Times Square, and the staff is friendly and helpful. We will be back!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: What a fantastic hotel!! Excellent location with easy access to all amenities. We stayed for 5 nights and found the room very comfortable, fantastic shower, wonderful bed and cleaned daily to a high standard. Made full use of the breakfast which had fantastic choices of bagels pastries cereals juice and hot drinks. Special mention to the guys on the door who were very helpful and friendly every time we popped in and out during our stay. Thanks for making the trip so special.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: What a great hotel, the staff were magnificent nothing was a problem and they were all so courteous. The hotel is a minute walk from Time Square, 15 minutes to central Park and 15 minutes to Madison Square garden. There is a subway at the end of the street too. The room was great, although the AC was very noisy and as we stayed during the hottest Temp recorded in May it was a problem as couldn't sleep, we did report the issue and maintenance attempted to fix the problem, but it didn't really solve the issue maybe slightly queiter so we just lived with it. Some of the woodwork and a couple of the blinds were showing signs of age bit that's all. Breakfast was complementary, croissant, bagles, cereals, yogurts. Just right to start the day off. There was always coffee and water…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I loved the modern decor. The bed was comfortable, and the glass walk-in shower was part of the room, which might not appeal to everyone but definitely did to me. The room was quite spacious, especially by New York standards. The rooftop dining/bar was delightful.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel was lovely, I have read some comments about not much view from the room, you are in the middle of a busy city...we never expected any kind of view from the room and were hardly in our room anyway. We booked room only, and did not expect any breakfast at all, so it was a nice surprise to get free breakfast, it did not matter that the plates and cutlery were plastic, it was free !! So we were happy enough with that. The staff were lovely. There are construction works outside, which were a little noisy at times...but it did not bother us really, it is not the hotel's fault. We never ate in the rooftop Haven restaurant, the food and drink seemed a bit pricey, so we ate elsewhere at various places. The Longacres bar a few doors away served lovely food and various…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The picture of the lovely neoclassical facade is quite misleading. Small, dark lobby, winding dark hallway to get to our elevator. King room was too small for two persons and view from window was a concrete wall about 30 inches away. Continental breakfast was mostly prepackaged food with styrofoam plates and plastic utensils. Tidy and clean overall. The earnest and friendly staff was another saving grace. Overall, I’ve been in nicer suburban budget hotels. Certainly not a “luxury “ property.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: First, the hotel is in an excellent and convenient location in the city. Second, All of the hotel staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Next, the room was nice and quiet. Lastly, we ate dinner on the rooftop and the service and food were very good. The only recommendation I have is that when it comes time to change the color scheme in the hotel, I would recommend going with lighter, softer colors. But again, we were very pleased with our stay and recommend it to all readers making a trip to NYC.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from 7th-14th May, I would highly recommend this hotel, midtown Manhattan. Close to Times Square. The Hotel it’s self was beautiful, the room it’s self was great, shower was just perfect after a day out in New York, Had great Blackout blinds… which is a must in a city that never sleeps. The staff themselves were so genuine and friendly and made us feel really welcome everytime we stepped through the door. The breakfast included was a plus.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I was extremely impressed by the beautiful interiors and the styling of the rooms. I cannot emphasise enough how comfortable the rooms are and partially due to the way they are styled with fabrics and colour schemes that make you feel like you are home away from home. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the sushi restaurant is to die for.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Great location if you want to be near Times Square. Fixtures and fittings are tires and dated. The bed was really comfortable if not I feel we would have been looking to find another hotel. Our room was more like a modular room as there was only a curtain separating the bedroom from the shower/sink area. Not much chance of someone sleeping while you had a shower. First impressions were great as you were welcomed by door staff before you walked into the dim lit interior. More of a outdated look rather then boutique look.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Considering Times Square is very busy (especially now as the covid restrictions are being lifted) this is a perfect choice to be in the middle of everything yet have a peaceful and relaxing stay. The hotel has been renovated and up-to-date, the staff is one of the friendliest I've seen in a long time and the location is impeccable. The room is tiny, as they all tend to be in NYC, but its design is optimal with pretty much everything you need for a comfortable stay. The only tiny thing I'd suggest would be is a coffee maker.:) They serve complimentary coffee in the lobby so that makes it up. The breakfast is included, which includes hot and cold drinks, pastries and eggs. Enough to start your day and spare some space for a delicious lunch somewhere else... Also their rooftop…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Excellent stay , room and brekfest included, but the Best thing Ever: today the City was blocked because of the Marathon and the Hotel Staff ( two people at least ) helped us to find our way to the taxi impossible to approach .. gave us all constructive informations .. where to go .. carried our luggage trough New York .. and found a way to get us a nice cab .. so We ´ ve made it and got on time to our expensive train with non-refundable tickets ! The Perfect Staff is what makes a Perfect Hotel when one finds himself in trouble !

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Sanctuary Hotel and as previous reviews stated, staff was great, very friendly. The location is near Times Square and close proximity to restaurants and shopping. The suite room is fantastic. I would stay here again and would recommend to anyone looking in the area.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We paid for an upgraded room and it is spacious, clean and comfortable. Bed is huge and sheets are soft! However, it is very noisy at night and early in the morning with traffic and building works next door. We are disappointed there are no tea/coffee facilities in our room and have to go to the Lobby for refreshments. Breakfast is pleasant. Calm and adequate. Enough of what we want and good selection. This is a special 60th birthday treat so money we'll spent!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Sanctuary Hotel. Staff were absolutely incredible… helpful, friendly, accommodating ! They went above and beyond to ensure our stay was perfect. The location is optimal - right by time square and in close proximity to basically everything. The only criticism would be the breakfast; it was a bit basic and choices were limited however we think this was due to covid and minimising infection risk? It would have also been nice to have a tea and coffee station in the room. Besides this, we will definitely be back to stay again and recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New York

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Perfect location, staff exceptionally customer minded, nice room, clean well maintained room. quite atmosphere after a busy day in NY, water coffee and thee available at the reception, wonderful rooftop bar !!!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sanctuary in April 2022. We booked two king sized rooms with the City view. We loved it! It is interesting and quirky but really clean and very safe. The Long Acre Tavern next door was a great place to eat (we ate there three times) after a long day of exploring. The staff are really friendly and were always helpful to this stereotypical suburban family of four. We would stay there again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We had a four night stay at this hotel for our visit to NYC. Great location near Times Square if you are going to see Broadway Plays and shows which we did for all four nights. Staff was very kind and pleasant. Breakfast coffee and muffins were very good. Our room in the East wing was small with a very nice size bathroom with a great shower. Our view was a brick wall and fire escape. The CONS Hot water took about 5 minutes to get hot wasting gallons of water. Sushi Restaurant door kept on slamming shut and people talking very loudly outside made this room very unpleasant at times Lots of construction two doors down will happen for a long time. They are closing the street on 4/11 for large cranes. Next visit in NYC would find me in a hotel on the upper west side. Times Square…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Booked this last minute for 3 night stay with friend. Rooms spacious for New York & bathroom had the best shower. Free coffee at reception all day & a basic continental breakfast included. I would definitely stay her again, good location, clean rooms and helpful staff.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: 5 night stop to visit NYC. The hotel is in a very good location for Times Square. Reception door staff very friendly, room ok clean & tidy. Breakfast not, dont understand why hotels are not doing full breakfast instead of box! Staff not interested, not a warm.and friendly experience when you can go out and have a breakfast with full selection include plates and cutlery! What was a disappointment was simply lack of bar facilities. Bar restaurant at top hotel seemed nice but as guests of hotel you have to book in competition with casual visitor's. What was poor is no bar for guest, if you did use bar at 22:15 last orders bar closed 22:30 in the city that never sleeps. Might give hotel a break on breakfast if it is purely down to Covid and government rules but lack ob interest…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Planning a special retreat for a mother and daughter worked beautifully thanks to the staff at the Sanctuary hotel NYC. Nothing was left to chance and Jimmy (general manger) was an absolute pleasure to work with. They were given the VIP treatment and the location was perfect for a visit to CBS studios.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The staff are amazing and very attentive, the hotel has very nice decor and clean rooms, conveniently situation for most attractions. Dont pay resort fees elsewhere when you can stay in this hidden gem.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We've just arrived back after a 4 day stay at this hotel. It's just off Time Square, so quite central. On arrival staff were friendly and helpful. Lifts to all floors Room was clean with plenty of towels. Room was OK size for us for such a short visit. We were hardly in our room. Which were changed every day and shower gels, shampoos and conditioner. Breakfast was a box of goodies, as much tea, coffee or juice as you like. With being off time square you would think with a city that doesn't sleep you would get alot of noise. Not really didn't hear much the odd siren going past but that was it. In all nice place to stay, would we stay there again yes we would. Many thanks.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Sanctuary Hotel is in a great location, has a great staff and comfortable clean rooms. Just one block from Time Square with a roof top sushi restaurant with unique rolls this is a great boutique hotel for business, Vaca, or theater district experience. I hope this hotel never changes because I plan on returning.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We have just arrived home this week from a 4 night stay at the Sanctuary Hotel. I can honestly say that this was hands down the best hotel experience I have had compared to other trips to NYC. From start to finish the staff were friendly & helpful. We had 2 rooms booked, a double for 2 adults and a ‘double, double’ for 1adult & 2 x 14 year olds. The room for 2 adults was small, granted! But it had everything you need for a stay in Ny. Our family room was a great size with 2 big comfortable beds. Separate bathroom with double sink and double walk-in shower. We didn’t have a great view really but at night there was no traffic noise at all which was fantastic! Room had air con/heating and we had good nights sleep each night. We had continental breakfast included every morning with…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Rooms exactly as photo depicted. Room and hotel very clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat. Multiple subway lines easy to access. Others complained about construction noise but when the windows were closed you couldn't hear anything. Box breakfasts and coffee and tea available in lobby but you do have a fridge in your room. Really can't say enough good things. We will be back.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel based on reviews, and will never stay here again. Two of the main purposes of a hotel are a nice bed to sleep in and a place to shower and get cleaned up. The second morning of our trip, the whole hotel had no hot water. My husband and I took freezing cold showers. The front desk was unapologetic when we let them know, and even seemed annoyed at us. The front desk and concierge employees were all apathetic, honestly, about everything- even just casual pleasant conversation. The only highlights of this hotel were the friendly doormen and the lovely waitress at the rooftop bar. Also note there is construction happening outside this building. You may find yourself in a room overlooking scaffolding strewn with empty soda bottles and other…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The Sanctuary is perfectly located near all the Broadway theaters. My room was clean, comfortable, and stylish - even came with a complimentary continental breakfast! Every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful. I look forward to returning here on future NYC visits. Note: when I returned home, I realized I left some belongings in my room. The hotel staff graciously recovered them for me and shipped them to me. Terrific service!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I am blown away by the top-notch service we recieved at this hotel, best I've ever been treated by any hotel staff. They went above & beyond to help us regardless the question, big or small. Our flight was cancelled the day we checked out, we returned within an hour & they just smoothly checked us back into our rooms for 2 more days. Fantastic front desk staff. The hotel is really uniquely decorated, it has a somewhat elegant, Gothic feel to it, with dim lighting in the halls and lobby. I LOVED IT. The room we got was the larger deluxe King & the size was perfect for a 4 day stay. Great shower set-up, comfy bed, great mini fridge, nice & quiet room. Maybe a little more storage for clothes but that's miniscule. Superb location practically right in Times Square, close to…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We just wrapped up our 2 night stay at the Sanctuary Hotel. There are pros and cons to this hotel leading me to give it 3 stars, and although our stay was fine, with so many options I would choose a different hotel for our next visit. Pros: - good value - comfortable bed - nice staff - great location - restaurant - atmosphere Cons: - It was myself and 2 teen boys and the room was small (even for NY) and the bathroom even smaller - room itself seemed clean but stains on curtains and wall - included breakfast was grab and go and left a lot to be desired - lobby was well appointed esthetically, but lacked snacks, waters, etc

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I honestly do not understand the negative reviews about The Sanctuary. This is our 7th night here and we are beyond happy. Are the rooms small? Yes, but we got a king deluxe to add a bit more square footage, and also, you’re right smack dab in Times Square, so you’ll be out and about most of the time you’re not sleeping. Plus, the beds here are among the most comfortable I’ve ever slept in away from home. The shower is fabulous. Though the hotel is close to a lot of action, it’s quiet, aside from the occasional street noise, which you’ll encounter throughout the city. The Haven Rooftop restaurant and bar is fabulous. We were here visiting friends from Philadelphia and all of us were exceedingly pleased with this clean, friendly, well-appointed hotel. Oh, and the staff members…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Chose this based on reviews…the rooms are TINY- probably the smallest I’ve ever stayed in while in NYC- but that was fine since we were never in the room. The bed is comfortable and the room ample enough for a couple or single. There is no water in the room (even for purchase) and no water offered anywhere in the hotel- that was annoying. The staff is nice and the lobby cozy with a fireplace. Centrally located to subway and Times Square- east to get around and walk uptown or downtown.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel has a nice intimate vibe to it and has perfect location, within meters you are in Times Square and it's great for walking everywhere - from hotel 20mins and you're in Madison Square Garden or from hotel 20mins in opposite direction you're in Central Park. We booked a standard room and have to admit, the room was on a small side. After NYC we were travelling to Canada to go skiing so we had a lot of luggage and it was tight. However I think they have bigger room options available for additional fee. Additionally there were no doors to the bathroom or wardrobe (they use curtains instead - my only wonder is how often they change/wash them), however rest assured, the WC has a sliding door! Whilst I didn't expect amazing views, one of our windows was overlooking cement…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We loved the sanctuary! This boutique hotel has such a cool vibe and felt very intimate and private. Douglas at the door was amazing! Even brought us coffee in the morning! I understand that they recently finished some construction- and from what I could see they did an amazing job. Our king junior suite was gorgeous, spacious, and very clean! Great getaway for the weekend!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This was a very pleasant surprise. I booked this hotel last minute and was blown away. It was very clean and the staff was amazing. I needed to upgrade to a double and it was not a problem. The room wasn’t ready but we had to go see a show. The staff moved us. It was an amazing experience. This hotel is close to everything. Times Square is at the end of the block. Walk to all you broadway shows. This will b my go to NYC stay.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Myself and My husband stayed here from 28th December till 7 th January, I loved every minute , room was lovely bed was so comfy. Pete from reception was super all reception staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel is just off times square in a great location we couldn't of stayed in a better place. I would definitely recommend staying here and who knows we will be here again. Thank you for making us welcome xx

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in a two double bedded room. Here's the brief from our experience, I hope it helps you x ROOM Small but fairly comfortable. The beds are soft though. We faced the street and by 6am it was incredibly noisy with construction and many sirens. The rain shower was amazing however the bathroom is teeny. As in teeny. BREAKFAST Due to covid, breakfast is a box bought up to your room. We were a family of four and one child has severe allergies so Keith said he would enquire if we could have toast for our child instead of the pastry with nuts. Well we waited over our allocated breakfast time and didn't receive anything. We called and ten minutes later there was a knock and we found a bag had been left for us with only two breakfast boxes. And both boxes…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I had a nice stay at Sanctuary Hotel New York. The location was perfect for Broadway shows, as well as visiting Rockefeller Center. It's surprisingly quiet considering how close to all the action it is - I had no issues getting a full night of sleep each night. My queen room was, to be expected in NYC, tiny - but well furnished and cozy. There is a safe in the room. The full length mirror was hidden on the sliding door to the toilet. I made a reservation at Haven Rooftop 2 months in advance of my stay and was cancelled the week before check-in due to a private party. This was pretty frustrating considering how difficult it is to get last minute dinner reservations in NYC during the holiday season. I did get to check out Sushi by Bou, which was terrific. They feature a…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: On our annual holiday New York City trip my wife and I stayed at the Sanctuary Hotel for two nights. The Sanctuary is a boutique hotel with a rooftop bar and a sushi restaurant. It is conveniently located on West 47th street just steps from Times Square. We chose a king room that was very comfortable. The modern facilities include a large flat screen tv, wifi, a glass enclosed shower with a rain shower head and a hand held shower. A continental breakfast is also include. The hotel has an arrangement with a garage one block away for 50% off their regular rates. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The Sanctuary is a very good choice tor a NYC stay.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Excellent location. Check in was slow - front desk woman clearly not excited to be there. Lobby area is small and because there were a lot of people around it was hard to hear what the receptionist was saying. Free coffee, tea and water in reception area. Room was tiny, open the door and you fall onto the bed. Shower and sink in the room - if you’re traveling with someone you have no intimacy with , you’ll become intimate whether you want it or not!! Shower was very good though. Toiletries ok, nice towel. Toilet was very, very tiny and toilet paper was like sand paper. Small hole in the wall to hang clothes. Safe available. Tiny desk. Bed was comfortable. Nice size HD TV. Room was quiet overall. Douglas, the bell boy, was very helpful when I need to solve an issue. They charge…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Well from the min we arrived on the eve of thanksgiving from Uk 🇬🇧 we were welcomed and couldn’t of asked for more . We had checked into another hotel earlier but wasn’t happy with the rooms so decided to move to sanctuary. Rooms are clean tidy , bed comfortable, fridge , tv , shower was good , small but plenty space for 2 adults . Breakfast was brought every morning but we decided not to take after 2nd day as we wanted to experience American dinners . Bar was closed unfortunately and reservations for the rooftop but a nice few words with the reception and we went for a few drinks . Location is right on Times Square , out door turn left and your there right on it . There is currently some building work going in the street with 2 hotels been built but wasn’t a problem . …

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: To be clear, there is no access to any gym contrary to what it says. There is no breakfast other than what you see in the attached photo. The work table in the room is unusable as the seat is simply too low. The place is grubby and not clean. There is really nothing open in the place. The shower is in the room. The toilet is tiny. I was checked in for 12 nights and left after 1.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: When traveling alone gets scary 🤦🏽😳. I stayed at The Sanctuary my first night in Manhattan. Perfect location. 2 blocks from Times Square and 3 from Broadway. I had a ticket to see Thoughts of a Colored Man ( highly recommended but the theatre seats are tiny). Left my bags there as I arrived before check in. Left and came back. The bellboy escorted me to my room. He asked if I had family there and if I visiting alone. I lied and said I was waiting for my husband. He was getting in late because of a delayed flight. I played with my decoy ring as we talked. I go in the room and put my lock on the door. First strange thing happens, call from the front desk saying they had a system glitch and needed to confirm who was in each room. They asked for my full name. I refused to provide…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I was disappointed at this place to be honest . We paid little over $300 for one night and for the price the service was horrible . 1- they told us once we got here that the parking garage was closed and I have to go around and find another parking . In time square it took me 40 min to find another parking lot that I could leave the car over night. 2- we wanted to go to hotel restaurant and they told us they are closed to guest because of a company party 3- we asked for water they said they don’t have water and if we want water we should go outside and buy water from a food truck. With the price they are charging I would go to another hotel .

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sanctuary hotel this past weekend with my mother because we were finally seeing Hamilton: The Musical and we were very happy about it! I booked this hotel because the location was excellent! It was close to the theater district and Times Square. The reviews were good. Also I was interested in going to their rooftop restaurant. I checked in Friday, around 10 am. Upon coming in, I was told they had no rooms ready but to check around 1 pm. After waiting for about two hours, around noon, I asked at front desk if they had any rooms ready and the man there gave me the good news that there actually was a room available on the 6th floor. The room had a decent view since it’s higher up. You can see the church next door and some of the street below. The room was…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Cons: - Very noisy hall. There's a supply closet that was always being opened/closed and it made a lot of noise. - One elevator. - There were flies in the rooms (at least in the two rooms I stayed at). - A dirty curtain is the "door" to the bathroom area. - The bathroom area is rather small and not very comfortable. - The "free, delivered to your room" breakfast to-go arrived only once during my 4 nights stay. Also, asked for gluten free due to health requirements, received a lot of gluten. - On the 3rd day most of the towels were taken away by the house keeping, was left with only 1 large and 1 hand towel. - If you want a quiet room, you'll get one with a view to a building wall (which also means, a very dark room). Pros: - Good lighting inside the room (to make up for not…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: As I write this review, I am currently laying in the most comfortable bed in the world located in the Sanctuary hotel NYC. Even before we entered the main entrance to the hotel, the gentleman at the front door helped us carry our heavy suitcases up the front stairs. The check in process was super quick and easy. Our room is lovely, clean, comfortable, and safe. The rain shower is incredible !!!!!! The staff is available, helpful, kind, and attentive. Although we only checked in a few hours ago, our stay here has been wonderful and such a pleasant experience. I will definitely be staying here again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I randomly came across this cute boutique hotel and I’m so happy I did! The location is so central, rooms are updated clean and stylish. The staff is absolutely wonderful. I had trouble with my flight and they did everything they could so I could be more comfortable. Special thank you to Jimmy for helping me with my stay. Looking forward to staying here again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sanctuary this weekend and I was pleasantly surprised. Location- They are located right off of Times Square a perfect balance of not in the mix of the crowds and noise but easy to get to the crowds and noise. We heard no noise from our room and slept wonderfully. Staff- Front Desk staff were great and so was housekeeping. We actually had our room down graded due to overbooking from a wedding and the Manager was very accommodating and apologetic he allowed us to check in early/offered us late check out/ and got us some appetizers and drinks from their overly popular rooftop restaurant-the haven. We were very pleased with the level of customer service. Parking- you're given a voucher at checkout $40 over night parking for discounted parking which is about 2…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Room are very, very small. Window in the room I couldn't open, but if I could I'll have view to the brick wall one meter close with silly painting of palm, beach and boat. I had to switch air system, cause had bad allergy when it was on. No one came in the room to change sheets, refill cosmetic, change towels four days. Finally after my second request someone was in the room and just change towels, without refilling shampoo and shower gel, and soap disappeared. Never again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This was not our first visit to Sanctuary, but the last time was five years previous so I wondered how it would be, particularly during Covid.. From the moment we arrived right up to departure, I cannot think of anything to criticize about this hotel. It must be said that Jimmy, the Concierge, is the heart and soul of Sanctuary and the staff makes every effort to live up to his standards. He even recognized us after so many years. Even though it is undergoing renovation and therefore does not have a restaurant, at a time chosen by us, a 'breakfast box' arrived. In each box was coffee, juice, yogurt, an apple and a croissant. Our very own continental breakfast without the line up Sanctuary is half way between Times Square and 6th Avenue. They must have special windows…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I stayed here for a long weekend last month, and it was a wonderful hotel! The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating—especially Van! Van went out of their way to bring a new mini fridge to our room when ours stopped working. Great location as well! I expected there to be a lot of street noise give the proximity to Times Square, but to my surprise, the room was very quiet! Will absolutely be staying here next time I am in NYC.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel is entirely very stuffy and dark. I've booked a trip for my family of 3 and our window was facing a large brick wall. I've asked for a allergen-free room as my child has specific allergies. Selection of rooms is entirely arbitrary and left up to the check in registrant's own accord. The staff were somewhat accommodating, however they did not change our room. Parts of the hotel are not regularly sanitized. The manager Andrew C. was not accommodating neither. Would not entertain this facility for my next visit.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel was Dispirited. Worst Hotel / Room. Stuffy, darkness in the entire hotel, Our window was facing a aged brick wall & waste of money. They gave us the room at the backside of the hotel I believe that is the worst area of this hotel. I feel they assign the rooms to the customers based on their own criteria.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the smaller rooms with no view that people have been complaining about (700).. I loved it! It was comfortable and cozy for two.. the room was quite and could be blacked out easily.. great for people with light and noise sensitivity.. staff is great! They are aware of your coming and going without being intrusive

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: A big shout out to the manager Andrew who made my stay extra special. His service was above and beyond! From the front door guy to the front desk as well. Thsnk you to all of your staff who knows how to treat guest! I never had a better exoerience with a Hotel manager like Andrew!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Outstanding hospitality. Van, Jimmy and Liam made us feel like we were part of the Sanctuary family. That's hard to find in bustling Times Square. If you want to feel like just a number go to those big chains. If you want to feel honored as a guest go to Sanctuary. Any request made was promptly met with a smile and courteousness. Thank you Sanctuary Team! Covid did make things a little less traditional: breakfast to rooms was just okay and daily cleaning of rooms didn't happen automatically. But I for one appreciate the times and totally understand and everyone else should as well. For those saying the rooms are small I recommend getting a Deluxe Room. It's plenty big. The beds and bedding were soooooooo comfy. Is there street noise: yup. You're in Times Square. People…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I lost my wallet prior to my arrival in NYC. The doorman was checking i.ds at the door like this was some exclusive high line hotel. I got past ‘security’ and made it to the desk to check in and got denied access to my pre paid room. I explained to Carlos and Quanisha that I had lost my wallet and needed to stay because I didn’t have many more options!! I pulled up my id on my phone and also a photo of my credit card and got denied access to my stay. They said they would refund me my money and still haven’t gotten a credit back to my account. Look my wife and I have stayed at 5-6 star hotels in various parts of the world and this by far is the trashiest, most unprofessional service/treatment we have ever experienced. My wife and I went to the Arthouse hotel and got accommodated…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel is "fine," but that is it. For the prices charged and website promising STAR service, I expected much more. The hotel is not offering housekeeping because of "COVID" but it's probably more of a staffing issue. Breakfast was supposed to be included, but I was not told that it had to be ordered in advance. So the next day I had no breakfast and was not even offered coffee or anything. For my second night, I was sure to place my order in advance. Coffee and juice were delivered to my door, but breakfast never arrived and no other alternative or solution was offered. NYC hotel rooms can be small, but this room is laughably tiny. Really, really small. The shower is open to the bedroom and essentially only 1 person can use the sink/bathroom/shower at one time. There is…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: To be fair I went in May, so the pandemic was still looming... however, I decided to spend a few days there, also to support the hotel and NYC's recovery. The room was quite dark since it faced the alley, but quiet, the carpet was dirty, it felt it hadnt been clean in ages. Breakfast was delivered to the room, but they forgot so i had to call the front desk, they only had coffee, some stale muffin and yougurt. A pity, I really went there to support the hotel and because of the good reviews in the past and also the nice pics. but there are better hotels in NYC at that price

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Overall it was a good stay but it wasn’t quite what we were expecting. The parking was close (about a block and a half away) but there was no valet and we probably could have found cheaper parking on our own - though it would’ve been a little further. The directions they gave to the parking garage weren’t valid after 2 because of closed off streets. Our bags, which were dropped off with the doorman to be taken up to our room, were sitting in the lobby when we returned about 15-20 minutes later. They informed us on check-in that breakfast was bagged and delivered to the room due to Covid and we needed to relay our preferences the night before. We did and requested it brought up at 8:30am. At 8:50 the next morning we called the front desk (with our personal cells because the phone…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I stayed 8 days at the Sanctuary Hotel and everything was perfect. The welcome of the team was very professional and the room very clean and overall the Location of the Hotel at 200 Metres of Time Square is the Most. The Haven restaurant on the roof top is very nice and the Sushi Lab excellent. I will go back for sure...

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We were able to return here after the year away. The hotel has been modified a lot due to New York restrictions and rules. However the staff was brilliant. Went out of their way to make our return great. The Haven is open up too and was better than I remember it. New York is no where close to being back again and some places are a bit of a waste land. I felt the staff here went above and beyond. Cannot recommend high enough.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We expected a "Sanctuary" and we were not let down- The Cozy Queen Room WAS cozy, clean, efficient, and well designed- Everything was in perfect working order. We enjoyed our two night stay with them- We visited both roof top restaurants and both were welcoming and bright and clean- breakfast was included with our "Package" and it was modified to be "Room service" and was delivered on time and of good quality (we were expecting a continental type service but it was more than that) . C 19 Protocols were in place- Everything that was "changed" due to the C19 situation was painless, seamless, and well done. The location is absolutely perfect to Times Square and Central Park. we met the Hotel Manager- James- and he was Friendly, professional, caring, and accommodating- We will…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The staff at check in was very good. Other times the front desk was manned by indifferent staff. Felt like I was interrupting their personal conversations and phone use. Was told breakfast was included. No breakfast was provided At check out they tried to add a "destination fee". It was never disclosed until check out. I never stay at a hotel with any such nonsense junk fees. I felt like this stay was a shake down. No breakfast, extra charges. Tiny room. A curtain separates the bathroom

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The receptionist and waiter exceeded our expectations, I would definitely recommend this place and revisit. Next time I’m doing the suite and eating at the Havana restaurant again the pizza , steak was delicious.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I spent the night here awhile ago and we couldn't be happier with our stay. The hotel feels very sexy so it was perfect for our little staycation. We're right next to Times Square so we got to be tourist in our city. The rooftop is gorgeous. We had the king suite overlooking the street with wall to wall windows. It was a great change and escape from our tiny Brooklyn apartment. Would highly recommend for a sexy night in NY:) Also shout out to the GM Jeremy Poon if he's still there. Amazing hospitality from the bellman to the front desk to the housekeeping team.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I’ve been coming 7 years bc fam in parade. Wonderful place. We will have to skip this Thanksgiving because Covid and parade restriction. Will be back. Japanese restaurant and daily breakfast wonderful and convenient.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I was here för a conference with Three colleagues in Dec. 2018 and they were very nice when we had a bad experience with intoxication. I will definitely live here again if I'm in NY! Very nice rooms that were renovated apartments were supernice.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I truly enjoyed my two week stay. I was displaced due to Covid and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. The rooms were a little small for my liking however I loved the ambiance of the hotel. I would however recommend changing the curtains in the room as they were old and tacky. I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and coffee every morning and the staff always helped me out to my vehicle. I would definitely stay here again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Fantastic location, great ambience, very helpful and polite staff, pretty decent breakfast. Room was lovely and well equipped. Rooftop bar drinks uninspiring but ok venue for a novelty drink. All in all we had a brilliant stay - cheers!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: If you are looking for a hotel look no further , you will not be disappointed. All staff - to name a few Andrew (concierge) Jame and Liam (front desk) were extremely knowledgeable, helpful and very kind . Breakfast was a buffet style , it was clean the rooms are great and the bed so comfortable ! I can’t rate this hotel high enough , it was so nice in every conceivable way . The doormen were also on hand to help and a stones throw from Times Square .

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We had a nice stay here! This hotel is located close to Times Square and we found it easily accessible. Pros: They offer guest free passes to NYSC about two blocks down - we found that to be a nice perk! The guest rooms were clean and the bed was pretty comfortable. We liked the decor and the complimentary breakfast was great! Cons: They told us to park at the 38W 46th street garage for a discounted rate of $40 -which is pretty good for NYC. We were leaving in the morning for JFK so when I checked in at this garage I asked how long it would take to get my car the next morning and I was told "2 minutes." Okay then. When we went there the next morning (keep in mind we have a flight leaving shortly) there was no one in line. There were FOUR employees there however. I walk up to…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Didn’t really think much of this hotel it was clean beds not very comfortable it’s a really dark hotel more like a Boudoir everything black and red breakfast was just ok didn’t think much of the maid throwing my drinks away than waited all day for them to be replaced the best thing was the location

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I'm going to split this hotel review up into two halves, the good and the bad. We travelled from London for a 5night stay booking through Virgin for essentially a sightseeing city escape. Starting off with the good the staff were always polite, any problem we had or anything we asked was never a problem. The hotel is located central New York, alot of the typical sightseeing attractions are in walking distance. It's also bed and breakfast so being able to wake up and not worry about your first meal is nice. The room was also always kept nice clean and tidy. Now onto some of the more underwhelming parts of out stay. The rooms are very small, this is made worse by the fact that the hotel has a very dark theme going all the way through. Our room had windows but let in no light…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Excellent location, literally around the corner to Times Square where the hop on hop off bus tours are well worth the money, walking distance to Central Park and Rockafella Centre. Hotel staff are very friendly and rooms very clean and cleaned daily, breakfast in which was very good and set you up for the day, would definitely reccommed this hotel, booked with Virgin where the daily hotel tax was included in the price of the holiday.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: It was so nice to be greeted by such kind front desk staff after the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Blanka and the young man working with her were a delight. I was also impressed with the free breakfast- much better than expected. A great stay. Definitely a "Sanctuary" from the big city.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel was nice. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel itself is smaller and the rooms are compact. They have been updated and are nicely accommodated. The hotel is dark, which is what they were going for but it's not for everyone. The elevator is small and slow, which if you cant handle that, take the steps. We did. The roof top bar on this hotel, Haven, was very cute and nice to hang out in. The hotel was clean, but hallway noise was very loud in the rooms. We have been to many nice hotels but in NY city we dont have much experience and expect most places are more compact. The location was great, walking distance to everything important to us. Time square, restaurants and bar/clubs were all within no more than a 18 min walk. We enjoyed our time here.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed on the 2nd floor of the hotel in a Queen. Location of hotel was great, so close to everything in Midtown. The rooms are small, but I assume that is probably true of most NYC hotels. It is a little strange to have the bathroom area open to the room, but at least they have the privacy curtain. The staff was wonderful, just incredibly helpful and friendly. T The breakfast buffet was a nice to have, but nothing to write home about, I would probably go to a legit bakery or something next time. The rooftop bar was very pretty, but the drink prices are redic. My boyfriend got a mixed drink that was all ice and probably had a total of 2 ounces of liquid for 20 bucks, not worth it. All in all, I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Christine K. warmly greeted us at check-in with a sincere smile and welcoming persona, first impression I made the right choice for our stay. Andre immediately got us great seats / great price too, for a show we wanted to see, tickets were in our room within the hour. The room was impeccably clean, beautiful and when we wanted extra towels, within 5 minutes they arrived. The location is near all the theaters, great restaurants and shopping. There is so much more to compliment here, I will be coming back to this hotel again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Location, location, location!! This hotel is a gem tucked away in the most fabulous part of Times Square. It is a very unique boutique hotel with chic flare. It has a fabulous sushi restaurant as well as an amazing rooftop restaurant with awesome views. The best part of this hotel though is it's proximity to everything in Times Square and all of the restaurants and Broadway shows it has to offer! It is also very close to all of the subway lines so if you want to travel outside of Times Square you have that going for you as well. I must also mention it was my birthday and the hotel truly went out of their way to make me feel special. We finished our stay there with the delicious breakfast in the dining room that is included with your stay. For a NYC hotel, I can't…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: A nice beautiful hide out in mid town Manhattan with really friendly staff and an ambiance to revel in. It was rather unfortunate that we came to the end of our stay but we thoroughly enjoyed our surroundings.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We arrived early afternoon on a Tuesday and before we got out of our bus transfer, a doorman from the hotel had opened the back doors and began to help us with our luggage. He carried them to the front desk and didn't seem to even expect a tip. Straightaway our first impressions were positive! Andre at the front desk did a fantastic job checking us in, letting us know of services they could help us with such as booking broadway tickets, getting reservations for dinner etc. Facilities fee was explained to us and what was included for that fee (as we booked through Virgin Holidays, this fee was waived). We were offered a drink whilst we checked in of tea, coffee or water. Drinks were available 24/7 in the lobby and you could help yourselves. When we reached our room, which was…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Danny was a great help promised and over delivered were we’re supposed to get a surburban but instead we got a LIMO thank you so much you made our experience amazing can’t wait till next time we come back he needs a RAISE!!!😄

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small. I can handle that in NYC. But "windows" that are blacked out make one feel as though they're staying in a closet. Shouldn't what is basically a windowless room be disclosed prior to booking? And as I write this from the hotel, it's impossible to fall asleep on this worn out mattress (or is it a futon?) and flattened pillows. On the plus side, hotel is convenient to theatres.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Absolutely well placed for everything including Times Square (1 min walk). No noise heard in hotel (room 609). Staff, including door men really helpful and polite. Very popular roof top bar/restaurant. Rooms are small with hardly any wardrobe space but hey, you out all day and night so ideal to just collapse in after sightseeing. Metro close and simple to navigate.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We got a great deal on a room at the Sanctuary and expected an average experience given the good price. We are rarely in the room when we go to nyc and dont feel the need to go overboard on a room. The room we had at the Sanctuary was very cool. It was quiet for nyc and the service was unbelievably friendly and solicitous. I dont think we will stay anywhere else from now on.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Our experience at the Sanctuary hotel was fantastic. One arrival we were checked into our room very quickly, despite us being early for check in. The room was very clean and had all you could want. It was also cleaned regularly. We had breakfast included in our stay and that was also very good. There was a wide range of choices, from hot food to pastries and cereal. However, the best thing about the stay had to be the staff. They were all very friendly and eager to help in any way. In particular the doormen, one doorman was very helpful when our transfer hadn't arrived, even calling the company up to find out what was happening. This in addition to already helping us with our bags. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family whether it be for business or a…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed in this hotel. It was so conveniently located to Times Square and Broadway, and the price, compared to other similarly-located hotels, was outstanding. The rooms were tastefully decorated, the staff very nice, and the included breakfast very good (although it's a bit cheap to charge extra for espresso!). You won't get views of Times Square here like at the nearby Marriott, but then you won't get the price either. The hotel has dimly lit common areas and a swanky vibe that made our middle-aged selves laugh. Our room was on the small side and the bedding was not luxurious, but, for the price, everything exceeded my expectations. My only major complaints were that the rooms were not sound-proof, and the area in front of the sink was limited,…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Highly recommended, I can’t say enough about this hotel, the stall was very friendly and accommodating. We stayed in 2 different rooms after extending our stay. The deluxe king was on a lower floor with a street view. You could hear some outside noise if you really listened but it was quiet and at least had a view. The room was slightly small but plenty of space for a couple . Just as pictured the shower has a glass surround with a privacy curtain, and a separate small bathroom with sink. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed the room. We decided to book an extra night and stayed in a regular king. It was slightly smaller and no view but sill a beautiful room. The included breakfast was hot, delicious and freshly prepared. It also came with fresh pastries, fruit and yogurt. The…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Had a fabulous stay at the Sanctuary Staff so friendly and helpful and really go out of their way for you Rooms nice very clean great shower Breakfast not a great selection but it was ok nice enough and I would say as good as you would get in any Hotel in NewYork and it’s included in price Restaurant food good but a bit pricey Location absolutely Fantastic really recommend the Sanctuary for that alone and the rest is a bonus

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Myself and my fiancée stayed at this hotel over Christmas as it was our 10 year anniversary. Being in New York at Christmas has always been on our bucket list and we got to tick it off this year. The sanctuary hotel was beautiful and in the best location if you want to stay in the hustle and bustle of the city. Loved the fact it was close to Central made even better for those cold morning winter walks. The staff were very friendly and the food in all of the restaurants were amazing. I would highly recommend the sushi!! We also spent New Years in the haven rooftop bar which was a lovely finish to our holiday. I would highly recommend this hotel.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Stayed here for our anniversary booked a queen room they upgraded us to a king once they heard it was our anniversary room and hotel were nice have no complaints at all would definitely stay here again there is a nice rooftop bar we only had drinks but the food looked good parking lot is half block away we were very pleased with the hote and would definitely stay again

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I had a wonderful time at the Sanctuary hotel. The staff go over and above to ensure your needs are met. The hotel is so cozy. Make sure to dine at Sushi by Bou. The fish is so fresh and the friendly staff made it a very memorable experience. I highly recommend this hotel.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The staff here are incredible and go above and beyond on every aspect. So friendly and helpful. They greeted us with hot tea and cocoa and it kept getting better. Rooms are small, ok for 2 people, but snug. No dresser or fridge. Would totally stay here again. Location is fantastic, right off Times Square. Breakfast is included and was very good.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Had a staycation to just relax for a couple days and glad we chose this hotel. A real hidden gem in Times Square (which as a real New Yorker you’d always avoid this area). Room is small but pretty standard do NY but the hotel makes great use of the space. Buffet breakfast was also pretty good and don’t skip the rooftop(open in the winter but covered) with good music and eats. No gym but off passes to a gym within walking distance that I didn’t visit since it wasn’t close enough during a very cold winter morning. Would recommend staying.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Our 3rd visit back to New York, this time just before Christmas. We stayed at Sanctuary for the 3rd time and everything was just superb! Nothing is too much trouble, the room is lovely, location perfect and the staff are amazing! Jimmy in the S.TA.R team is absolutely brilliant, he booked our restaurants and recommended some prior to us arriving, he helped us in anyway he could! If your visiting New York stay at this hotel, it is everything you need in a perfect location right around the corner from Times Square

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: My husband and I along with our two children had a wonderful stay at Sanctuary hotel in NYC. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful at all times. The rooms were very clean and not too small. The rooms were very quite throughout the day and overnight. We would definitely stay here again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I can't tell you how refreshing it was to stay at Sanctuary. Every bit of interaction with staff was great. We were greeted at the door, suitcases taken, offered coffee/tea/water, walked to the elevator after checking, absolutely fantastic. We even had a sick child in the middle of the night and had new linens within minutes. I was really pleased with this hotel, room was clean, quiet (aside from typical nyc street noise), nice shower, really a lovely hotel.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful, rooms are adequately sized and clean. The staff are so willing to help with any requests, and genuinely seem to love their job. They made our trip so special, so a huge thank you to them! Despite loving NYC and wanting to spend most of our time exploring, the hotel was a haven and it was so nice knowing we could return there to relax. We especially enjoyed the fresh water provided every morning, and me and my partner still speak of the beautiful fragrance that inhabits the lobby (wish we knew what it was!). The breakfast is delicious, full of amazing pastries but you may crave something a bit more substantial after all the exploring of the previous night. All in all, it would be difficult to fault this hotel, we loved it so much and were sad to…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We booked a cozy queen, the room was a little small but we are a couple so it worked fine for us. The hotel is cozy and clean, the rooftop bar is nice and the location is perfect. All staff was very accommodating and friendly. I highly recommend a stay here. The hotel is low lighting so just keep that in mind during your stay. We had an interior room so the noise was not an issue.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 2 nights at the Sanctuary Hotel during Christmas. The location is excellent, only a few blocks away from the MoMa, the Rockefeller center and Timesquare. The service was nice and helpful.The room was small but cozy. It was pretty quiet because it was not directly on the street.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
