reviews.text: The services and location are excellent. We enjoyed the Hotel, and the peaceful environment the Rooftop restaurant is an enjoyable place to eat and talk. Close from Timesquare and Rockefeller center. I definitely will book this Hotel again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This was our fifth time visiting the Sanctuary Hotel in New York City. My wife and I truly love this fantastic hotel as it is the perfect location for the activities we have planned, and the rooms are gorgeous. The staff are truly outstanding and go out of their way to ensure our hotel stay is amazing. We enjoyed the excellent breakfast and the staff hosting this were fantastic! We will most definitely stay here again. Thanks to all!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel close to the noise and bustle that is Times Square is truly a sanctuary. Our experience from the friendliness and helpfulness of the front desk and bell service to the peaceful and beautiful surroundings was amazing. The hotel restaurant was first class for dinner and the breakfast was great. The rooms, although small, were comfortable and efficient. They pack a great deal into a small property but never make you feel crowded. Definitely one of the best hotel experiences we have had.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We had a great experience. The hotel was close to Times Square, NBC Studios, Rockefeller Center and The Empire State Building. The hotel was very clean and a substantial breakfast was provided. The rooms were very clean and cozy. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. We were very satisfied and definitely go back!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Our stay at The Sanctuary for a Christmas weekend was wonderful...The room was a bit smaller than we expected, however the staff was the most cordial, polite and helpful that we have encountered anywhere, from the doormen to reception to restaurant staff...Would not hesitate to recommend...

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel around 11:30am. I checked twice with the front desk on the status. At 2:30pm, the young guy said he would come and let me know the status on my room. He never came back. I am typically a very patient person and I swear to God that I never write reviews. But this was the worst experience in my life with the wait time and customer service.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel was really nice and clean, close to everything but gees! I wish I knew it wasn't kid friendly. It felt more like a night club...so dark inside, rooms are super small bedroom and bathroom separated by a curtain and overly performed. The pictures of the roof top look really amazing on their website but it is completely different in person it's a full bar and not kid friendly all the plans of relaxing on the roof top that i imagined were ruined. I guess if you are going their with hubby or boyfriend it's okay but NOT with children. This place is NOT kid friendly at all. It's an adult boutique hotel. Period.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I must say, I generally like to patronize boutique hotels. However, this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. Admittedly the time I chose to visit is considered "high season" (second week of December), however, the rates that they charge for this hotel for what you get are simply outrageous! To say the rooms are small is an understatement!. I barely had room for my suitcase. I am a seasoned traveler, so I don't need/use a large suitcase for a 5 night stay. I queen bed (platform style), a small desk, mini bar and out-dated television on the wall (not your modern day flat screen) are the only items in the room....very small space to walk and closet was about the width of my suitcase standing up. The room decor is dark------brown carpet (which concerns me, since…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Really enjoyed the ambiance of this hotel and how different and quiet it felt when walking in from the hubbub outside. The free breakfast was pretty good and an easy way to start the day. I'll likely stay here every time I come to NY and want to see all the shows. Much easier and nicer than many other hotels in the the TS area.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel is superb in every way😊The location just off Times Square is perfect and the whole team are fantastic"! The room is cleaned daily, breakfast superb! The bars are great, just can't praise them enough! You will not be disappointed with a stay here❤️❤️

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I travel to ny a lot and have hotels where i normally stay. It was unusual for me to try something new. I tend to like the boutique hotels. In this case the room was very expensive, even by NY standards. It was the smallest room I have had, outside of Asia. No room for a desk or chair, the bathroom directly adjacent the bed and looking out to a brick wall in a light well. I could almost touch the shower from the bed. The decor is unusual and noir. I’m sure it’s trendy but I didn’t really like it. Great location and the people were super helpful. I can see my reviews differ from others, but I’m probably back to my regular spots next time.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Monday 25 Nov to Friday 29 Nov at the Sanctuary in Kingsize deluxe room over thanksgiving - Fantastic amazing luved every minute of our stay - the bed was enormous all the staff were wonderful and the location is perfect for a base to explore NYC . Highly recommend this hotel was our 2nd visit, the first was 2014 and the standards have not slipped just love this hotel.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I don't typically leave comments, but I had to say it's the coziest place I have been so far in Times Square area. Great place for those who seek a quiet and comfortable relax in the center. BTW Douglas and Danny were very helpful, thanks, guys!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We returned for my birthday after visiting last summer and we love it at the sanctuary. Its in a great setting just a short walk to the bustle of Times Square. The greatest staff, nothing too much trouble. We stayed under the B@B booking and breakfast is both continental and hot food. The door staff are amazing , helpful with our luggage and so friendly. We shall be back next year I promise

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Cool entrance and bars don't overcome the street noise or small rooms. Even by NYC standards, these rooms are exceptionally small. My room was on the 6th floor street side and was very loud. Homeless outside the nearby 47th street Church and construction half a building down are also disruptive. Lastly, the towels were old and thread bare in spots. The staff is friendly and service-oriented, but they are dealing with some impossible conditions.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The rooms are small, but very well put together. The staff was super friendly, and the restaurants and location are also great. Really positive surprised. The breakfast is pretty good, and the sushi place is awesome.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I stayed here on a recent trip to NYC and enjoyed staying at this hotel. It reminded me of some of the cozy boutique type hotels where I stayed in Europe -- and indeed, many of my fellow guests were European. Talking points: 1. Staff friendly and helpful from the moment my taxi dropped me off until I left for the airport. 2. Hotel appears to have been recently updated, with modern shower and decor furnishings throughout. The entire hotel has a nice fresh (but not overpowering) smell. 3. Convenient location -- theatre district , times square, shopping 4. The continental breakfast is nice and includes some hot items, such as eggs, bacon and/or sausage. 5. The coffee is excellent and is available 24/7 in the lobby along with hot water,tea bags, fresh water. One caution: the…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The 'guaranteed' check-in by 3.00 pm was not honoured. Please wait in the bar where over-amplified muzak and decor from a bad day in the nineties awaits. The room, when it becomes available, was a dogbox. Small, dark and unwelcoming. The 'breakfast' was disgraceful. Served in the same, back-to-the-nineties bar. My wife had to spread a napkin out on the chair before she sat down. It was disgusting. There were no options for anyone with any ideas of healthy eating. Porridge? No. Muesli? No. Yoghurt, granola, bran? That would be a no. Eggs? Yes! Tepid scrambled eggs. Other varities? Boiled, poached, fried? No. Bacon. That's a no. But TWO cannisters of pressurized whipping cream if you'd like that. Fruit? Yes, tired apples or oranges sitting in the same fruit bowl day after day.…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We visited in October as we got married in New york, the hotel is amazing in location, cleanliness & style. The breakfast has a wide range of things to choose from. The staff are really helpful especially Danny on the door he helped us with directions places to eat & sorted our transfers back to the airport. Can't wait to visit again 😊

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Solo traveler on a 1 day work trip. I asked for a quiet room and was told that I am given one. However, the door was not isolated (there was a visible gap) and all night long I heard doors slamming, loud conversations and suitcases being dragged. Everything else was perfectly ok - room, amenities, breakfast, nice staff - but the job to be done wasn't accomplished since I could not sleep at all.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Enjoyed last time in New York so decided to stay again. Room ready early so that was great, hotel darker than I remember but you get used to it. Rooms are small and not much storage space but hey this is New York! Breakfast included and fine to start the day, serves from 07:00 which suited us. The real plus of this hotel is the staff, especially the door men who are always on hand, Gil the STAR manager was great and booked the 9/11 museum on our behalf. We were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary which was overlooked by the hotel but not an issue. There is building work going on at the end of the street which is a bit disruptive but we just went the other way!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Great location just off time square and close to a subway, rooms very small but maybe this is the trade off for the location. breakfast was mediocre and a bit boring after the first couple of days. Exceptional customer service from all staff

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This wonderful hotel is situated adjacent to Times Square and is within easy walking distance of numerous subway stations. The decor is fantastic and all the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful - nothing is too much trouble and they are genuinely pleased to help. We stayed in a Deluxe King room, (201), that overlooked the front of the hotel - this was a decent size, very clean and very comfortable with minimal noise from the street outside. We ate breakfast, (American style- great sausages), and a couple of evening meals at the hotel with the staff pulling out all of the stops to get food to us when we were a bit pushed for time - the standards of both food and service were impeccable. We drank in the lobby and rooftop bars and both were very clean and comfortable - the…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Really enjoyed ambience, food, location, and staff. In particular Jimmy at the desk(planned a great day for us) and Danny at the front door. TKTS is right up the street so it is super convenient to pick up discounted theater tickets.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Outstanding customer service from the doormen to the rooftop bar. Very good dinner at the restaurant plus a15% discount and a free buffet breakfast in the morning. Just a real good experience at a very affordable price,especially in manhattan!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Friendly, helpful staff. The location is outstanding for mid-town. While taxes always rack up the rice, this place is very competitively priced. The rooms are cool and the minimalistic look is not overdone.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The included buffet breakfast was great, excellent pastries and other treats. Also on the ground floor was a bar that had a cozy atmosphere.The rooms were nice and bigger than some that weren’t near the square. The view across the street was a TV broadcast station .We could live news programs due to large windows.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This isn’t a great boutique hotel. It’s an average hotel with no real amenities. Albeit in a good location. Felt like entering a nightclub the morning after when you can just smell stale alcohol. We had spa passes included in our package which were no good as the spa relationship was discontinued. We weren’t offered anything to compensate. Room felt dated. No room service. Roof nice but was too busy to get a seat. I’m sure there are better options.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: ....but little else. From our arrival, as the doorman watched from inside as we lugged our cases up the steps in the rain, we found the service perfunctory at best. Our room was pocket-sized ,with a view of a concrete wall, and with a curtained-off shower. Noise from the air conditioning and the roof bar above was a constant intrusion. The hotel seems to set great store by the decor, which we found weird. Dark and gloomy, mirrors on the ceiling (sadly no pink champagne on ice), unpleasant odours in the passageways. The sports bar's walls are lined with huge TVs, all showing different channels to a background of thumping rock music. If you are party people then this is for you. It reminded us of the torture scene from the 'Ipcress File'. Maybe change the name from…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Last minute trip to Manhattan to see a show at Radio City with friends. Found this place on TA and the price was right and location was close to where we wanted to be. Got there at about 2 pm, room was not ready,told us they would call,no problem left bags met up with friends and went to eat lunch. The location is great we like to eat in Hells Kitchen and it was a short walk to many wonderful restaurants. Got the phone call,headed back and got checked in. From the gentleman at the door,to the front desk to the lady at the elevator in the evening (to go to rooftop bar) which by the way was amazing, such professional,pleasant staff. Our room was on the 4 th floor room 408,in the back of the building. Room had a queen size bed and enough space for the 2 of us,shower is in the room…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed at the Sanctuary from the 29th August to the 5th of September 2019. From the moment we arrived at the hotel the doormen took our cases from us and were very friendly. We checked in and one of the men at the desk heard our name and wished us a happy anniversary. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom being right there was never a problem and the toilet was separated by a door. While the room wasn't the biggest it was the perfect base for a week in New York. So close to Times Square and a good starting point. There was a card in the room for a bottle of sparkling wine for our anniversary. This was brought up, when requested, in a champagne bucket with 2 glasses. I thought this was a nice touch. Breakfast was simple but nice. The coffee…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We’ve just returned from a 5 night stay here, after just a little bit of research we decided on this hotel as it looked like a bit of luxury. We weren’t disappointed, the hotel has a luxurious feel throughout, nice & dark with lots of chandeliers. I’ll start from the beginning, we arrived a little tired to be greeted by wonderful smiles & an instant offer of help from Danny & Douglas? I sincerely hope we have the correct names as throughout our stay these lads, including Deshawn felt like friends, we laughed & chatted lots, they’re a credit to your hotel & a great first impression. We were shown to reception where unfortunately the girl behind didn’t give us the same welcome, I’ll get this out of the way now as I don’t want to spoil a great review, but we kind of got a strange…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic location to Times Square only a few steps from the centre. Our room was spacious although took a bit of getting used to having the bathroom in the bedroom but it was fine. The hotel definitely need to provide more hangers there were 5 hangers for 2 people staying a week is impossible. We had to iron every day which was a chore. Our air con also broke on the second to last day which was annoying given the heat. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and after a long day it was perfect for relaxing on. Our room was very noisy even with ear plugs though and we could hear the beeping from outside which is not the fault of the hotel but I would say definitely ask for a room not facing the road. Breakfast was a disappointment. Cereal was either…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This was first solo trip to a city I haven't been to before and a lot of it is down to the incredible people who work here. I am disabled so I was extra nervous about asking for help whilst I was staying here but I needn't had worried. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with a smile and someone bringing in my case. The room I was in was a deluxe queen room with a bathroom with a door. It was the right size for me and my friend (he joined me later in the week). Every morning I was taken care of at breakfast by the wonderful waitresses who got me my eggs and sausage. The breakfast is self serve (I needed help with that) and basic but more than enough to fill you up. The rooftop bar is cosy and relaxing, though at the time of writing this (Sept 2019) there were a lot of…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: On entry to hotel was hit by stale beer odour on Sunday afternoon. First appearances was everything was very dark, gives it a dirty dingy feel. Stayed here 4 nights, room small but clean and had the noisiest chilled cabinet in room. Not a good look,most of staff very friendly. Reception staff not very informative upon checking in, was not until we came to check out that we realised there was a big downstairs bar, also coffee and cold drink and being able to help your self not explained, If we had been made aware at check in we would have spent some time there in stead of going other places . Hotel roof bar ok but no where to sit as tables all booked be companies outside of hotel.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The Good: Proximity to time square Friendly customer service team Great rooftop bar Clean Updated bathrooms The Bad: The king size bedrooms facing the street are super noisy. Do not recommend for light sleepers. Choose queen size rooms if you’re a light sleeper, but they’re facing a wall so little daylight and no view in those rooms. Average breakfast. Damp feeling in the room No separation between room and shower. Feels cramped. Outdated decor Overall small rooms.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We took a very last minute overnignt trip to NYC and needed something reasonable and centrally located. Book based on price and location. We loved this little gem of a hotel. It is very Zen and know why they call it the sanctuary. It’s peaceful and dimly lit which makes for a relaxing and sexy vibe. The doormen were very welcoming and helpful as was all the front desk staff. Breakfast buffet is included. Basic egg and sausage and lots of pastries yogurt and fruit. The room is cool and cozy with very comfortable bed. Be forewarned - while it is well appointed it is small. It was perfect for a quick getaway. If I was here for a longer time with bigger suitcases that would Have been a struggle as storage is quite limited. We will definitely return. Great bar options and a…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The location could not be better for getting out and about in NYC. Staff were very good prior to our arrival arranging a surprise of champagne and chocolates to be in our room on arrival. We arrived late to the hotel due to it taking 3 hours to get through immigration at JFK. When we checked in we had bee upgraded from a queen sized bed to a king sized bed which was very nice. However the rooms are still small with you toilet and shower effectively in the same room. There is little hanging space for clothes or space for bags. The decor is very dark...everywhere. Feels like a speakeasy or bordello. Roof garden bar is nice but very small and noisy. Breakfast choice is limited...scrambled eggs with either bacon or sausage depending upon the day. Pastries, yoghourt, fruit juice,…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed at The Sanctuary on our Wedding week in New York, we got Married on Feb 20th and celebrated the whole week, we managed to see all the sights of New York and were look after impeccably by the hotel Staff, we had a bottle of champagne sent to our room by the management on our wedding day which was a lovely touch, we will be returning some time in the future thats for sure

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay at ten Sanctuary. Staff were very helpful and always available. The rooftop bar / restaurant were amazing! We had an issue with the air con making a noise in our room and we were quickly relocated. Location was absolutely amazing, right next to Times Square, made our time in NYC very enjoyable! Rooms were not the most spacious, but were clean and modern, all you needed in the heart of New York!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Booked here for our New York visit with husband and 2 boys (8&9) Had a lovely welcome. All the doormen and front desk were kind, friendly,helpful and very professional Throughout our stay. We arrived very early and they took our bags for the day so we could enjoy the city as check in wasn’t until after 3pm. Rooms very small but this is standard for New York. We had separate bathroom, 2 double beds but no storage so had to live out of our 3 suitcases which were on the floor. Room was very clean so I get over all that. Tv WiFi and air conditioning very welcome. Breakfast was disappointing for what it costs. Bread/toast yogurt, awful coffee, pastries, scrambled egg, bacon and 2 types of cornflakes. That was the choice and all self service. Note that you get hit with a service…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights last week. There were 4 of us (2 parents and 2 adult children) so we booked a deluxe 2 double bedded room. Room 412 overlooked the street, had 2 big windows, was large enough and had a totally separate bathroom. Everywhere was very clean and well maintained. Yes, the corridors are a bit dark but that doesn't spoil the hotel experience. No drinks in the room but tea, coffee and iced water always available in the lobby. The air conditioning was very welcome! All the staff were very professional, pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was good (one of the only hotels in NYC to provide this) nothing extravagant but plentiful and edible: bread/toast, pastries, tea/coffee/juice, fruit, yoghurts, scrambled egg and either bacon or sausages. We didn't use the rooftop…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel has a slick website, great photos and promises a great stay. But when you arrive and check in this hotel it under delivers. Small rooms, limited storage for clothing.and very overpriced for what you get. Do your homework before choosing this hotel there are better options.?

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: 5 stars hotel in Times Square to be avoided. The breakfast is a 2 stars hotel. Omelette made if powder and butter and some juice. The coffee is awful. The rooms are small and the hotel elevator needs maintenance.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Cozy stay in great location in NYC! Service was excellent! Room was comfortable and cozy. Close to 5th Avenue and Times Square. Convenient. Enjoyed my stay! Too difficult to meet 200 character minimum.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Staff are very friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommended this hotel and will return very soon. Rooftop bar was amazing. Comfortable beds. Loved the free breakfast and beverages always available.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed one night and I’m glad it wasn’t a longer stay. My first impression was of an unpleasant odour in the reception area - like stale urine. The male reception staff were friendly and welcoming which is why I have rated our stay with 2 stars rather than 1, but the female reception manager was rude and abrupt. The decor everywhere was shabby and tacky and there was an unpleasant smell throughout the hotel. This hotel really needs a facelift. Everywhere I looked I could see grease marks and fingerprints. Even the handle to the door of the hotel was greasy to the touch. The air conditioning was very noisy, especially noticeable when trying to sleep. I wasn’t impressed by the hotel’s rooftop restaurant - it was overrun by non-hotel guests, very noisy and frenetic. That’s fine…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We spent 7 nights here in July. The porters were excellent, as was the team of concierges. The room we had booked was unavailable due to a 'plumbing problem', so we were upgraded to a King room on arrival. Disappointing to then have to pack up and relocate the next day to a queen room, so we couldn't really settle in until day 2 of our stay. The room was tiny, but to be honest we only slept there. The air con blew directly onto the bed on one side and was extremely noisy. The continental breakfast was exactly the same every day. The roof top bar was fabulous. But what a location!! So easy to access and was a haven among the bustle of Times Square

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights. Fantastic location just steps away from Time Square, but still very quiet. Room was tiny but comfortable. So small that the sink and shower were basically an alcove in the room. There was at least a curtain you could pull across the shower. Staff were lovely.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Our 3rd visit to The Sanctuary Always friendly staff especially Liam at the front desk. Both porters were very attentive . Having breakfast at Hotel was very convenient We requested a certain room setup and it was honored .

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: 7 night stay for special occasional Travelled BA first class all the way The hotel was a let down Poor standard of room, they were hotel style to me Best bit was Gilbert on front desk very polite young man, extremely helpful Barry / porter was very kind and helpful The hotel appears to offer the Haven outside guests more attention On check in we asked if we could book extra day told no need On the morning told by a very rude reception girl, NO, no customer service at all, Barry the porter intervened due to her behaviour but she refused, in the end having stood firm we spoke to James and were allowed to stay until 2pm, but then we felt like we were an in convience to the them, I would never return to this hotel if you paid me But credit to Gilbert and Barry who…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: highly recommend this hotel due to the incredibly knowledgable staff and the stunning hotel. the smell is extremely memorable and the staff are always happy to help. Gilbert specifically was the best!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I really want to like this hotel. It is in a great location, one block outside of Times Square. Unfortunately, the rooms are the tiniest that I have stayed in while in New York City, and there is only a tiny window with no light. The redeeming qualities of this hotel are the rooftop bar, and good service from the people who work there. The hotel itself has a very cool zen vibe, but it is a shame it is so dark and small. The bathroom is actually part of the room, with only a curtain to separate the bedroom from the bathroom. They do offer complimentary water downstairs during the day and complimentary coffee in the morning. Overall, despite the cute atmosphere, I would not recommend staying at this hotel.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The hotel is acceptable and in good location for those who likes to be next to times square and the theater district, the room is small and noisy you can hear what is happening in the adjacent room, the breakfast was not good and not tasty

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This place was amazing. The staff were awesome. And the star staff, Jimmy and Gilbert bend over backwards for you. I'm shocked their last names aren't gets, cos whatever you want, Jimmy and Gilbert gets! Highly recommended hotel. We will definately be visiting New York again, and most certainly stay here. OUTSTANDING

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I loved my stay at the Sanctuary. If you want to be right in the heart of Midtown I can't imagine a better hotel at a better price. I was blown away by the luxury hotel feel when I walked into the lobby and was greeted so warmly by the reception staff - hot tea? yes please. hot towel? yes absolutely. It is NYC so the rooms aren't large, but they're perfectly fine for getting a good night's sleep, a warm shower, and for any downtime you might want while breaking from business or tourism or whatever you're doing that day. Oh! And the rooftop bar is awesome. It is definitely a fun scene to be a part of and as hotel guests, you get to skip the line that will eventually form. People want to be up there on a beautiful summer night. We stayed until closing time because it was just so…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed here for 7 nights whilst celebrating our honeymoon in New York. The hotel is in a great location, up the road from Times Square, lots of shops and restaurants around within minute walks. The staff are very friendly, helpful as we asked many times for some recommendations where to eat and professional. The rooftop bar is great when it's not busy, I am not sure if they have a maximum amount of people allowed up there but if they don't i think they should take this into consideration. Only had breakfast one morning but it was standard continental so cereals, toast, pastries, fruit, yogurt, tea/coffee and juice. The hotel overall is OK, I was possibly expecting too much. It is very dark, our room was a superior queen room and it was tiny however we didn't complain but…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Our stay at the Sanctuary hotel was great! Being minutes away from times square was really convenient, the rooftop bar was pretty cool. The gentleman at the front door Danny, was really kind and helpful, not only was he genuinely friendly, he brought our luggage in and suggested some good food places and food trucks to us, he also let me know the hotel offers breakfast in the a.m, which was pretty good! .

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: This hotel is located in a great area. Within walking distance (1 mile approx) to Times Square, 5th Ave shopping, Upper West Side, Columbus Ave-Central Park and a short Taxi/Uber ride to Javits Center for Trade Shows. The hotel staff is really fantastic, they were polite and very attentive....nice job! There's a complimentary breakfast which was pretty good! The rooftop bar is very cool and something to experience.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was clean and relaxing, and the breakfast was great! We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was conveniently located next to Times Square with nearby Subway stops. We couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay!

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We went for my wife’s birthday and stayed 5 nights. The reception staff were all very good and friendly but those on the rooftop bar were an exception, who seem to cater for private parties and non residents. The hotel is very dark and crypt like everywhere and wouldn’t be good for older guests. Our room was tiny; one of the worst we have ever stayed in. The air con is very loud and hard to sleep with when it’s on. There was a separate toilet but the shower and basin are behind a curtain. The wardrobe space is suitable for 6 items or so as it’s also tiny so we couldn’t unpack our cases at all. The breakfast was just about ok as were staff. We ate at the rooftop bar twice; the first time I’m sure we were over charged but were so tired and jet lagged we failed to notice until we…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sanctuary Hotel for 2 nights (21st and 22nd May) prior to going on a cruise that we picked up from Cape Liberty and the a further 3rd night on the 1st June. This was our first time in New York. The check in was swift and efficient and our bags were quickly delivered to our room which was positioned to the front overlooking 47th street. We were lucky enough to have received an upgrade to a deluxe room which was a large room with a comfortable king sized bed and twin sinks and an excellent shower. The breakfast was included in the price and consisted of a buffet where you could help yourself to cereals, fruit, pastries, hot food, juice and tea or coffee. The breakfast was great value and well prepared. The customer service was excellent, the staff were…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Best customer service ever! I would stay here again. Beautiful. Elegant. Great location. I just can’t say enough nice things. It was fabulous. The staff was friendly and helpful. They absolutely went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights to see the sights, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We liked the text message system with housekeeping, and used it to ask for extra hangers and robes, it was very efficient! Our room was tiny-405 and more an in suite than en suite but it was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had no view but it was very quiet. The air con was difficult to get right though and quite noisy. We ate once at the rooftop restaurant, it was pleasant, and so was Tenders downstairs. The bar downstairs was pretty busy but again the staff were friendly. We did think the hotel overall was very dark and the rooftop is very popular with a lively young crowd. The hotel is very convenient for Times Square and Top of the Rock.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I can't fault the staff or the location but I did find the room we had rather grim and depressing. The whole hotel is in darkness, which feels rather oppressive and our room was just horrid. The bed was uncomfortable, there was no separate bathroom, the air con was so loud that we couldn't have it on during the night and the whole room just felt damp. The rooftop bar was also a massive letdown. I haven't been to New York before, so not sure what the overall standard is, but I was disappointed with the Sanctuary.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Firstly we have to mention the amazing staff. From start to end they couldn't have been more helpful (special mention to Danny and Ian the main doormen). we arrived slightly early but had a room ready for us straight away which was great. we entered our room and found a note on the bed saying thanks for spending your anniversary celebration at our hotel, please call us at reception for your complimentary bottle of bubble, again, very thoughtful and just generally a great little touch. there have been a few reviews about it being "too dark", which is slightly true,but in my opinion, get over it!!! it adds to the ambience, and the hotel looks great. the rooftop bar is great, very attentive staff and just a good vibe! location couldn't be better! time square a 30 second walk…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Good place to stay in New York and also centrally located close to Times square. Room was somewhat small but clean. Haven rooftop bar is an added plus. They are associated with one of the parking garages nearby and you can park overnight for 40$. Only stayed here for one night, can't say much else. Breakfast was included and was pretty good. They also have a sushi restaurant in the hotel but didn't get to try it out. Overall good experience, only wish they didn't impose so many taxes and fees (amounted to 50$ by itself). Check out is at 12pm.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Very nice small hotel just off of Times Square. We were looking for a place near the theatre (5 min. walk to William Kerr Theatre and Hadestown!). Yes, the rooms are small as noted in other reviews but super comfortable bed, and come on folks, how much time do you spend in your hotel room in NYC? We did the Park & Stay package and I was disappointed that there was no valet parking and I had to get back in the car and battle traffic again to get to the garage after a six hour drive. The roof top bar seems to be an attraction and is noisy and people seemed to be way overindulging. But hey, maybe I’m just too old! We were in a hurry for dinner before the theatre Saturday night, and the sushi bar in the front of the hotel was amazing! They got us in right away, recommended an…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for our 40th Wedding anniversary it was our first visit to the states, we based our choice on the reviews, photographs and location. Our tour operator informed the hotel in advance about our wedding anniversary and on check in a guy called Liam gave his congratulations and said he would sort a small something, this never materialised, I didn’t expect something for nothing I just wanted to make it a bit special for my wife. The hotel is in a great location just off Times Square. We found the hotel decor for our tastes to be very dark and lacking light, deep red and dark brown colours, on entry to the lobby there was a very strange smell, like a sickly air freshener or essence sticks. The room was small with very little wardrobe space we had to leave…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: The Sanctuary is right by Times Square but away from the hustle and bustle. I was a little concerned about the rooms after reading other reviews but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised as yes it wasn't a huge room but our upgrade to deluxe king was perfectly adequate as we didn't spend much time in it and the bed was extremely comfortable after being out all day and night. A bonus was the breakfast which yes, is the same and limited but again satisfactory. Unfortunately the rooftop bar was always far to crowded and not the most pleasant of views so we only went there once but the cocktails that we had were very nice. The ony reason I have given 4/5 and not 5/5 is due to when we left. At soon as we got to the hotel we asked (based on other reviews) whether we would be…

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We were deciding between this hotel and another for our honeymoon and I’m so glad we stayed here - the place is truly spectacular! The decor throughout is decedent yet elegant, the staff very friendly and knowledgeable, the breakfast was filling... I could go on and on. The location is second to none and it’s very handy having a beverage station in the lobby to grab a coffee to go. It has a few restaurants within the hotel and a rooftop bar where we dined on our last night and I’d very much recommend. Our room was small which is usual for NYC and had no view but as we were only ever there to bathe and sleep I don’t see this as a problem (room 609). I personally loved the open plan bathroom too. Haha. Can’t imagine staying anywhere else in NYC! ♥️

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: Our first room was 514, there was no functioning window. The window was nailed shut and had a cover over it so we couldn't see outside. The room was about 8x10. We asked to be moved. They moved us to room 708 - larger a normal sized room for NYC with a functional window. Unfortunately it has an awful mold/musty smell that went away after about 20 minutes with the window open. The bed felt like it was old ...very old. The room was clean. The front desk and doormen were pleasant. I would not stay there again.

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: We have just returned from our stay at the sanctuary. All i can really say is 'perfect'. The location the rooms the staff everything was fabulous. Having breakfast included is a real plus. Only small thing was the restaurant was closed on the sunday, it was my 40th birthday and we would of liked to try it but wasnt a problem. We will definitely book here again if we get to visit new york again. Thanks everyone for making our stay so wonderful. Xx

address: 132 West 47TH Street, New York City, NY 10036
name: Sanctuary Hotel New York
reviews.text: I was able to take a last minute business trip up to New York earlier this week and checked Hotel Tonight for best available deals. I was thrilled to find this little (unknown to me) gem on W. 47th just off Times Square and convenient to the NYC subway and Penn Station. While the rooms are small, they have everything you need for a good nights sleep, a nice complementary breakfast, a roof top lounge and best of all, a VERY quiet night's stay (I was across from the elevator and still didn't hear a noise all night). The housekeeping staff was immediately helpful when I reported a bad bathroom light bulb and the front desk staff was professional and helpful. I will definitely look to book here again! Thanks for the hospitality!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Amazing hotel, the check-in staff member was exceptional and went out of her way to make our stay feel special as we were celebrating birthdays. The pool and view were the draw card. Worth paying the 5 star price just to spend the day in the pool. Rooms immaculate and our TV was massive.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We are a family of 6 ( my 85 yearold father, 79 year old mother, my sis-in-law and his sons flew in from Canada and myself ),the room upgrade (Merlion Suite facing gardens by the bay)was very much appreaciated!My 2 nephews flew in from Canada and were celebratin their birthday as well, so having us all in 1 room was a big surprise as well as the complimentary cakes.The suite was of course luxurious, the complimentary tea, coffee, drinks and chocolates were a big hit.Booking is simple online, the check-in process could be improve especially for the unintiated like where do we look for the queue numbers although 1 unpleasant encounter was when a guest claimed that our queue number was his and proceeded to the counter , I was baffled as the prompt in my phone stated my check-in…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: You can go there for casino and infinity pool, other then this it's not attractive at all. The infinity pool is nice but you will not going there everyday, because it's too many people and not easy to get seat and clear picture. The renovation of hotel room is old, I can't understand why they can refurbish it. And the worst is they have renovation work during midnight. I can clearly hear someone drilling the wall at 2am. I called the reception and they told me doesn't know where is having night work and can't stop them. I can't believe this is happening in 5 stars hotel and I was paying SGP$600 to sleep at the working site lol I got the video with me and clearly can hear the drilling works, I was try to show to their manager and I forgot to do that, if you want to go pls…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Clearly beautiful place not just an iconic one with overrated reviews. Pristine clean and fantastic customer service, absolutely in my top favs hotel. 36th floor gave me an incredible view to the gardens and the infinity pool on the top is stunning. Bars are awesome, both the Spago and the c’est la vie.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: It was my first time to Singapore which was for the F1 and I am so glad I had the chance to stay at Marina Bay Sands. What an experience and what a hotel!! The service from check in all the way until check out was incredible. Spacious rooms, attentive staff, complimentary mini bar plus the famous infinity pool are a must for anyone looking to stay. The countless food options and top restaurants on site are fantastic for any foodie. Can’t wait to be back and will only stay at MBS!!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Stay from 05 sep to 08 sep 2022. Hotel requested a security deposit of Sgd 400 which i offered my debit card. To my horror, it was debited rather than hold charge. After 1 month, i queried the credit process back to card. However, they said they paid me in cash during check out when i check out via express boxes which we simply drop the key cards to a machine. Im still pressing for an answer. I suspected they got mixed up with other rooms.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Marina Bay sands is a must visit place for anyone who would like to view Singapore from top. I would recommend you visit in the evening as there is a light show which is awesome and also the sky scrapers and everything around you is lit up and its breathtaking. Would highly recommend this for everyone visiting Singapore.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: One of the best hotels in Singapore, the garden view has an open balcony, and the city has the most spectacular view of the Marina Bay area, including the water laser show, Spectra. The Garden view is to see the sunrise; the city view is to see the sunset. Booth ate a spectacular view. During special occasions, taking a city view is a good choice.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We stayed at Marina Bay Sands for three nights. This hotel was excellent and as we loved the pool. However, out of all the hotels I have stayed at, I would like to say a special Thank You to Marina Bay Sands. On our holiday (we went to a few places), my 10 year old son became ill and became dehydrated. By the time we reached Marina Bay Sands, it was becoming obvious that he was not well. I contacted the front desk and the staff organised an ambulance and a doctor to come to examine him. Marina Bay Sands security helped take my son in a wheelchair to the ambulance and assisted us with our passports and details we would need to take to the hospital. The staff at Marina Bay Sands simply went above and beyond. My son went onto make a very speedy recovery after going…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We arrived in Singapore as a family. Beforehand, we arrived to 2 different hotels that were cheap and reliable. When we first arrived to Marina Bay Sands, we were stupefied to see how many adults were in the hotel. At that time, it was school holidays in most parts of the world. The check-in time was at 4:00pm as well. When we first arrived to our room, it was pretty standard for a $1000 SD per night hotel. Nevertheless, the facilities were superior for adults. Consequently, Marina Bay Sands is a great hotel for adults ONLY.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: It's an enormous, sprawling hotel, and the check-in experience was similar to checking-in at an airport - not ideal. However, it was clear after a few encounters with the staff that despite the fact that we were 4 people of thousands of people passing through, that this hotel was special. Each interaction with the superb staff felt personal and the staff were fully invested in us having a great time. I'd single out the following staff for exceptional service: Concierge (and Clef D'Or holder) - Muzaffar - he went the extra mile to help us book our night safari Pool-side manager - Maurice (one of the nicest Aussie's I've met) Pool life guard - Mo ( a one in a million character)

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We had such a lovely time in MBS! The service is outstanding and the facilities are simply amazing. Singapore’s best hotel totally did not disappoint. Plus points that we were given a generous upgrade from Garden view to City view.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: This was my 2nd time at MBS. I had a great stay. I would like to say that this time I experienced an even better service. The room service was very prompt. The waiting time for breakfast was much less. Also the breakfast selection was very nice. The staff was very helpful as I had arrived early and the check-in executive gave me a temporary card to access the pool and the health club so I could relax and shower by the time my room was being readied up. The views from the hotel is undoubtedly amazing.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: This hotel deserves 5 stars for its sheer size. Our visit was to the MBS was the most impersonal experience I have ever had at any hotel anywhere in the world. When you arrive you are simply one of thousands of other guest who are checking in and out of the hotel that day. The surprising thing is everything does seem to be well managed which is why the place deserves five stars. It is another thing I have ticked off the bucket list, but as for returning, that wont be happening.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at MBS. The staff were friendly and helpful and of course the rooms, the pool, the views are AMAZING! The hotel is very conveniently located and great if you are travelling with children with access to Art Science Museum and Gardens by the Bay right on the doorstep to the hotel

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: If you are looking for luxurious personal service, this hotel is not for you. The swimming pool view is the highlight but it's not for swimming, it is for posing and taking pictures. We hadn't booked anything because we didn't know we had to and we didn't find a restaurant to eat in before 9pm because everything is fully booked. There doesn't seem to be anyone to help you navigate the madness of so many people so even though as a hotel guest spending a lot of money it doesn't feel like you are important to the hotel. The guest room is a wonderful sanctuary. We had a high view across the gardens and bay which was wonderful but this was not enough to make me want to go back.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Our stay was made so much more special by the staff but in particular, Renee Soh from the Premium Services team. Nothing was a problem and room was like a penthouse. Amazing hotel with amazing staff to match.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We booked the Deluxe Garden View room but we were very kindly upgraded to a newly refurbished suite in the second tower. This room blew every other hotel suit out of the water. The suite came with spacious rooms, very modern technology and insane views from both the bedroom and living room. Staff were very friendly and attentive. Only thing I would say I wasn’t to keen on would be the breakfast buffet, considering it is very dear, but this could just be down to personal preference.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We stayed in the Orchard Suite city view on the 45th floor, the team at MBS helped organise a surprise proposal for my partner. We were put in a corner room that had views of both the city and the gardens by the bay. Everything was above expectations and it was the perfect night for the both of us.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Me and my partner stayed here at the start of our 5 week travel. The hotel was amazing and facilities excellent. The food was superb and portions of a decent size although expensive. The hotel was so clean, beds really comfortable and lovely smell throughout. My partner proposed during our stay however our only disappointment being that ce le vie restaurant in the hotel weren’t particularly accommodating couldn’t sort us a table or give any gestures. Would definitely return!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We stayed here as a couple on a Saturday night for my partners 40th Birthday. We stayed on the 52nd floor which had amazing views of the Marina and Singapore skyline. The infinity pool on the roof had breathtaking views and we went here several times during our short stay. During the daytime we were kept topped up with free ice creams and ordered cocktails from the bar menu. The jacuzzi was the perfect way to end the evening. The room itself was very spacious with a walk in shower, a very large bed, 2 giant TVs and a lounge area. We had a meal in the evening at the Spago dining room. The food was delicious and well presented. To have a meal and drinks with the view across Gardens by the Bay was very special and well worth it. There are so many hotel options in Singapore, but…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We stayed at MBS at the beginning and at the end of our SE Asia trip. The beginning was fabulous as we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and also had an upgrade to the MBS "Prestige" Rewards Program, so we were upgraded to a fabulous suite, with a view of both the bay and gardens. They also delivered a cute little cake. We had signed up for the Re-Imagine promo and received a free voucher for each night of stay for either breakfast, lunch, rooftop lounge, science museum, or infinity pool photos. The Rise Restaurant was excellent with an amazing array of choices. MBS is an incredible structure, with the best location. We walked to the Gardens by the Bay twice. Of course, the infinity pool and Observation deck are a must do as well. The MBS Rewards program gives cash…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: I was on a trip to Bali and decided to stop over at Singapore for two nights which I booked via their website. I booked a superior room which was on the highest level as I wished to experience the beautiful views across the city and Of course the infinity pool. However when I arrived after my long flight I started to encounter issues. I was only allowed to book one night as there was an issue with my card. So I stayed the one night. I was told to check and book again in the morning for the second night. Which I did but my card got declined. So I then had to leave the hotel to stay at the airport. I then find out a few days later that my card has been charged for the second night. This hotel would not allow me to stay the second night and happily escorted me out but then charge a…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We were receiving invitations to Marina Bay Sands for the last 7 years or more. Last summer we decided to visit Singapore and, stay in this hotel. All Bay, View, rooms were already booked, so we took Garden View room on the opposite, side of the tower No 3. This turned out to be the best choice. All rooms with Bay view have no opening windows nor the balconies, however the Garden View rooms are having this, advantage. You can slide yoyr glass open and, enjoy the view from your balcony including evening concerts in the gardens with illumination of the artificial forest. All services were perfect. Laundry exceptionally good. Rooftop swimming pool Cristal clean and staff serving free drinks. Dining at, Rise restaurant opulent and very well served. The only thing I can not…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: What can I say but PERFECTION in every way! Everything was just perfect, the room, decor, cleanliness (spotless), customer service, food…ooo, and let’s not forget the infinity pool, amazing! From the moment I walked in after 16hr flight from London, till the moment I check out, I can not fault anything. Thank you so much for making my first Singapore visit so memorable and such a pleasant experience! I will definitely come back! Highly recommended!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: The rooms were not ready - and this was at 4.30 pm,, 90 minutes past check in time, it was very busy, and looks so much like, the hotel is more interested in quantity rather than the quality or the guest. The room was dirty, with large staining on the bed, which we had to ask to be changed - no dressing gowns or slippers. We had young adults with us - who asked at the pool area, about the music venue, on this floor (of which we could have booked, but was told the night club might suit them better), so didnt book, when they went to the nightclub, it was shut - they went back to floor 57 (i think it was 57), to be told oh sorry - yes i gave you thee wrong info - but then wouldn't let them as it was full, and they didnt book - although advised not to. I brought this to the…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: My sister and me have had a nice trip with an perfect experience in MBS. Hotel was very clean,beautiful. Staffs were very friendly. My room views city. It was very excellent. We will comeback here next time with our children. Thank you!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: i enjoyed our stay at Marina Bay Sands,beautiful view from balcony especially the food at Waku Ghin restaurant was so great.I love it.Thanks for Chris from hotel gift shop lobby tower 2,she give me more information about everything,will be back again for sure.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We visited the Marina Bay Sands hotel And we were very delighted! An excellent hotel! Great experience! Caine, the guy from the reception was so kind and nice. Gave us wonderful service and helped us as much as he can! Caine you’re the BEST! Love from Israel

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: This could be a long overdue review since we stayed at Marina Bay Sands Singapore last 31st of July which was our most awaited honeymoon destination. We booked for 3 nights stay to a premium room. Everything was planned perfectly until we arrived in the hotel. There was a flocked of people everywhere, we don’t have any idea what was going on upon entering the door. We approached a gentleman wearing a black suit that we wanted to checked in and we found out that we could not check in because the hotel was having a system down. My husband and I wanted to melt down coming from a long flight only to found out that we could not get our room upon arriving the hotel. It was around half past 3 o clock when we arrived. I have never seen a hotel so huge, so crowded, so chaotic and there…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: I visited Marina Bay for 2 nights on our way to Bali. Lots to share to help everyone make their decision if this is the place to stay in Singapore (we believe it is.) Food - visited Spago and Cest la vie bar. Be clear when you book Spago if you want the fine dining as we made this mistake and we couldn’t then get a reservation at the fine dining as it was fully booked and they have a strict dress code so my boyfriend in shorts and a shirt wouldn’t have been allowed in anyway. The food was okay but we didn’t get to experience the fine dining which I’m sure would be out of this world. Pool - way more impressive by night than by day. I love that there are different chill spaces like day beds, cabanas, sun beds etc… and that the pool and jacuzzis are open until 11pm at night. The…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Stayed here as it seems the right thing to do when in Singapore, we were underwhelmed and thought the hotel was over rated, had to book even to have a drink in a bar, Ce la Vie deposit and minimum spend was extortionate, room was ok brekkie average, hotel is to big and lacks the personal touch.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Our stay were well taken care by the outstanding Premium Services team. Special thanks to Shataz, Nicholas and Mac for the seamless check in and check out. They were patient and professional. They provided direct contact number so that our needs could be attended promptly and it definitely made our stay amazing and smooth! Definitely recommend to book your room/event at mbs with Premium Services. Thank you team!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We book Marina Bay Sands, due to the pool.... and it is indeed an amazing pool! We love it! Besides that, staff was always friendly and efficient. Room was perfectly clean and we loved the room balcony with an amazing view over the Gardens by the Bay, The price for a night is very expensive and does not include breakfast.... we pay the pool.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Amazing hotel with 6 star service!! The staff were fantastic, they made our "sisters get-away" extra special with their warmth and professional hospitality. In particular, we would like to acknowledge Gai, Room Guest Services - KJ, Infinity Pool lifeguard - and Jessie, Reception check-in Services. They all went out of their way to provide us with exceptional service and made us feel very welcomed. Can't wait to go back!!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: I enjoyed our stay at Marina Bay Sands, our room was a Garden View which was excellent. We could watch the Supertree show from our balcony which was a really cool experience because you could see the whole thing, as opposed to when you're actually at the Supertree show you only get a partial view. The staff were all very friendly and attentive, Nicholas who checked us in was excellent, he was so helpful and made sure we knew everything about the hotel that we needed to. Candy in the gift shop was also wonderful, so friendly and helpful. The pool is an awesome experience, as it wasn't peak season we got to go a few times. They bring around complimentary ice-creams too so definitely keep an eye out for them. You also get access to the SkyPark Observation deck. It can be a little…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: It is my 3rd time staying at Mbs, it is good to be back here. I would like to compliment a particular staff, lifeguard Ryan. He has gone extra mile by volunteering to help us take photos, mingling with guests and helping his colleagues. He is a gem.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Customer service from premium Services was immaculate, I mean next level. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was nice, views were fantastic but the hospitality did it for us. Would 100% recommend.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Way overpriced for what you get. Don’t get me wrong the view of the pool was amazing but without that the hotel is nothing. Was £1000 for one night, and not worth it. I had dirty bedding which had to be changed. We couldn’t get into any of the roof top bars which I think as we were a hotel guest for one night we should have been Abel to. That was very disappointing. The room wasn’t wow, which for that amount of money was also very disappointing. We spent most of our time at the infinity sky pool which was amazing but the only amazing thing of our stay. Had this been half the price perhaps I would have been more wowed but it’s defo not worth the money of the stay! I had paid half the price of this for hotels which have been outstanding.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: 4 hours for hotel to arrange a room despite check-in @3.45pm, followed by 2 different versions of why the lengthy wait occured. Worst is the service recovery that we didnt request for by a person called Jeevan. We dont usually go to such lengths to post. But his story of an IT outage causing Phone service to jam was absurd.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Just want to take the time to recognize one of the nicest people on staff. Every morning we woke up at 5:50 am to have the pool all to ourselves. At 6:50 my companion would leave the pool and head down to the Cafe ORIGIN + BLOOM. The coffee is great. But without fail, my companion, Maria, would return with our coffee saying how nice Linda at the front counter was to her. This happened every morning. Linda remembered our orders and always had a warm smile. So yeah, the hotel is amazing but always remember, its the people working there that makes it so.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Besides the view from higher floor there’s nothing special about the hotel. The customer service is very poor, which will take you by surprise compared to other 5 star luxury hotels. Check-in process is long and there isn’t proper sitting/waiting area. Staff aren’t the friendliest. Also would like to add the hotel is super crowded partly due to connecting with the mall I suppose. My overall experience wasn’t really great and that’s my personal experience but i am pretty sure for some guests it was memorable one.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Our plane was delayed, so we arrived in the middle of the night, and we were only going to stay for one day 😕 Staff was really nice, and offered us a delayed check-out and extended access to the pool, so we were actually really happy about that - it was really kind. Therefore, we ended up having a really nice stay at the impressive Marina Bay Sands.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We stayed at Marina Bay for 3 nights - 26/29 Aug Hotel is very busy - they have trouble coping with the number of guests - we had to wait 40 minutes to check in. The hotel is very expensive - $8.00 for a coke - $18.00 for a Heineken - $55.00 each for breakfast - dinner buffet in excess of $100 each We tried to book restaurants on the 57th floor - there are 4 - I think - every restaurant was booked out for dinner - for the next 3 nights of our stay I think 1 restaurant offered a table at 10.00pm !! I suggested to the hotel that guests paying nearly $900 a night - should be advised to book the restaurants in advance of their stay so they are not disappointed. Prior to arrival - the hotel advised you need to book a time for the swimming pool each day - I though this unusual -…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: The service at the hotel was great and attentive; I had a wonderful welcome gift from the hotel. However, at the price of almost $1000 dollars a night that should be pretty standard. The pool was wonderful to experience and it is great that there was no time limit. It was not crowded at all and enjoyed the pool as well as the hot tubs overlooking the ships. For me it was a must do for the pool but I don't think I would spend the money again since there wasn't much else to justify the high price tag. Great cleaning staff and front reception.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We can’t recommend this bar enough We received an amazing service and great cocktails from Lisa, Nithilah and Rishaban and her management ~ definitely worth a visit 🇸🇬🌷🥰🇦🇺☺️✈️🏙☘️ We will definitely pay a re-visit with our friends 🤗🇸🇬🇸🇬🇸🇬❤️❤️❤️

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Obviously a very luxurious stay but feels more like a business resort than a hotel. We were a honeymoon couple but they weren’t bothered by that. We choose this hotel thinking it would be the best in Singapore but were left feeling a bit deflated. A lot more work is needed in making guests feel like they are in-fact staying in the best hotel in Singapore. Disappointing to find we had to pay a $400 holding fee which was not advertised and some 17 days later, we are still awaiting this refund - I don’t understand how they are able to hold on to your money for that long after check out??

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: We were concerned about the scale of the hotel and the number of guests and how that might impact our stay, but from even before reaching the hotel, we were so wonderfully assisted by a personalized check in staff as part of premier check-in services that we didn't need to worry about a thing. The luggage magically came to the room and left the room without us needing to supervise, thanks to the very able luggage staff and the exceptional operational management. It is worth staying in the suites for this premiere experience. Each dining option offered by the hotel is just fabulous, with the stunning views from Club 55, the beautifully crafted cakes and savouries at Renku, and especially the widespread and delicious breakfast selections at Rise. The ease with which the scale of…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: I have stayed here 3 times now loved the first 2 visits not so good this time. The hotel is great lovely room and the pool is wonderful unfortunately you now have to book the pool our morning booking didn’t get to poolside but the man on duty kindly let us in. Pool and sky bar are lovely but we were refused entry before leaving for the airport at 5pm were told all tables were booked in spite of it being empty. We were given a bar stool seat and the restaurant remained empty till we left. We had booked a twin room but were given a double/king bed told we had an upgrade with club facilities yet couldn’t use a conference type of room for my daughter to use for some work she had to do. Previously we had breakfast included the high tea and canapés from 5-7pm now this is only…

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Marina Bay Sands is a MUST STAY! Not only is the room cozy, the hotel is smack dab in the center of everything. Everything was in walking distance or a short uber ride. The light shows, the mall & the never ending choice of foods is the reason we will definitely be back! Also thank you for our front desk check in person, Jia Qi, you were so helpful in setting us up for an incredible stay. We appreciate everything!

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Stayed at MBS for the first time and was disappointed at the long checkin lines, crowded infinity pool, and overall retail atmosphere of the hotel. All restaurants were overbooked and reservations had to be made months in advance. After spending more than $1000 on integrated resort purchases we were told that our loyalty points would expire in 12 months with no option to redeem destination dollars online. Our Prestige status would also be downgraded if we did not continue to spend. This is not how you treat loyal customers! As a tourist, this discourages me from returning to MBS. Very commercialized hotel with poor concern for customers. We also stayed at the Shangri-La during our trip for less than half the price of MBS and the atmosphere was much more refined.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: This was our second visit and was really hoping for a better experience but it was soulless, cold natured, boring and absolutely no vibe. Everything we did as a family was hard, had to make reservations to empty restaurants, hours were bizarre and just seemed like a communist strict dull city. All the gear no idea.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: It’s a Disney World. You have to wait for everything. You have to pre-register what time you want to check in. You get a ticket and wait for your number to be called just to check in. The pool is cool. But you get only 1.5h a day and you have to register what time you want to access 24h prior. And it’s nothing relaxing. Full of Instagrammers taking photos and the staffs are constantly asking your room numbers to ensure 1.5h limit. The rooms are okay. Service is okay but nothing personal. Never again.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: On our way to Bali we stayed one night at the Marina Bay Sands. Everything from check inn to check out was very professional done. The room was very clean and had amazing views of the entire city. The pool ... the pool was just out of this world!! Just amazing! Definitely come back and stay again, maybe on our way back from Bali.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Excellent 4 night stay at this massive 5 star hotel. The amazing roof top infinity swimming pool on 57th floor offers a panoramic view of the city. The observation deck also offers panoramic views of harbour and the city. The check in service was quick and all the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. The room service was high class. The continental buffet breakfast offers a wide selection of different cuisines with local tropical fruits and juices.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore 018956 Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: Great hotel and great experience. The staff are very friendly, the hotel and rooms are extremely clean and the views are panoramic. Overall, Marina Bay Sands is worth the price of staying there at least once. The infinity pool is almost always open (6am-11pm) and was not crowded at all. During our stay there, we went to the pool as many times as we could and easily found lounge chairs. My only complaint is that the pool is not heated so it can get cold especially in the mornings.
