Staff who attended to us, a man & a lady (wearing a black suit) didn’t met our expectations as the basic body language, the tone of voice as well as the communication, how they carry themselves is very unprofessional. It gives a negative connotation to Pan Pacific. The food was average and we are unable to request for how the doneness for the beef burger (it’s all well done only). Our request was outright rejected without any options given. On settling…

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: The Pan-Pacific Singapore is one of the hotels I wanted to explore for a long time. I booked a Club Harbour Room for a National Day stay. It was expectedly busy due the public holiday and National Day celebrations. There wasn't an rooms for upgrade as well due to the peak crowd and a late check-out was offered as per membership benefit entitlements. If you are holding a GHA Discovery status, the benefits and service ends there, this pales in comparison to IHG or Marriott Bonvoy. For a flagship Pan-Pacific property, I find this rather disappointing. The room was generally good, measuring about 38 sqm. There is a very good working chair with back support that would be ideal for working in the room with multiple plugs for your electronics at the work desk. Although, the lack of…

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Chef tommy yeo cooking was superb. He was very friendly and provided good hospitality. He even shared with us his specialty sauce. Had some good pictures and videos with chef Yeo’s culinary performance. Great job!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel, the way they used to be back in the 70's / 80's. Could not fault anything with the internal architecture simply brilliant. All services exceeded our expectations and we will definitely return and recommend

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: The gym in this hotel is modern and well equipped. In addition to that, the human touch makes it perfect. Must give a credit to the great Gym Supervisor, Andrew, who proactively and nicely introduced me to the fascinating stretching machine together how to use properly all the strength machines. However it's seem that the hotel only have him as in house trainer not like before which is 3 trainers in the gym.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Attentive service by Chef Tommy Yeo and Manager Wan for good food and sake recommendations and ensuring my family had a memorable time esp on a joyous NDP day and my staycation in Singapore after being away from my family for past 6 months.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Booked a room at Pan Pacific for the extended family. Had the best National Day '22 experience and amazing time watching the show from the bed in the harbour studio room. Throughly enjoyed the Pacific Club Lounge at L38. Great stay thanks to the hardworking team on duty!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Went to Keyaki for a Teppanyaki dinner and was amazed at both the culinary skills and hospitality of Chef Eric Yong. Not only was he engaging, he even gave us some tips for cooking at home! Can’t wait to be back at Keyaki again to visit Chef Eric and thank you so much for the spectacular service + food 👍🏼

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we stay at this hotel. After 5 years, we still have good experience. The breakfast buffet is still good. The rooms and common areas are well maintained. The location of the hotel is a plus.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Had an amazing 3D2N stay at Pan Pacific Singapore thanks to the amazing individuals (Xin Fang, Shawn & Bobby) who provided such amazing services to make our stay so comfortable and enjoyable! Will definitely be back for a longer stay!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Amazing services by the team led by Kishore. The staff is very attentive to wait on customer. As usual will be back soon to have a delightful tea. The service has always been impeccable. Keep up the good work.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: We were at Edge on 10 Aug 2022, for our sisters' birthday. We were pleasantly surprised with Poh Lan's service. She was really attentive to the table and prompt with servicing our needs. Her attitude was sweet and nice too and even sang the birthday song to our sister. We really enjoyed our meal here because of her. Thank you so much Poh Lan for making our meal a fuss-free and enjoyable one. :D

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, lovely rooms . Great service. Very close to Gardens on the bay and Marina bay attractions. Club room experience is fabulous with panoramic views of the bay and excellent selection of snacks in the evening.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: The room that I stayed in was spacious and clean. It had a clear view of the Marina Bay area, including the floating platform. We had the chance to see the fireworks from the National Day Parade, which was the most memorable experience for our family.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Enjoyed our time here, most especially the good customer service, they are very attentive and welcoming. And the staff named Kishore, he was very nice. Would definitely recommend this with my friends!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Hotel was not ready to hand high volume of guest during peak time. A lot of bad experiences encounter during visit. Waiting more than 2 hrs for room readiness. Being treated badly at pool area by staff and accused of illegal access when you have card access

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Good service by kishore!! He’s friendly and kind he serves us very well will come more after this because of his service!! Good foods also and the environment was very comfortable love it!! The salmon sandwich is my fav

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed at Pan Pacific for almost 20 days and the entire stay was fantastic. What stood out for me were the servicing standards at the hotel be it at the pool, reception, room and at the buffet restaurant Edge. Special shoutout to Janice at the Edge for making the breakfast routine comfortable and delightful with her promptness and care.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: I had a great time with my family at Hai Tien Lo. Special mention to Kelly and Apple for the impeccable service rendered. Kelly was extremely warm and hospitable. Food was tasty, with the exception of the Osmanthus Soy Sauce chicken - my family didn’t really enjoy this dish. Otherwise a 5 stars experience through and through.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Patrick super powerful. Always look for this guy. He made our dining experience and extremely present one. He is very experienced in this F&B trade and service is of the highest level. Thanks Patrick :)

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Chef Tommy is amazing. He may be new in Keyaki but his cooking is exceptional. I was told that he has many years of experience elsewhere. Will definitely be back for his good service and good food, of cos. 5 stars ⭐️

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Came for birthday lunch with family. Had the teppanyaki multi-courses- ten The steak and seafood were great and chef Tommy was a great host at the teppanyaki table! Will recommend and come back again!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: We had teppanyaki for my birthday lunch date, and chef Tommy Yeo made the experience much better with his skills, friendly chat and great food. The ambience was nice. Place was clean. The staff were kind to give us a complimentary slice of cake for my birthday.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Good was great as usual but what stoood out was an extremely helpful service staff Jess Ang. Jess was very prompt in her service and was also proactive in asking if we needed anything else. Her cheerful disposition made our family dinner really enjoyable. Thank you Jess!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Nice ambience, yummy food with vegetarian options and great service. Special thanks to Paulyn who has provided good and attentive service. My family has been coming here frequently to celebrate special occasions. Highly recommended.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Was a really good staycation at Pan Pacific. I was given a high floor (32nd floor) which overlooked Millenium Walk. The rooms were good and clean. Really enjoyed myself. Would highly recommend this hotel

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: It's has been 30 yrs we always stay at Pan Pacific Singapore and this is the first stay in this year with this lovely hotel. Andrew from the gym that always provided outstanding and professional service at his gym by assisting me and my wife workout make us felt valuable. He even helped me to lose weight more than 10kg in our previous personal training sessions before the pandemic. A very rare fact that most hotel's around the world have in house trainer that have high experience like him and he has been with the hotel for quite long.Thank you Andrew and we will always will look for u! Prakaj P.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Good buffet spread for lunch, really enjoyed my time here but quality of food have some room for improvement (e.g. Singapore chilli crab way too salty, desserts nothing impressive). The best part about this visit was the service by Janice. Even though it was a buffet, she would recommend us food and got us drinks as and when we needed 💯

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Great ambience at the Atrium and good service received from Mr. Kishore where he went the extra mile to get the August babies a birthday cake! Friendly and kind , good service, Cake are delicious but way sweet 😊

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: The variety of food and the quality of good is really top notch. Its quite evident that HTL takes good care of their customer as they really provide excellent service, especially from paulyn, it really makes us wanting to go back again.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: A Steven Kennotly is very attentive to our needs. It’s my first visit to Edge and am very pleased. He is very obliging and attentive. Keep it up Food is good and well displayed. Variety was excellent! Me family if 18pax thoroughly enjoyed ourselves Keep up the good work! Best May 98732984

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Nice hotel with typically pleasant staff. Rooms starting to show age but still comfy with good views. Mine was quite dusty on arrival which suggests it hadn’t been cleaned properly and it smelt a bit musty (not unusual in Asia). Bar has a nice vibe but the pool area closes way to early (20:00 approx). Big breakfast buffet with a good choice although not very intimate, more like a busy business hotel. Good location, close to the marina. Worth a stay.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Service is great ! Love the ambience and drinks (: Thanks for the complimentary mock tails drinks. It taste so good and I had a wonderful afternoon with my friends. Great place to chill out with friends!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: The food was great and great service by the experience and friendly staff Would recommend Paulyn as she is very attentive, helpful and make us feel welcome. Price of the food is worth the price Will definitely come back again soon

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Very good service I like very fun and exciting Kelly Hui Qi Apple all very good funny people enjoy the food. Good. Excellent. I will hopefully come back again. I hope that the price will be cheaper next time.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: This is an amazing hotel. Views to die for and in a great part of Singapore. Not far from Orchard Road and an easy walk to China town. Very enjoyable breakfast and the last time I was there they had a happy hour. Our room was amazing very comfortable an again had an amazing view. I would highly recommend this hotel and am really looking forward to staying there in August.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was very good, location was prime, staff extremely helpful and friendly, rooms were comfortable… If anything needs an update it would be the carpets in the room as carpets in general are not the most hygienic things in hotel rooms.. I also like the fact that the hotel showers had big bottles of shampoo, shower gel and conditioner installed, as this reduces the amount of plastic waste from the small disposable bottles.. this is the best thing for an environmentally conscious hotel.. The hotel buffet had a wide variety of different cuisines and the room service was good as well.. Bed was comfortable, room balcony had a nice view… Hotel was connected to two malls and you can cross to the Bay Area from the sky bridge..

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Great Afternoon tea set. I was really impressed with Ms. Cris's service and the Bacha coffee selections. Foods are delicious, especially the salmon tart and crab sandwich. Definitely come back next time in Singapore. You can also choose sparkling wine or champagne (Taittinger?) for the set.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Thank you Alan for your excellent service, being so helpful and recommending us the best choices on the menu. Great ambiance including live piano music. Tip: if you go for a small bite, take the satay!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Lovely staff (Abhi), we asked for 2 rooms close to each other and he is willing to help us and successfully find the rooms, Great location close to MRT but we mostly use taxi which is always available in front of the hotel, close to shopping mall and restaurants, We really had a great time here. Highly recommended

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Service by Paulyn and her colleagues was exceptional. She is able to make good recommendations since it is my first visit. Always attentive and trying their best to make the dining experience a pleasant one for me and my son. Food is good quality too.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Very nice food with good service, compliments with Lee Mee, Wei Jian, Paulyn, Mabel, Frankie and John. Enjoy the dinner with my family. 😊. Love the environment. Highly recommended the Beijing duck here.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: My stay at Pan Pacific was fantasic and the service was excellence. However i cannot say the same for the room reservation experience. Poorly trained sales and reservation team that bungled up price matching.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Had a super nice stay to celebrate our daughter’s birthday! Staff brought out a small tart to celebrate her birthday when they found out during breakfast, which was a nice touch and made my daughter feel special. Food at breakfast was also really good and was a nice spread!!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Awesome food and great service from all restaurant staff, especially Jeff, who was exceptionally friendly and helpful! He made great recommendations and had a smile on his face while attending to us (: We had a great time overall and would highly recommend Keyaki to everyone!

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Though the stay was comfortable and the hotel clean and lovely, there should be better and more efficient service. There should be more counters open during check out at 12. There was a long queue of people waiting to check out. For a 5 star hotel, this can be improved.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: Thank you Team, I enjoyed my stay and slept well. I greatly appreciate the request for additional pillows. I love the size of the King Bed, that's one of the reason I am back to stay with you :) A good sleep always make my day ends with a SMILE. Breakfast was good but slightly noisy thou. Have a great day ahead :)

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: This hotel is fabulous. Staff are amazing, (special shout out for TJ on the concierge desk, his enthusiasm for his work is off the scale). Perfectly situated for Marina Bay Sands, Gardens by the Bay, Raffles Hotel, Clarke Quay, Boat Quay, Botanic Gardens, Singapore Flyer, Little India, China Town and just about anything else you could possibly want to see or do in the City. The hotel pool is gorgeous and so relaxing. Hotel is spotlessly clean, rooms are beautiful and comfortable. I really can't big this place up enough.

address: 7 Raffles Boulevard Marina Square, Singapore 039595 Singapore
name: Pan Pacific Singapore
reviews.text: My friend bought me to pan pacific to had dinner, the food was great and was serve on time. Despite that it was a busy period during dinner, the manager John Ong came and ask if we need anything, and was caring.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I visited Singapore and stayed with MO SP. The staying is lovely with a beautiful view facing the harbor. Sunset and sunrise from the room. I tried to charge my iphone and was advised not to directly in case my phone will blow up. lol well it turns out to be fine but it took a few staffs to figure it out. haha. I like the little yoga place and the breakfast is yummy. Typical MO that would not disappoint. :)

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: From Check in to Check out we found this an excellent hotel. The pool area was excellent and extra touches with 2 towels and staff laying them out for you. Also provided cold water and some fruit on skewers came around all for no charge which was a nice surprise - even provided a selection of sunscreen. would recommend the Oriental club rooms with high floors and great views from your room over Marina Bay. The oriental club was excellent and staff great - Samantha was the stand out. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will be my firs pick on returning to Singapore. The beds and bedding were probable the best I have experienced.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The staff are geared to really understand the tired business traveller and do and exceptionally efficient job to get you into your room. This stay was a room with an amazing view over the water and their room service breakfast is easily the best I have had. The room on the second top floor was not modern (don't read this as dated though), which was different to other rooms I have stayed in there which were updated. Pool is very nice and gym is great. For a flying visit of 1 or 2 nights in Sing I would not stay elsewhere now.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Lovely view of Marina bay from my room. The rooms were well maintained, housekeeping does great job. Refreshes the room every single time we step out, feels good as soon as we are back. The pool was very nice. Very near to many attractions, walkable to many. Had great view of Singapore 50 years Anniversary rehearsal parade and fire works from the bar sipping Singapore Sling. My wife misses the bed , it was very comfortable. Nice place to stay

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed there for 3 nights facing the swimming pool, the room itself is spacious, decoration a bit out dated. I found the mattress and pillows way too soft. Luckily they can be changed to foam pillows if they still have stock. We had the buffet breakfast, the breakfast is very good, lots of choices and didn't need to wait very long to be seated as the restaurants has many tables. The hotel is closed to the bay, if you want, you can actually walk to the Garden by the Bay, the big wheel, and walking to the closest MRT didn't take too long, around 10-15 mins. There is a big shopping mall - Marine Square linked to the hotel. But mind you that the restaurants at the food court in Marine Square stared to close quite early around like 915pm. If you don't mind the heat, there is a…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The facilities were good and I could use hotel facilities pleasant ly. Thexpool and BREAKFAST were the best and the house keeping did their jobs in a very impressive way. My kids got some gift, The entertainment system on TV was I ne of the best.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Reception desk person at check in didn't speak English well. I think she must have been from Japan as I arrived with a business associate and when we were on line, she asked if we were together. My friend and I looked at each other and laughed. She was innocently (I hope) putting us in rooms near each other for our convenience. She checked us in at the same time and we had rooms literally adjacent to each other. Wow. Took the elevators which require a room card swipe to our room floors. Rooms were clean and spacious. Unfortunately my room was not facing the Marina; I had arrived during the weekend of Singapore's celebratory 50th birthday. The cleaning service was excellent and took attention to each detail (something I can't claim that US hotels do, only in Asia). Gym…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. We only had one night in Singapore, and enjoyed the city and this hotel so much that we extended our trip at the end, so that we can stay additional nights. The staff, pool and room were so amazing, and my wife and I had the most fantastic breakfast Buffett at Melt! I highly recommend staying at the Mandarin Oriental If you are going to Singapore. Thank you to the staff there for making in such a memorable part of our honeymoon!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The hotel is in good maintenance although the decoration is bit dated. The pool is nice and rooms are roomy. Our rooms were facing the ocean and we were lucky to see the fireworks rehearsal for Singapore's 50th year of establishment in our room. Despite the above, their services did fail badly. We reserved four rooms one month in advance and stated clearly that we needed two baby cot. However when we got there, none was arranged and front desk staff just kept asking us for proof of such request without attempting to arrange immediately. The lady then said they were out of cot and could not help. After we gave her all the emails and vouchers as she requested, she then unwillingly said she would try to arrange. This was so not to be expected from this hotel group. We…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I travelled with my team (4 of us) and everyone of us absolutely loved the experience. The beds and pillows were amazing. Staff, in house dining, quick and delicious. I realize that in Melt, MO has an outstanding restaurant, but the in house dining is an experience on its own that I like very much. To be able to sit in your own room and look out of the window and eat, wonderful. They were kind enough to put all of us ont he same floor, which was great and allow us a late check out. I realize that this is subject to availability but I am used to being told that there is no availability in most hotels, in MO for me it has been always a yes, we can arrange something. Will certainly return.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Club floor. Booked 2 rooms. King bed facing the marina and twin for the kids facing the city. The bathrooms need to be updated immediately! Marble on the floor and wall were aging with plaster covering holes they renovated in the past. Not to mention mold in the shower floor. The sinks did not drain well. The toilet was next to the sink without a door between them in both rooms so I assumed this is the configuration for all the rooms. The bathrooms looked dated and I cannot believe my eyes when I saw them. The towels looked old. Unlike fluffy and white towels at other 5 star resorts and hotels. I have stayed in several hotels in Spore many times and MO did not come close to a 4 star hotel. One more thing, the amenities in the bathroom is worse than…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The staffs were so kind and the room was perfect. The pool was really wonderful to get rest and the view from the pool and the room was awesome! I could see Marina bay and MBS as well. I felt like I was being healed by the mood while I was at the hotel. The breakfast they served was the best I've ever had.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: An excellent standard in service and facilities, pleasant and helpful staff attendance, food selection and standard is great. We appreciate the concierge courteous and friendly assistance Its kind a hotel where you always like to go back.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: 3 of us including my 88 years old mum stay on the 19th floor Room 1938 (Ocean Grand room) on 15th Aug 2015 as a stay cation. We alighted at the Circle Line Esplanade Station and made our way to the Hotel through Marina Center which is just next to it. The Hotel is next to Marina Center and very near to Suntec City. There are lot of eateries and shops in both these Centers.In Marina Center the food court is at Level 4.If you come out of the Hotel and turn to your left it is a short walking distance to the Marina Bay area where the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and Shopping Center is located. Also here is the Singapore Flyer and the lotus shaped Arts Science Museum.The view from the hotel floor to ceiling window was fanstastic by day and night.. The bed was super comfortable..There is…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is my second time to stay in MOSG and I stayed here for 2 nights. The breakfast buffet was absolutely incredible and the view (Marina-bay view room) is good. However, the sound proofing in the room was below standard, I could hear the sound from the corridor; The shower room (Showering area) and the room size is relatively small, if compare with other luxury hotels in SG. Anyway, I still recommend this hotel, if the price is competitive

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Our 3 night stay in July was nice. We booked a Club Marina Bay room with a beautiful view, though it took them 2 tries to give us a room with the promised bay view. We had lounge access and really enjoyed the food and drink, though no real view. The lobby was my least favorite part of the hotel. It really had no function except for checking in/out. While we were there the army was practicing for the country’s 50th anniversary. We saw military jets flying low, in formation, as well as tanks cruising the streets. My son sent a text to my wife with a picture of the scene stating “There’s a coup going on”. I had to quickly dispel this story!! I would stay here again, though I would look at my other options.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: By far the best stay in Singapore, the best part is that Mandarin Oriental grows on you. For a 1st timer, it can be a sweet and positive state of shock :), for a 2nd visit it is absolute luxury, and for anyone who has been to Singapore more than than it just becomes a necessity! Comfort, space, outstanding rooms, relaxation, round the clock assistance and services, food and city connectivity being the integral advantages, there's one cherry-on-top that Mandarin offers - views - that overlook Singapore's most famous Marina Bay. It is just phenomenal, the feel, and everytime I think of my room, I am most reminded of the view I was offered - besides the great coffee! Thank you for the pleasurable experience.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel. I've stayed at MOHK several times - MOSIN is a more modern version but with the same outstanding service, The rooms and facilities are first class and the staff are discreet, courteous and nothing is too much trouble. The Hotel were able to confirm at booking that we had interconnecting rooms - none of the others I contacted would do this. When returning from jogging one evening the front desk porter immediately gave me a towel and some water to cool down. Small things make a difference. Leisure facilities are top notch with a great gym and fantastic pool. The pool, is in sunlight till around 5pm and open till late. There are cabanas round the pool to shade from the sun - you can stay in one all day but if you go out for > 30 mins you give…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Booked in for 1 night to a executive marina view room. From the outset we felt we were staying somewhere special, from arriving in the lobby and being taken straight to our impressively decorated, spacious and comfortable executive room for a check until our checkout in the executive club that next afternoon, my only regret was we didn't stay longer. The view of the marina bay sands was second to none, the bed was so comfortable after a journey from Australia we felt as though we were sleeping on clouds, and the snacks in the club were so tasty and plentiful you had to tear yourself away from them to go walk around the beautiful marina or eat dinner. Of course such luxury comes at a price but if you feel like treating yourself this is certainly worth it! ( an executive club room…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We had views overlooking marina bay sands. Spectacular. This hotel is absolute luxury. Amazing rooms and service. The buffet breakfast was really good and location is really easy to get around the city. The pillows were a bit soft but that is no big issue as room staff were able to get a firmer one. Thank u again for a wonderful stay

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for a couple of nights. The rooms are nice and big. Location is right in the centre of the city. The Marina square shopping center is right next door. Everything is at walking distance. The staff were very courteous. Everything was in order so I had no troubles. Only the breakfast is bit on the steep side at SGD 54. Not worth it. Did not have any other meals at the hotel so cannot comment on the food. The property insides is a matchbox structure with the elevator in the center surrounded by rooms on all sides. Good hotel to stay for a business visit.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The full height window views of the Marina are spectacular. Framed by the Marina Bay Sands and Lotus Museum building on one side and the Singapore Lion on the other. Wonderful to see during the day and so mesmerising at night with all the lights - I didn't want to sleep and miss any of it. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable. Loved the very comfortable King Bed! beautifully appointed bathroom with spacious bathtub. The pool area is wonderful with, again - those spectacular views overlooking the Marina. Crystal clear water. Cabanas and choices of private sitting areas. Staff very attentive ensuring you have drinks and clean white fluffy king-size bath towels. The Hotel staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Wi-Fi was extra, but with a nudge, they did include it. …

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed over the busy National Day weekend. While the staff were clearly swamped by the crowd of guest, all were simply excellent in their service. From the front desk for both our check-in and check-out, housekeeping, concierge, porter to the door man(? the elderly man was always flashing his wide toothless smile as he opened car doors even though he must have been suffering in his thick uniform and hat in the crazy Singapore afternoon heat) all were always warm, friendly, efficient and helpful. And of course, there's the lovely view of Marina Bay from our room!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My wife and I had three nights at the Mandarin Oriental and found it to be a very stylish Hotel with very helpful staff.We had a faulty toilet on our first night and when staff could not rectify the problem we were given an upgrade. I must mention the excellent work of Ms.Rosie,who went out of her way to make us comfortable. The breakfast here is quite amazing.We had a Marina Bay view room and it is well worth the extra cost.Very central location for exploring all Singapore has to offer.A bit disappointing that you have to pay for Wifi.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: It was a great staycation at oriental. Although the hotel have given me a wrong room at first, but the staff immediately change and upgrade me to a twin bed room. The reception staff irene even led us to the room which i was surprised. The tv at the hall was down but the technician jimmy went down few times to get a nice cable box to refix it. Lastly i am just disappointed about the bathtub as a suite room the bathtub should be bigger than i expected but instead it was very small. On top of that the hp chargers are still the old struture fix at walls which was pretty inconvenient for me.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Wow what an experience in one of the best hotels in the world, if you are considering the Mandarin for your stay, do it!! We had a club room which the lounge was perfect pre dinner, location excellent ++ just down the road is the hop on bus to give a full tour of Singapore. Singapore is expensive but if you like to eat with the crowd there is an outside food mall opposite the hotel that is buzzing with customers. The breakfast in the hotel is amazing, caters for every culinary taste, the rooms are wondeful, bed really comfortable and the shower gel etc is spa products. This was a real treat to stay here and would without a doubt recommend the hotel for all of the above and also the very happy friendly staff. Room Tip: Select a marina view if possible, perfect See more room tips

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We won a 3 day 2 night stay at a bay view room with a king size bed. The hotel has a vintage look about it and very oriental. The view is the centerpiece of the room and as it was national day weekend in Singapore offered the best view of the fireworks we have ever seen. We had room service for dinner and enjoyed a great view of the celebrations. The swimming pool is large and a great place to swim and watch people. We tried the Japanese restaurant which also had a good view of the Bay. Staff were extremely polite and helpful and service was top class. We are generally impressed and would certainly go back with the appropriate excuse

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights with my wife: Pros: beatiful view on marina bay from our room (extra charged) pleasant poolbar friendly staff Cons: our room smelled like hell (for 350€ per night) paid WiFi, price 20€ per day?! very chaotic breakfast I think after similar experience last year in Kuala Lumpur, this was our last experience with Mandarin Oriental in Asia....

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Wonderful and excellent property. Everything was perfect. Near to shopping mall, Marina Bay Sands. Staff were friendly, welcoming, warmth and knowledgeable. Would easily recommend this hotel to everyone.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Lovely view of marina bay and floating platform from 16th suite. separate powder room for friends watching parade, and suite came with small balcony. Expensive but worth it ! Prices for f&b bit high. Better value to est at marina square mall next door

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I have visited Singapore over 125 times over the years and this is my first really disappointing visit. My disappointments center around three things; 1) Poor service- It took an 55 minutes to get ice in my room the second night I was there & 35 minutes the first night. I had to ask for coffee 3 times at breakfast the first morning and finally got it just before we needed to leave. 2) Begrudging service- When the bell hop delivered my bags the first night, he looked at my $5 Sing tip as if it was an insult and held his hand out. When the waiter delivered my SGD $28 Caesar salad he was also insulted that I felt the service charge on the bill was enough. I suspect this is why I waited 35 minutes and 55 minutes for ice later that night and the next night. 3) Deception- The…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I recently spent over a week at the Mandarin Oriental for business and was thoroughly impressed. The rooms are spacious and very clean and the service is simply amazing. Absolutely loved the pool area and the food options within the hotel are excellent. My only criticism of this place would be the bathroom. If you're on your own it would be fine but sharing as a couple could get awkward given there is no bathroom door and all-glass bathroom walls which obviously doesn't provide much privacy when using the toilet.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My family had just left the National Day Parade 2015, and were looking for a quiet spot for some dessert, and to wait for the hoardes to disperse before we braved public transport home with 2 small children. We walked past the entrance to this hotel and there was a sign out the front saying that the hotel was accessible to guests only. Fair enough, I thought, but we decided to check with staff if we could dine there. They were poised and unfailingly polite, to me as well as the many others who made endless enquires on what would have been one of the busiest nights Marina Bay had seen in a long time. Understandably the hotel was booked out, including all dining venues, due to the festivities. We were about to leave when I asked if I could breastfeed the little one and possibly…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for three nights. The hotel is not located next to any mrt station, would take 5-10 minutes walk to the mrt station. Room is very spacious. The view of the outdoor swimming pool is spectacular. Breakfast is good with good variety. There is a outdoor food court next to the hotel which open till late night. I left my jeans in the closet, and I wrote an email concerning the case. The housekeeping replied to me instantly and said it will be ready for pick-up or mailing it back to me. That was very good service.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is our 3rd stay at this property and its standards, & service is as impeccable as always. Check in was efficient and despite being early for check in, they found us a room pretty quickly. I had indicated to the reception staff that it was not necessary to accompany us up to our room which was customary as we have been before however they still insisted. The room was spacious and we had a beautiful water views. You cannot fault the hosuekeeping as everything was cleaned perfectly. I did notice this time that they had a nice card over the kettle saying that they had filled it with clean water. This little touch shows how good the service is and for that reason why we keep coming back to this hotel despite of the many to choose from. Complimentary bottled water was supplied in…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The best hotel. It was fantastic time. Thank you so much. beautiful pool and places. my family was great time in Singapore. Next time,I will go to Mandarin Oriental Hotel. Have a good day^^ I hope to enjoy.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We came here as 3 friends travelling together and working in the industry I really wanted to stay at the MO. It is an incredible hotel but is primarily set up for the business traveller. The plus points are the service, the incredible breakfast, all mod cons in the room with a fantastic sound system and the location. I resented paying for wifi. There was no tables and chairs on the balcony so really pointless and the pool only has the sun for a window around 11-3 (probably just the time of year we went though), but saying that the pool is amazing. It is an incredible hotel but there was just something missing to make it that extra bit special, especially for the money.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We arrived mid- morning and were greeted by really helpful and polite staff. We were allowed into our room early and were given a complimentary upgrade to a fabulous suite. Our suitcases arrived promptly and the room was amazing. Breakfast was vast and excellent quality and the location was perfect for exploring the city. Pool area was great with really attentive pool people topping you up with ice cold water and fresh fruit. Will definitely stay again and will always look at this chain of hotels in future. Highly recommend!!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed as a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 teenagers) in 2 interconnecting ocean view rooms. The rooms were quite small, but well appointed albeit not high end luxury. The pool area was realy nice and definitely worth spenidng some time. Breakfast was good although very busy. We also ate at the japanese restaurant which had very good food although a little atmosphereless. As with most paces it seems in S E Asia, the service was faultless everytime. WiFi was not free! Overall a good hotel but the best thing was the location on the edge of Marina bay and with great views over the Big Wheel, Marina Sands hotel and the whole Bay.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for our 2 week holiday in Singapore. What can I say about this hotel... NOT A LOT, apart from it was brlliant... Fatastic location, and staff that will do anything to make sure your stay is memorable. The room (Suite) was very spacious and comfortable. The restuarants very good and staff that ensured you wanted for nothing. They also make sure you experience tastes you may not normally try, but bringing you complimentary samples. We ate at the Cherry Garden twice and where treated like royality but the staff there. You where made to feel like welcomed family and not customers. A must if you ever stop in this hotel. In fact, it is so popular that when we where there non hotel residents where eating there as well. If you plan to stay in…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My family and I have stayed at this hotel many times in Singapore and we keep going back for the service, location and the pool. Service here is top notch and everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Location is great. You are close to the city, but also you have access to Marina Square and Suntec so there are many shopping and food choices. The pool in my opinion is the best one in Singapore. My kids love it and it is very relaxing and peaceful. I would suggest to try to get a cabana if possible. It has a ceiling fan and a dock to listen to your music. The rooms are what you expect from a 5 star,they do not have the wow factor, but function well and have a comfortable bed. We love this hotel and can not wait to go back to Singapore to stay there.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Fabulous view in marina bay view room.. Kind and respectful staffs.. Beautiful and well- maintained swimming pool.. Very famous breakfast buffet MELT.. (So very crowded ) It was not the overstatement but the truth. I love MO!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Down stairs hotel is marina square very convenient for shopping and easy access around singapore, stayed over night had a very good dinner and good room service. The room corridor looks like haunted but its very nice, the balcony view is nice and windy. The rooms looks old but in good condition with a huge toilet. An ideal place to stay while in singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed at the Manderin Orenital with my wife for 8 nights, and I can only rave about the service we received from the service staff in the Melt Restaruant. Evan at check out I was suprised by the abiklity of the staff to

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The Hotel is good, but is actually a bit far from the Station, I went swimming and the people there are just chitchatting and not accomodating. Internet is a ripoff, 25 dollar a day... I stayed 4 days in this Hotel and expected the best since it is 5 star, but I guess I was wrong.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 2 nights as a stopover before heading to Bali. Firstly location wise I'm not sure you can do much better than the MO - turn left out of the hotel and it's an easy walk to the Singapore Flyer, Gardens by the Bay and Marina Bay Sands complex. Turn right out of the hotel and you've got a short walk to Boat Quay, Raffles, the Fullerton. Also the hotel is connected by a walkway to the Marina Square shopping complex (and therefore Suntec City behind that) so it's well located for shops. When we arrived in Singapore sadly Etihad had lost our luggage. Kathleen on the front desk and the lady at the concierge were very helpful and sympathetic to this problem. They offered to contact Singapore airport and Etihad on our behalf and kept trying…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed last weekend to catch the National Day Parade Preview and fireworks, and booked a Marina Bay room to enjoy the show. We really had a great stay - first, we were pleasantly surprised to find that we had been upgraded to a suite, which had an open balcony facing the bay, so we had the whole experience of view and sound. The room was luxurious, nice contemporary décor, with a big, soft and comfortable bed and huge bathroom. It was also fairly quiet, despite facing the Marina Bay stage area, and we were able to sleep well. Everything about the hotel exudes style, class and graciousness - from the room service, restaurants and pool area - and most of all, each and every staff member that we encountered, despite the hotel being fully occupied ! We're definitely becoming fans…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Whenever I travel to singapore I'll definitely be staying at this hotel. It has a great location overlooking marina bay within walking distance to the singapore flyer, marina bay sands shoppes, casino and gardens by the bay. There are also a few shopping centres right next door to the hotel including marina square where a staircase is located next to the hotel which will lead you inside and you will find a good money exchanger just as you enter. Aside from the location and breath taking views what makes this hotel so special is the staff. As soon as you arrive you receive outstanding customer service throughout the hotel, my partner and I ordered room service a few nights and everyone who served us were very friendly, polite and had a little chat with us about our day and tips…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We arrived early(7.00am) from France and were met at the door with a friendly warm personal greeting. Immediatly invited to Club level to check in, and then offered drink, food, and as early access to a room as possible. In a room by 10 am and freshened up shortly after, a most restfull 3 day stay followed. Without fail we received helpful quality service in all areas of the hotel, and I often wondered if I was wearing a name tag as everybody called us by our name and cosistantky offered any assistance sort. Special thanks to Samantha, Sunny, Princes, Joy, Eve and Cherry, and all the helpers that are too numerous to list. We love your style and felt we were magnificently looked after. We will make a special effort to visit again shortly.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: MO SIN Club level, Marina Bay room is the path to perfection. Arrived early in the day and was welcomed by a flawless staff into the Club lounge to enjoy the 19th floor view and cooked-to-order breakfast. My breath was taken away by the Marina Bay vantage from my room. Never felt the need to close the curtains for fear I'd miss the ever-changing Singapore city lights and harbor arrangements. Enjoyed the beautifully secluded, Hollywood like 5th floor swimming pool which they kept at perfect temperature relative to the outside. This hotel just happens to be located directly above the SG50 stage for Singapore's 50th Anniversary of independence. This was my first visit to Singapore and to this hotel but for sure, it will not be my last.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We returned - after one year - for another 7 night stay. Again we received faultless and fantastic service. Arriving from the airport by taxi we were already greeted by our names. Awsome! Check-in was in the room and as returning guests we felt really back home. We got a room on a high floor (as requested) and a 20% discount in their food outlets. Very welcoming. Breakfast at Melt is fantastic. On the first morning they also remembered our names and even knew what drinks we are had the year before. This is unbeatable! Pool area is fantastic - service there again perfect. Drinks and little snacks are provided regularly. The room (refurbished) was fantastic with absolutely stunning views of Singapore downtown. You should go for a marina bay view room - little extra but worth…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is the third time we have stayed at MO Singapore over a period of 4 years. The quality of the hotel, facilities and staff are at the highest level. We usually arrive from a longhaul flight, quite tired and needing time to ourselves to relax. The checkin process is very efficient and in no time we are in an extremely comfortable room. Highly recommended for both business and leisure travel.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We were very satisfied. And it was very happy trip in Mandarin oriental, Especially in swimming pool. Staffs were very kind. and breakfast was excellent I want to go again Mandarin Oriental Hotel. Thank you

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for three nights and loved our whole stay. Check-in was very quick and the reception staff were extremely polite and friendly. We were given a room on the 16th floor with an amazing view over Marina Bay. The room was perfect; spotlessly clean, comfy bed, plenty of storage space, perfect air conditioning, nice seating area and desk, wonderful bathroom - no complaints. What really stood out at this hotel was the level of customer service e.g. front desk, breakfast time, concierge, staff in the Axis Bar and Morton's, pool area staff - all were so attentive and friendly. The breakfast buffet was fantastic - almost too much choice! We enjoyed an early evening drink at Axis, where delicious complimentary snacks were served alongside our drinks. We also went…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights over the weekend and that coincided with the National Day rehearsal. From the 17th floor, the hotel has a wonderful view of both the Marina Bay Sands as well as the CBD skyline, which in my opinion is the best angle, especially during twilight. The view of the fireworks against the backdrop of the city is unforgettable. The service was, as usual, excellent. This is consistent with my experience years ago. We were so pleasantly surprised with a towel and bottle of water after completing a run around the bay, which is also a must do. Even the staff at the really busy breakfast restaurant, Melt, tried their very best in spite of the workload. The management tries its best to maintain the property. But the rooms are getting tired. A very pleasant stay.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I usually choose a hotel for the pool and location.This one did not disappoint. I swam laps every morning with the best view ever.We paid a bit extra and got a club room on the 19th floor.The Club Room Staff bent over backwards to help us with all our queries.The view was astounding.The Singapore Flyer,the largest floating stadium in the world,the Helix Bridge, Gardens by the Bay,the Marina Bay Sands and Marina Bay out to the ocean.The Hop On Hop Off Bus left from outside and the fantastic Gluttons Bay food markets, closing at 2am Saturdays was just over the road.All restaurants at this hotel are world class.Staff wonderful.I can't wait to go back!!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is one amazing hotel, everything was perfect during my stay! Great view, great pool, great service, excellent breakfast ! Quiet and clean room, super comfy bed ! It's attached to a mall, there's a foodcourt and Starbucks, 7-11 ...etc, very convenient!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Definitely one of the best hotel in Singapore, excellent services and staff, superbe swiming pool with beautiful view on the bay. Nice restaurants, bar, and good foods. Nice fitness too with d^good advices.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Rushed trip- made to feel very welcome and supported from the hotel staff. As always high standard of service and room finish.The rooms were clean and we'll appointed.Available in room facilities were good for a short stay

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Mandarin oriental is very good hotel in singapore. This hotel has good swimming pool. Most of staffs are nice. Breakfast buffet serves variety menu. I will consider to choose this hotel again next visit in Singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I stayed for two nights on business - my Ocean View room was on the 17th floor and had superb views, but the Marina View rooms offer a slightly better vista, and the Marina Bay Suites enable guests to watch the Singapore Grand Prix from the comfort of their own balconies. Dining options at the Mandarin Oriental were superb - the Cherry Garden deserves a particularly mention for their home brewed soy used in a fantatic steamed cod dish. As with all Mandarin Oriental hotels the service is second to none - plenty of staff, and a world-class spa experience. There is a proper gym (for business folks who need a burst of activity), plus a lovely outdoor yoga area where the rustling of bamboo creates a world apart from the bustle of the city below.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed here for 10 nights... All round great hotel, with several minor issues as follows 1. Aircon in room not as cold with finicky thermostat 2. Front line staff needs training to listen more rather than just jumping to conclusion Other than that, great stay and will be back...

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Great service during our wedding here including: Wedding Planner Ball room filled with orchestra Ice statues Great wedding banquet Music and Toast Masters Wedding cards Gifts Guest VIP treatment Wedding night stay Also spent other holidays here including great buffet with champagne

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Came to Singapore for a business trip and booked 4 nights on a club floor at the Mandarin. Have been coming to this hotel for years and it has always been my go to hotel when coming to Singapore. What gave the Mandarin its charm is their service and the very accommodating staff. Unfortunately, on my last trip I was left extremely disappointed. Booked a hotel room for one guest accidentally instead of for two. The difference online when booking was USD 36 a night (basically for the extra person club lounge usage). However, when I informed the hotel on check-in they wanted to charge an extra SGD 120 per night (USD 100) for the extra guest club lounge use. Now I don't mind paying extra but I do not appreciate getting screwed, especially at a hotel I have been coming to for…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Unfortunately I only spent 7 hours in the hotel, but it felt a very special place, not least because of the wonderful view over the marina. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and solved my issues with the wifi swiftly. I'd loved to have spent more time here to enjoy the hotel fully.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is located just opposite to Marina Bay. The view from room is very nice. Especially at night, the view of Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay is just mesmerizing . We recieved a warm welcome on the arrival and the staffs are very courteous and professional. The best service I have ever seen in any hotel. The rooms are very spacious, modern and beautiful. The bathroom is also very spacious with a beautiful bath tub. The room is filled with all the modern ammenities. The room service is excellent. The buffet breakfast is just amazing. They have a huge variety of breakfast menu which includes Indian dishes too. I just loved my stay in Mandarin and will highly recommend this hotel.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Excellent for everthing, staffs, service, accomdation, specially moring meals. Swimming pool is also very good. Specailly marina bay view is very nice. I will make a reservation next time to stay in Mandarin Oriental.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: To be fair to this property, I stayed here just 2 nights until my client moved me to a sister hotel (I presume to save money?), so my experience is a short but very pleasant - I did not want to move out........ I find the Waterfront area of Singapore confusing and very easy to get lost when walking. The advantage of the Mandarin Oriental is the location and the superb views offer from the hotel - the hotel is a landmark which I used as a guide while exploring the area. The property is not crass or faux opulent, its classy with excellent facilities throughout. the rooms a spacious and well appointed with modern fixtures and fittings. as is often the case in Asian Hotels, the staff are a class ahead of European colleagues, being helpful, friends and knowledgable - for me this…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this hotel as our regular hotels were fully booked. I remember The "Oriental" back in the 80's when I lived in Singapore but had never given it mush thought before. This trip, our host, booked us at this hotel as it was close to their office and we were driving. The experience from the time we arrived at the was amazing. I felt I had arrived home after a long time away. The welcome was genuinely warm and concerned. The car valet informed us that parking was complimentary and said he would look after my classic car very well during the stay, taking note of the small scratches and a dink in the paint work as he did. Ha! Ha! Our check-in was totally hassle free and I liked the old fashioned way of ensuring we were who we said we were. (Can we have your ID…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days. This was my second time and it was great as always. The hotel manager was very kind and staffs, too. Great location. It is very near to most of tourist attractions. Good breakfast.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I had a staycation and the room has an awesome view. It faces the marina bay sands and Marina Bay. What impresses me is the staff are all well-trained and they pay attention to the smallest detail. I was at the Melt café having breakfast and next to me was a family with a kid. They asked the staff to take a family photo but the child was not looking at the camera. The staff didn't just take the photo but took effort to capture the kid's attention before taking the picture. The room has a huge tv and your name will be displayed on it when you enter. The bed is comfortable and there is a layer of comforter that makes you sink into it when you rest on it. With the awesome view, one could just sit there and watch the world goes by.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights en route to Indonesia. Having spent 3 months in residence at the hotel while working in Singapore some 25 years ago, we thought we would stay again for old time's sake. Well Singapore has certainly changed but the hotel has maintained, if not exceeded, the high standard they set all those years ago. Everything was first class. A well appointed room with a panoramic view over the Marina Bay Area and the business centre skyscrapers, friendly and efficient staff at all levels, excellent buffet breakfast and a good pool area with staff bringing iced water, little smoothies and fresh fruit skewers throughout the day. Great location too. The only downside was the price of food and beverages, if not included as part of your package. A Tiger beer was…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I stayed this hotel introduced by credit card company, and decided to stay here because knowing that this hotel is one of the first class hotels in the world. If you would like to enjoy shopping in singapore, the location is a little bit inconvenient for going around. For buffet restaurant, I was a little bit disappointed for the food varieties.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: A better hotel in a better location you will not find in Singapore. Lives up to and even exceeds Mandarin Oriental standards. Exceptional service beyond compare. I look no further when traveling to Singapore on business.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We booked a Marina View Club room as our base to explore Singapore and found the entire Mandarin Oriental experience to be superb. From the moment we arrived and were escorted to our room to complete check-in, to the moment we left the service from all staff was outstanding. The Club Lounge team in particular were welcoming and friendly, always remembering who we were and our preferences. They also maintained a classy and exclusive feel to the Club Lounge, where the dress code appeared to be politely enforced and there was always a quiet and relaxing ambience. The room we stayed in was well appointed and quite spacious, with all the facilities you would expect of a premium hotel. The view of the Marina Bay and Downtown Financial District was breathtaking, especially at…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The hotel was recommended by my Centurion consultant and the offer looked good. When I arrived at Changi the driver was waiting and took me to the hotel. Very nice transfer. It was a warm welcome and was immediately taken to the 18th floor by a receptionist who showed me the layout and controls of the room. A very quick checking and my luggage had arrived by then already. The room had an excellent view overlooking the marina. On Saturday night there was a show rehearsal for the National Day Parade. What a show of fireworks and parade of the Singaporean military vehicles. Jet overhead, helicopter flying formation etc. I had the best seat to watch the display from my room which had a very large panorama window. The breakfast was magnificent from service to food selection. Lunch at…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Kind staff, fantastic view, good location !!! But can not use free wifi. Swimmig pool is so nice at night time. Breakfast is nice, too. And can go Marina squar shopping center easily. I will visit mandarin oriental again.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My wife booked our stay of 4 nights here as a lay over from our trip to Europe. She got a great deal of under aud $300 a night. From the moment we were let out of cab till the time we got in a cab to leave the service here is impeccable. Staff are always close by to attend to your every need whether it be by the pool or the concierge desk. They are not stuffy. Just friendly and willing to help. We had a harbour view room on the 13th floor and it was spectacular. The bed is comfy and so are the soft pillows. This is not a cheap hotel. So for those of you who are middle class like us be prepared to have your wallets ravaged. This place is expensive. A glass of beer by the pool will set you back around $20. A club sandwich about $28. Dinner at dolce vita - well you won't get…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: One of the best hotels in Singapore with exceptional, personal service attention to detail. Aside from the very high quality of the hotel and the rooms themselves, I found the following made a difference: * The Sound system – while not being a surround sound, was above the average compared to other hotels, excellent sound and you can tell a subwoofer is concealed and brings bass to the music or TV * The music server with ability to pick from a music database on the TV interface – really good and intune with our digital era * I had to check out super early to catch a flight before breakfast available time, while talking to the front desk the night before, they offered to prepare takeaway breakfast for me – great anticipation of the need * Loved the choice at breakfast * Loved…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: An excellent team effort , quality ,service and value from in my opinion the best hotel in Singapore and having been a guest there on numerous occasions my obvious first choice whenever I return , well done to all the team !

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Excellent top class Hotel at fair price level in one of the most beautiful and vibrating areas of Singapore. The location and the services are top class in particular the breakfast service is a hit! Rooms are well equipped and quite large. The beds are a bit soft. Still very recommendable Hotel!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is a great option when staying in Singapore. Nice bars and restaurants, terrific breakfasts, superb staff, high-end rooms and a lovely pool area. We stayed 3 nights and the restaurant staff in particular couldn't have been more helpful, providing advice on suitable dishes and insights into local cuisine. If I'm back in Singapore, I'll be back at the Mandarin Oriental.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I don't normally write on these things but our stay was absolutely fantastic, i felt i had to write to let others know. I had done a lot of reading about hotels but ultimately i chose MO for the pool :) However, it wasnt the pool that made the stay so amazing it was the staff and the service there. We turned up rather early to the hotel after a long night flight. I had rang ahead and they told me it wouldnt be an issue to stay by the pool until my check in time. Once there we were greeted by a very friendly gentleman who allowed us to check in early, which was amazing. The view from the room was spectacular and we slept with the curtains open at night so that i could look out at it. Thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet. Plenty of choices and all seemingly fresh. …

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Mandarin Oriental hotel is an excellent choice at the Marina Bay area since the room rate is considerably affordable. Best of all, the Marina Square shopping mall and mrt is right behind the hotel. Tnx

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: all of services are fantastic In swimming pools and room ,you can see wonderful views nice room and morning buffet and tropical juice are excellant and early in the morning you can enjoy jooging through river bridge

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Got married at this hotel 5 years ago, hence wanted to relive the magic during our anniversary. Hotel gave us a complimentary upgrade to oceanview suite with complimentary wine and cake. i have stayed in more expensive hotels in Singapore such as Capella's villa and Marina Bay Sands Suites, MO is still our preferred choice of stay. The service from check in/out, dining, room service, concierge was extraordinary. Would definitely be back again.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was absolutely incredible, from the fresh squeezed tropical juices to the chef curated meats, curries, hand made yogurts, crepes, pancakes, potatoes, french pastries with a veritable smorgasbord of delicacies and flavors from the entire world! The best part about this amazing breakfast was the espresso which was made with the finest beans I have ever tasted! To top this all off, the manager of the dining room would not only greet me every morning, he gave travel tips, suggestions and a wonderful smile!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We always prefer to stay in Mandarin every time we are in Singapore. Friendly staffs and convenient location are the best that this hotel has. We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoy every night of them. The downfall of it was the long queue for check-in, otherwise everything is perfecto!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I had been staying in this hotel for 2 weeks and I must admit that I'm completely satisfied with its service. The room was bright and always clean. Laundry service also impressed with its attitude. I can recommend this hotel as good place to stay.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Was greeted by everyone when enter the hotel. Jacqualine who check into my room. Everything was fast and accurate for the check in. Was direct by Jacqualine to our room, she was a cheerful and always wearing a smile on her face. We were check into a suite room. It was a newly renovated room. Room was perfect in condition hardly find any fault from the room. The spa at the mandarin oriental was a great experience. That no where I've enjoy and experience the other spa before, service was great. The breakfast at the Melt was excellent, great variety and choices. Ryan was very attentive and Anshul was very helpful. Not forgetting Deva and Edwin who assist with out luggage. It was truly an enjoyable stay with Mandarin Oriental.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Easily one of the most pleasant hotels I have stayed at. The staff new me by name within a very short time and were very attentive to my needs. Concierge was very helpful with my lost luggage. Will bring my family here next time.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Bay facing room with excellent views of Marina Bay. Room well equipped and furnished with IPod dock. Lovely swimming pool and spa area and good bars and restaurants within the hotel complex. Excellent usage of the internal spaces, zen/minimalist type interior design in Mandarin Oriental style.
