My 6th visit in the last 18 months, fabulous hotel and at a good location. Service was excellent. WiFi though should be free to all.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Always a highlight to visit Singapore and stay at this hotel. You must have a drink in Morton's during happy hour. Enjoy the service and great location. Restaurants are all good and. You also have the shopping centre at the back of the hotel for some good alternative food venues,

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is an absolutely fabulous hotel and I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental hotel in Singapore a few times and each time I have had marvelous stay. The hotel is modern and beautiful and the rooms are very spacious and provide a luxurious stay. The rooms with the pool view and with the view of the CBD skyline are the best which are show to make a first time visitor go WOW! The hotel is located close to Esplanade theaters by the bay and the Marina mall, providing one with excellent food and sightseeing options just a stones throw away. What sets the Mandarin Oriental apart from the other hotels though is the human touch, one is assured of a quick and fuss free check in and an attention to detail by the staff whatever part of the hotel you are. The front desk, room…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Very friendly staff in a great location near the Marina. The breakfast is fantastic and the rooms spacious. You can go jogging around the Marina (approx. 3.3 km) and get a towel and a bottle of water when you arrive back at the hotel.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: A very warm welcome from extremely hospitable and friendly staff greeted us in this luxury hotel. The view of the marina from our bedroom was splendid. The service in the dining rooms was excellent too. We were recognised at breakfast on the second morning and presented with a framed photo of us taken during breakfast as we left the restaurant only minutes later. Faultless.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I was planning to surprise my family who were staying in this hotel. I arranged everything prior for an extra bed later on. Staff were very helpful and excited for the surprise at check in. Club lounge room very spacious and big. However if possible get a view of the bay and not looking over sun tec City. In the room there was always quite a bothersome high pitched noise coming from the TV. We also had some troubles working the light switches. But these are not big issues. The beds are fantastic and so comfy! Once you are laying in them you do not want to leave. Gym is great but would have loved if the work out room was cooler. It was very hot when working out. Was a/c on? Very friendly staff at gym who provide water as soon as you finish your bottle. That's MO service. …

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My prefered hotel whenever I stay in Singapore. The staff are welcoming and attentive. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed for business travel. The Melt Cafe has one of the best breakfast selections that I have come across anywhere in the world.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I've always wanted to stay at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore because it's always rated as one of the best, if not the best, hotel in Singapore. I finally had the opportunity when I found a very reasonable rate recently. Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed with the experience. The common areas of the hotel were gorgeous, as one would expect of any Mandarin Oriental. I loved the pool, though it was quite crowded. The rooms, however, felt rather dated, and in dire need of a refresh, especially given the intense competition from so many newer or recently renovated hotels. The furniture had visible marks of wear and tear. The entertainment system felt like it was from a decade ago; everything was very manual. I'm so used to having an iPod/iPhone docking station in every hotel I…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I already mentioned my complaint. Everything is really good except cavana. One more thing, there have wi-fi in good hotels. nowdays, it is really important free wifi. i would like to give free wifi to customers.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Perfect location with very nice room layout Excellent staff Huge breakfast restaurant (The Melt) Thier taste is so nice. Fresh fruits and variety of foods The nearest MRT is Esplanade station. It takes about 5 mins walk via Marina Mall link

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Despite this being the first time I stayed at Mandarin Oriental Singapore, by the second morning, I was made to feel as if I had been a regular guest for years and the staff had already remembered my name. The buffet breakfast was wonderful and there was a huge range of options available to choose from. I also experienced afternoon tea, lunch at the cafe and a drink by the poolside bar overlooking the bay. They food and service were all exceptional. Some reviews state that the hotel is looking dated, but I found everything to be maintained perfectly. The carpets, decor and bathroom fittings all looked as new. I will never forget the warmth and service from the staff and out of all of the places I have visited, this must be the best hotel in terms of service level. I…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Just a lovely hotel. Friendly welcome, great room with great view of Singapore and a perfect location. Staff were very attentive and friendly in an easy and genuine way. Couldn't fault anything on my stay. Maybe the food in the pool area is overpriced, but that's to be expected.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We recently visited Singapore for the first time (March 2015) and stayed at the mandarin oriental hotel. The staff were lovely and very helpful. We had a Harbourview room, and were not disappointed. We were able to watch the laser light show from the marina Bay sands hotel from our room, truly spectacular. The rooms are quite large, but really only accomodate 2 people as the beds are only a king single size or 1 king bed. The suites may have more space for more people, but are more expensive also. The hotel has a side entrance directly connected to a shopping centre.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Breakfast had a great selection of hot and cold. Staff very friendly. Wonderful view of the bay and a great night food market just across the road. We were picked up by hotel car very prompt. Close to shops and easy to get the hop on hop off from just across the road

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My wife and I wanted a weekend break from the kids but couldn't leave the country in case of an emergency. We had a fantastic 2 days, made better with the SG50 deal. Definitely a thing to redo every 6 months.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Don't bother to consider other hotels in Singapore, this hotel moves hotels to a new realm. It is like a modern art gallery with bedrooms. The staff really do know how to work with busy business guests. They don't waste your time, think of everything and remember you. This is my perfect hotel. And the food is excellent.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Very classy beautiful hotel with a perfect balance of Eastern style with modern design. Superlative service across the board, be it at check-in, restaurants, gym, etc..The view of the harbor from the upper floors is breathtaking, as is the serpentine of ceramic pottery while descending in the well designed elevator shaft. Not an inexpensive place, but worth every penny if you can afford it.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Really wanted to stay at MBS but could not get a room for the Saturday night ( I find this really hard to believe but I digress ) A couple of recommendations from some reliable hotel fanatic friends found us staying here for 2 nights and wow , what a treat! The only negative about the hotel is that you don't want to leave to explore the city! Exceptional service. Nothing is too much trouble. Our room took in the city view and a view of MBS, so you really get the best of both worlds. The Mandarin Oriental chain has never really been on my radar but it certainly is now!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Super luxurious hotel. Reserving a "club harbour" room meant check-in handled by a lovely young woman while seated in our hotel room. She then took requests from us and left to make dinner reservations on our behalf. The view was stupendous. A view over the marina area with the iconic marina bay sands hotel across the water. (Far better to have a view of MBS than to stay there, we believe.)

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Good hotel with a great pool. But The club suite facilities are poor with little variety of food and restrictions on alcohol availability. And the prices for food and drinks on there menus is outrageous. $26 for a glass of Prosecco.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I have stayed here many times for business (usually only for a night or two). It's a brilliantly located hotel. Staff here are always so friendly and welcoming. Choice of restaurants is good - very good quality food and service, although some are a little pricey. The Italian restaurant by the pool is always a popular choice among my colleagues. The rooms are so well-appointed and the layout is great. They're a very comforting room. I've had to spend a day working in my room before and it was one of the best hotel rooms I've had to work in! Mandarin Oriental is renowned for quality and the Singapore property sure lives up to the reputation.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed for one night on route to Hong Kong and we were so happy we did. The rooms were clean and spacious and the views of Marina Bay are breathtaking. Breakfast was amazing, a grand selection to suit everyone. Walking distance to alot of sights.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: It is a MO so you cant get wrong with it, my favorite thing in this hotel is the pool and also the gym - never too busy and you get all attention that you need when you need. I was there 2 times and loved both occasions.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Came to Singapore for business. I loved the bed, super comfortable. Room is spacious and well decorated. The bathroom has a standing shower and bathtub with excellent amenities. I went to the pool, and staff there was super attentive, setting the lounge chair, bringing cold water and replenishing. The fitness center is small but has the basics. Good quality equipment. Variety for breakfast at Melt World cafe is excellent and very nice and friendly staff. Very well located, walking distance everywhere! Definitely worth a visit.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Booked a suite there for my friends's wedding. I think the hotel has one of the best views of the central business district and marina bay sands. Very nice and helpful hotel staff who helped us to decorate the bridal cars. The hotel is a bit far away from the mrt station though.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This hotel was by far one of the best I have ever stayed in. The design and character were excellent and the staff simply amazing. Nothing was too hard and everyone fussed over us and made us feel at home. The pool area was stunning wether to swim or just to have a drink. The restaurant staff were exceptional and the food at the three restaurants in the hotel we dined at was simply stunning. I'll definitely stay at this hotel next time I'm in Singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Fantastic venue for getting around Singapore. Within walking distance to most attractions. The hotel, food, rooms and service and views are outstanding. I would not stay anywhere else. The bed was so comfortable we slept for 15hrs solid...not good for us wanting to sightsee, but definitely refreshing. However the hop on and off bus passed the hotel front, so this allowed us easy access to the whole of Singapore. The staff were very friendly and courteous at all times, even thought the hotel reception had the bustle of any big city hotel. Wonderful and fully recommend.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great for shopping, the rooms were clean and tidy. The breakfast was overpriced in my opinion but was of a very good quality. Overall good value for money for the location and considering the costs of staying in Singapore

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 days and enjoyed the stay. But its my first time at this hotel and I was slightly disappointed. I won't say where I normally stay when in Singapore or other Asian cities, but for some reason this Mandarin Oriental di'd not quite tick all my boxes. There were some little niggles which just took away the edge - like the two or three set of steps in the Melt café( why do designers put steps around - is it to give the staff something to do or is it to keep the guests alert??), the WC in a gents restroom on the 5th floor where there is no hook at all to hang a jacket whilst in there, towels which are hung up each morning but then are still replaced, and dim sum at breakfast which were only just warm. So great rooms, very attentive and helpful staff but not as…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Our favourite hotel in Singapore. The best location on Marina Bay. Attentive staff who can't do enough to please. We were greeted by name each morning at breakfast and the breakfast was fabulous. We were not happy with Morton's and won't be recommending this restaurant to anyone. Overall we cannot fault this exceptional hotel and we very much enjoyed our stay.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This hotel is amazing and the breakfast selection was fab best ever and I've stayed at top hotels staff did everything you required very helpful everything went smoothly I really recommended this hotel if your traveling to Singapore

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This hotel is reliably excellent. The staff anticipate your needs but are not intrusive. Luxurious but discrete and stylish. The restaurants are excellent. The pool area is like a resort. A most enjoyable stay!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights to break up the journey home from Lombok Indonesia. Fabulous hotel with excellent customer service. Great location to explore the harbour and walk some of the formula one circuit! Always a fan of Mandarin Oriental hotels and their exceptional attention to detail. Will certainly go back.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Easy access to the center of Singapore, Marina Bay Sands, Esplanade, etc. Enjoyed pleasant stay at the hotel with fully-equipped amenities. Efficiency of check-in and welcome hospitality. Comfortable bed with overall excellent cleanliness.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: In Singapore the Business Hotel having the perfect match of value for money.Right level of service being available when needed but also not too much. Location of the hotel very convinient for Business trips but at the same time at a very nice spot.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Great pool area and the champange brunch is amazing (not cheap, however). The club lounge is very nice. Had a great room over looking the MBS hotel, I suspect I was upgraded based on prior states at the MO chain. I would stay here again in a second. You could just waste away the day in the oppressive SIN heat at the pool.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: It was a good experience to stay in this Hotel. They truly care about their customers. From the beginning to the end I couldn't fault anything. My room was superb with beautiful views and it had everything I need it. Dining experience was very pleasant as well and the swimming pool with views so enjoyable. Thanks for this good experience and keep going with your good work!!!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We couldn't have been looked after better in this lovely hotel. The service levels from all the staff we encountered were above expectations. Pool was delightful with the staff attentive even there. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a luxury holiday in Singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: 1. Friendly and helpful staff 2. Staff really anticipate your needs. For example, went for a morning run around Marina Bay and upon returning to the hotel feeling very sweaty and thirsty, a member greeted me with a towel and a bottle of mineral water. Did not get this attention at MBS or Shangri La. 3. Buffet Breakfast is simply awesome. The diversity of selection is huge and the food is great! 4. My young son had an accident in the bed. Called housekeeping and sheets were changed immediately. 5. Had an issue with the bathroom after day 1. There was an issuing with the plumbing. Upon report, the problem was attended to straight away. Due to the complexity of the issue, we changed rooms and really appreciated the upgrade. 6. The 180 degree view of Marina Bay was simply…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: book a club room as you can enjoy many benefits of drinks lunches afternoon tea and pre dinner cocktails We we're up graded to a room with a balcony the view wasn't as fabulous but more spacious I would recommend asking if you could change from a club to a balcony The swimming pool is very impresses with lovely cabanas we had lunch over looking the pool which I would recommend The staff are so helpful especially the concierge in the club room as they arranged all our reservations and travel itenery as we island hoping Nothing was to much trouble I would highly recommend this hotel a 5 star service and amazing views

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights at the Mandarin Oriental, room was excellent with a Marina Bay view, we ate in 3 of the restaurants and they were all excellent, but what really made the trip special was the staff and their care to detail. Malou Garcia, one of the managers in the Melt restaurant could not of been more helpful, she went out of her way to find a missing package.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the hotel after a week in Phuket. We love the Mandarin Oriental hotels due to the excellent service and attention to detail. We stayed in a City Suite with two kids and this worked very well (2 rollaways in the living room). The Harbour suite is amazing (previous stay) but we liked the layout of the city suite as it is slightly bigger in the living area. Buffet breakfast and dinner are amazing with so much choice which really puts Australian hotels to shame. We also tried Mortons Steakhouse and had a great meal there too. We will always stay at Mandarin Oriental properties in Asia.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: A wonderful Hotel centrally located. Reception staff and efficiency of check-in and check-out were excellent. Room was large with possibly the best views of Singapore (and Marina Bay Sands). Bed was very comfortable. Internet worked effectively. We had heard good things about the high tea on level 4 and it did not disappoint. Huge selection of very tasty treats. Overall, we would definitely stay here again. The wonderful and happy staff throughout this Hotel is what made this experience extra special for us. Well done!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Excellent service. Most comfortable hotel I hav stayed in for a long time Rooms are great and the staff is amazing. Only thing I can think of that is missing is a free wifi... Locatin and service is just perfect

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Hotel very central to everything. Walking distance to Marina bay. Beautiful place, luxury. The staff are fantastic, service is on par with some of the top hotels in the world, everyone is just so nice and hospitable. This was except around the pool where a few people had obviously reserved the much sought cabanas, which went against their policy of removing towels if they weren't used in a period of time. One gentleman had one reserved for himself all afternoon despite sitting on them no more than 20 mins, the staff felt reluctant to move his towels and free it up, especially when he disappeared from the pool area for a few hours. Food at restaurants is expensive and makes it a little prohibitive to eat everyday there. Rooms are small, this is my main gripe. Once my suitcases…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We spent the Christmas of 2014 here with the family. We had booked this hotel 6 months ahead and got the City Suite Pakage. I booked two Suites, one for the children and their grandmother and one for myself and my wife. Unfortunately we could not get connecting suites as they were on two sides of the corridor. The rooms were very large with a sting area, very comfortable large beds and a beautiful bathroom. The hotel is connected to a Mall, you just have to walk out the front and climb two flights of steps and you are in the mall. There are four malls connected by walkways that go over the streets so you don't have to be outdoors at all. Which was great as it rained three out of the five days we were there. The breakfast at the hotel which was inclusive was great and the…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Check in was not brilliant...was kept waiting for about an hour while they found the room that we booked without trying to charge extra for it, no offer of seating or drink. The room itself was very nice, all amenities and great view over Singapore Flyer and Marina. The Club Lounge was very good, plenty of food and drink but rather outdated rules on dress code for both men and women. Would have no problem with the rules at night but for breakfast and afternoon tea it was inconvenient. Timing is 5.30 to 7.30 which I find a bit too early, they do have champagne... just ask, and it is no smoking, you have to go down to 5th floor or outside hotel. Pool area is really nice and staff in general were very good. Would recommend to anyone who does not smoke (although this was…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel along with pan pacific as they were close to where we were working at the Grand Prix, rooms were very nice and comfortable, bathrooms very clean, the view from the room was to die for especially at night when the track was lit up, room service was as expected for a hotel of this calibre, the building itself is quite impressive with the huge lifts to the floors, we had room service when at the hotel most of the time, being a night race we ate at unsociable hours, the food was very good and still hot when arriving at the room. The hotel is well situated, close to the flyer and gardens, the pool area was clean and although we only managed to swim in there one day we felt comfortable and enjoyed the relaxing break. would definitely recommend this hotel along…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Beautiful property..excellent spread for Indian Breakfast... Perfect location for all sightseeings in Singapore... Cannot think of staying at other hotel on next visit... Although wifi is too costly..should be complimentary for fare paid.. overall worth it

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We loved staying at this hotel. Close to the Harbour, across from Chinatown and walking distance to both the Singapore Flyer and the Gardens by the Bay. Checkin service was impeccable, and out interactions with staff at all times was very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were beautifully presented and in a lovely setting (we ate outside on the terrace).

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I was attending a training session in Singapore, and I decided to go the extra mile and book a luxury hotel with a great view to the marina. I selected the Mandarin Oriental because of it's vantage location and the excellent reputation of the brand. I won't say a lot, I will only say it's an EXCELLENT CHOICE. For approx. 340 EUR/night I had a fantastic view of the marina, everything in front of me from The Float and the lotus flower and the iconic huge "Marina Bay Sands" hotel till the Merlion. The service is exemplary in all aspects. No comments whatsoever. The cost might push some people away, but the trick is that a decent hotel in Singapore costs no less than 240 EUR/night. Don't make the mistake to compare this hotel with budget properties throughout the city. If the…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Great location with a room that had fantastic views overlooking Marina Bay. My trip was made so enjoyable by the courteous staff who helped me with everything from international power sockets to shopping tours and finding local fishing shops inside a city metropolis! Fabulous food at the buffet which I ate at for Breakfast , Lunch and Dinner over my 5 days. Lunch was way amazing and would leave no person with even the biggest and fussiest appetite hungry.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The Service is most helpful and friendly. Rooms and food are simply excellent. Unfortunately, one bar (the round house) closed a bit early for me but there was another bar in the hotel with excellent coctails. I was very happy that I got an upgrade (I almost got lost in my big rooms :) I also enjoyed the superb swimming pool.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: One week stay for business conference at same hotel, had all meetings and nearly all meals on site. Service is quite good, staff very attentive and professional. Rooms are nicely done. Meeting rooms are very comfortable. Food and service served at meeting venues and at restaurants is very good quality. Location is nice in Marina Bay area - more than one shopping mall within walking distance. Roof top bar (pool area) nice place to relax al fresco.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying one night at this luxury hotel on a short Asia trip. Possible to hold the room until 20h on the day of arrival makes it more flexible for those returning to Europe with the evening flights. Got a very nice room on 12th floor overlooking the beautiful Marina Bay Sands. They have a delicate and large pool area, several fine dining places and a nice bar (Axis Bar and Lounge) with a good view on the forth floor. The breakfast is rather hectic, but they offer a wide selection of breakfast cousins in the Melt World Cafe. Nice spacious bathroom with both shower and bathtub. The beds are heavenly. I needed to get my suit pressed within 45 minutes and they delivered after 30. Brilliant service and this hotel is just what you wish for after a long flight.…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights for business. I would say overall the staff are very helpful and good but I thought the hotel was substandard. First of all it's very dark and gloomy - I was craving natural light all the time. Second, sound proofing in the room was terrible. I could clearly hear TV from next room and also when their phone rang. One crazy thing is that Housekeeping switch on the TV when doing turn down service so one evening all I could hear was the TV playing the "welcome screen" to my neighbour. I called to complain and it was resolved quickly but I should not have to hear all this in a luxury hotel. I used the swimming pool on my last day - there was no good changing facilities (I had checked out of my room already). I had to change in a tiny cramped shower room and was…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I recently stayed here and has been a long time since i was back. The rooms are large and very well appointed. The beds are extremely comfortable and the room contains everything you need. Bathrooms are large and have a separate bath tub, I was lucky and got a room with a balcony. The staff here are very very friendly and extremely helpful. Take a drink at the bar by the pool and you will enjoy one of Singapore's great city views. I also stay at Mandarin in HK and great to see consistency.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I have stayed many times in this hotel and continue to be impressed with the excellent service. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. The hotel is in a good location and I would recommend a harbour view room. There is always something going on in the marina area. I would also recommend a club room. The club is a great place to relax after a busy day in Singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The mandarin oriental is particularly well placed for "seeing" Singapore. Whether you are out walking round the sites, nipping out to Chinatown or just reviewing the splendid surroundings whilst floating on your back in the pool. This is an excellent hotel, great staff, cleaner than clean, food in the hotel as you would expect is simply amazing whether room service, bar or China valley Cantonese. If uou want to be lazy there are cabanas at the pool? Energetic - great gym. I know the name is scared but negotiate a good price, as there are plenty of hotels in Singapore keen for your business. This just happens to be one of the best.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Everything about my stay at this hotel was a disappointment. Front desk staff were robotic, there was a long wait to get my room, and when I finally got upstairs, the room was tiny and very worn looking, i.e. only vaguely refreshed 1980s vintage decor. All of this might have been forgiven, but then the drain in the shower was so slow that I had to shower quickly to prevent it from overflowing and a room service meal arrived after a 45 minutes delay and was half wrong. It took another 30 minutes for the 'correct' part of the meal to arrive, and then they forgot the condiments. Given the eye-watering prices this place charges, it should be much, much, much better, and as I said, this experience will make me honestly leary of staying in a Mandarin Oriental hotel again.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed here as a stopover travelling back from New Zealand and immediately wished we could stay longer We booked a Club Marina Bay room and it was really well appointed and spacious. The views to the Marina Bay were uninterrupted and stunningly impressive. We loved everything about the hotel and the staff and their commitment to us having a great time in their hotel. The breakfasts in the Club room were impressive in both their range and their quality again the staff were attentive without being too obtrusive. Try the pool and terrace are if you get time it is hugely attractive open and looks a great place to relax (we were too rushed and found it too late in the day to enjoy it ourselves) I am sure we will return here and certainly it will be our first choice in Singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Our family of four stayed for three nights at the MO - we swtiched from our usual Grand Hyatt to try out the Marina Bay location. We were upgraded to a City View Suite which was spacious but frankly lacked the Mandarin Oriental "oomph" factor, especially since they had been recently renovated (or so we were told). The room was furnished in light wood and had basic furnishings: couches, coffee table, lamps. I thought the Grand Hyatt suite was more impressive. Service was of a very high standard and that is where we thought it beat the Grand Hyatt. Nothing was too much for the staff. We had dinner at Melt (the hotel coffee shop) and received warm hospitality from Mr. Alex Wong, the Assistant Manager. He made sure that my young children were well looked after, and gave very good…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: A short 2 night stay for business. All of the staff were very professional, friendly and very helpfulful. The hotel facilities are great and the rooms are very comfortable. I had a room with balcony/patio, which was good to have on a nice warm day in Singapore. A great hotel and a great stay.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, very convenient location, professional staff, good and big spread in breakfast, great crowd, nice view from the room of the marina. Little expensive but worth it. Will go again next time with family.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Had a good stay The hotel was very well situated for meetings at Suntec Had a fantastic swim every day or evening and enjoyed the gym, where the staff soon got to know me I had a standard room, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was quite nice No gripes and as everywhere in Singapore the staff were extremely courteous

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We arrived for our 2 day stopover at 7am, tired after a long flight and minus our luggage which was possibly still somewhere in Europe. The hotel check in was speedy and, much to our relief they were able to offer us our room immediately along with the offer of extra toiletries and spare clothes should we need them - all much appreciated Breakfast was extensive, catering for most tastes with great service - can't comment on any of the other restaurants as we didn't have the opportunity to use them. We found the concierge extremely helpful in trying to locate our luggage as well as offering shopping and restaurant advice This hotel offers a great location and we felt very well looked after. It was our second visit and we would return for a third should we come back to…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Checked in for a 3 nights stay to attend official meetings. Upon stepping ut of airport taxi, it just looked like the many hotels that I stayed before. Check in was fast and I was given a room that I highlighted during booking. Lobby area and checking counter, design was a little disappointing, rather blend, but cafe or breakfast area on 4th Floor was just fantastic. Breakfast spread was OK as could be expected for a 5 star hotel. All staff met were polite and welcoming, and one of them that I ran into while looking to get a light or matches, went out of the way to give me his and turning down my insistance of paying him, his name is Moses

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: WOW! This is a Mandarin Oriental. You can expect it to be great, and it is. What we were amazed by was the level of service at the gym. At all times, there were two personal trainers on duty to help you learn a new piece of equipment, bring you a new water... as you took your last sip of the one you had... or take body measurements on a $10K machine and review your BMI, RMR, and other measurements with you. Simply great service at every turn. These folks deserve all the 5 stars.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This was my first time to Singapore and what a amazing memory I will have of my stay here and that's due to this wonderful hotel. The service was impeccable, cleanliness of the room, the little details, the friendly and helpful staff right from the front reception to the valet. On arrival I was informed of our room being upgraded and we had the most amazing view of the Marina Bay, Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands so beautiful. I have stayed in some of the best hotels but can honestly say the bed at Mandarin Oriential Singapore is the best bed I have ever slept in. The pool area, stunning, the views out over Marina Bay, the staff around the pool the food and drinks were fabulous, expensive, but the service was perfection. Hotel is also in a great spot within walking distance…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We attended on Mothers day recently. The food was absolutely amazing, beautifully presented with every type of food you could ever wish for, even a barbecue outside. The meats melted in your mouth, glorious seafood and pastries to die for even chocolate fountains to the great delight of children and adults alike. For 30 dollars extra you could have a selection of drinks including champagne on free flow. The times are between 12 and 3 pm. The cost was a little more than normal at approx 120 dollars per head as it was mothers day. Really lovely time had by all of us.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Had held our wedding dinner at Mandarin Oriental. Service and Wedding Dinner quality are top notch. Although pretty pricey but it is really worth it. My family and friends are all very happy with the food and service. The Wedding Suite we stayed is the City Suite. Abit disappointed that we were not given a better view e.g. Marina Bay Suite. But it is fine as the room is really spacious and nice. Really love the 2 days stay during our wedding!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My sister and I are now regular guests at the MO and this year we returned with our father for his birthday. Expectations were high and there were a few minor issues that I will address directly with management but all in all the service was great. Dad loved the Oriental club lounge and it's definitely worth the extra money. We had breakfast and pre dinner drinks there every day and the service from the staff was exceptional. Fantastic meals in both Mortons and Dolce Vita but a little disappointed with dinner at Melt, buffet quite pricey and selection not as extensive as say the Pan Pacific next door. Word of warning for those booking a twin room, it's just 2 single beds pushed together not 2 double beds with space in between . I love my sister but not that much!! I do notice a…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: MO is really a hotel brand where you can rely a very efficient and excellent service.., from their staffs and hotel facilities all are beyond expectations. We were delighted on all the extra arrangements.., though we have not requested it, they made sure that my son wil have a very memorable 13th bday celebration in their hotel. The smiles and warm welcome of all the staffs we met are all genuine. Overall.., we were very delighted and what we had during our stay at MO Singapore exceeded our expectations.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: They serves nice view and upgraded room without additional charges, even though I did an early check-in. And in the room and swinmming pool, I could see the city view including fascinating and famous building in Singapore with light at night. And breakfast menus consists of several kinds of countries' famous foods. Such as Japan, India, China and so on. I impressed nice facilities and all staff's kindness.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed overnight before a cruise to Hong Kong.We had an amazing view of the harbour from our room which was very comfortable.The staff were very accommodating and helpful.We had a great meal in the Asian restaurant in the Hotel and there is also a good bar.We also had time to visit Raffles Hotel on our short visit which is not far away.I would return to this hotel.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The staffs are helpful and friendly, the cleanliness of the room is superb, including the bathroom. The staffs always concerns about the availability of the everything, such as ensuring we have sufficient waters to drink, sufficient toiletries etc.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Ive been in love then hate with this property. But again, I stayed here countless time, the staffs even remembers me already. There was a time checking in and out took almost an hour before, problem when asking for rollaway bed, problem with credit card detail. But now its no more. The staffs are now attentive, fast and amazing esp the housekeeping team. They are aware I needed more water in room, they put some more extra without i need to ask. When I went out from the room, the aunty come to me give me a bottle of water for me to bring out. Isnt it beautiful? Its a small touch, and its really kind. The housekeeping need some appreciation too! Hope they keep on keeping up. Oh the new shampoo, soaps and all its nice too. Better than before.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Super staff, excellent food and great ambience. A very nice Indian food available in both breakfast buffet as well as in room dining. The pool is great and so is the hotel amenities and service. The staff never disappoints.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: M.O. hotels been around forever, this location is pretty convenient, close the shops, bars and everything. View is amazing. But room in higher floors aren't as peaceful as you think. Though room standard maybe up to standard and scale, but I do think their room is lack of lighting and abit moody. I am not sure whether they want to keep guests falling asleep asap or just their style. But overall I can't complain much> Just have to watch out their bed sheets, it was abit dusty when i wave it up

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: i always visit MO whenever i visit sg notably for by business visit. staffs support when i encounter any problem during stay (i.e. restaurant reservation, shopping related issues, transportation). Though the premises are a bit outdated, restau's great (i personally they serve the best breakfast buffet in sg!), great view, & great staff are good enough to compensate the hardware of the hotel.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My husband and I have just arrived home from 8 days in Singapore. We stayed at Mandarin Oriental. Request the 18th Floor Harbour Room. Do your booking directly with the Hotel, they are quick to reply and you will get a much better deal. They are so friendly and accommodating, you will have no worries at all. This hotel is very close to all that you need to do in Singapore, Shopping, MRT, and local attractions. We chose to upgrade to the Club Package, which is in the Oriental Lounge. Highly recommend. The staff on Level 19 are so attentive to your every need. They remember you and treat you with respect and go out of their way to attend to your needs or requests. You will be able to enjoy a wonderful breakfast, then from 11.30 till 4.30 a lunch or afternoon tea. Then…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I just stayed here for 3 overnights in early May for business. It had been several years since I last stayed here and the hotel was just as lovely as I remembered. All the staff took the time to say hi and wished me a nice day wherever I may come across them. Check-in was quick and I was up in my room several minutes before my bags arrived. The room was clean and had a lovely view of the water. The pillow was really flat but I didn’t ask for a different pillow so that was on me but to be honest I was exhausted every night and passed out quickly regardless of the pillow. There was a problem with the hairdryer but I made due with it and kept forget to tell them about it, so again, my fault for not asking for it to be addressed. Other than those two items, everything else was…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on our way into and from Vietnam. As expected - great service was offered by all of the staff we encountered. The pool bar offered spectacular views over the city and the laser light show over the harbour at 8pm and 9pm. The Dolce Vita restaurant offered one of the best Truffle Mushroom Risotto's I have ever had, and the breakfast bar offered a wide variety of food choices.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I have done a few staycations at the Mandarin Oriental. I had previously done a staycation at the Marina Bay Sands and can say with 100% positivity that the Mandarin Oriental is much better and better value for money. The harbour facing rooms have floor to ceiling windows, with great views of both Marina Bay Sands and the CBD, best of both worlds. The rooms are fantastic with the most amazing bed. The location of the hotel is great for walking around Marina area, with a lot of restaurant and dining areas. You can also walk over to the Boat Quay area within 15 minutes for more options. The pool is nice and not overly crowded with great views and fantastic service. For dining options in the hotel, you are spoilt with choice. Morton's is one of the top steakhouses and they…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We spent three nights in the Mandarin Oriental Singapore on route to Bali. Having stayed in many 5 star hotels all over the world I was simply blown away by every aspect of this hotel. We arrived around 10am after 14 hours of travelling to be greeted by Caroline on reception, she was extremely friendly and helpful and we forgot all about our long journey to get there. We booked a harbour view (I believe this is called a marina bay view) room and this was well worth the upgrade, you can see the uninterrupted iconic view so well. We were treated with such care throughout our stay whether it was reception, at breakfast, at the swimming pool or in the many restaurants and bars on site. Breakfast was the best I have ever experienced in any hotel, such a selection of food from all…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel last month on a business visit. Loved the location, great views of the marina from your room. Impressive lobby. Spacious rooms and well kept washroom. What makes this hotel different is the Team who goes out of their way to make your stay delightful. I travel a lot and have stayed in several great brands. I am truly impressed by the willingness of the team to make your stay the BEST. A very strong recommend. Will be back again next month.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Did a stay-cation at MO, as my friend had a room, well it is actually for Hardwell as the event was held at the The Meadows GBTB. Most of the time i was at the pool as i needed to recharge my senses with the two elements of mother nature, 'Sun' & 'Water'. I totally love the get-up of the pool and cabanas as all aspects blended well with one another and the weather was on our side for the past two days. Service staff were ready for every guest that walks in to the pool area, minutes later ice water was served. Got to compliment on the in-room dining, great service recovery as there was just a slight service lapse which we did not bother, however we were given a box of lovely artisanal crafted chocolates in a nice pink MO box. Tip: Wi-fi internet is chargeable per day at quite…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Located within walking distance of Raffles and surrounded by half a dozen shopping malls. Over looks Marina Bay. Enough food choices around the hotel or stay in and soak in the atmosphere within the hotel. I enjoyed drinks in a number of spaces. Staff were welcoming, helpful and friendly. If there isn't a cab downstairs the staff will ensure you get one. The internal atrium is impressive from the ground level. The long corridors aren't impressive on your floor level until you reach the room. I had a room overlooking the bay and there was always a wonderful view. The room was perfect for a business trip with connectivity and space to feel at home. Comfortable bed.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We spent six days in a Harbor View Club King room and couldn't be more pleased with the experience. Our room had the most amazing view of the harbor, the Singapore Flyer and the incredible Gardens by the Bay with its light show each evening. The Club Lounge with its constant supply of high quality food and beverage is hosted by the most charming accommodating staff. Alma and her team made us feel very special and well cared for. The hotel is extremely well located within walking or a short taxi ride from many of Singapore's special attractions. If you are able to book a Club room, don't hesitate. We found ourselves really never needing to eat or drink elsewhere. We would venture out for sightseeing and return to the Oasis of the lounge each day. Such a good value! The…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The hotel is a very pleasant and luxurious place located in the middle of the new Business centre of Singapore. The hotel reflects the quality and lifestyle one expects from all Mandarin Oriental hotels and it responds to the taste of the most spoiled global traveller. Staff is very cortageous and helpful. The rooms are not too big but adequate and well equiped . One should select the rooms with a view over the Marina which is spectecular especially at night. The hotel is located in the new centre of Singapore (Marina Bay) with all the high-end shopping, restaurant and theatre facuilities. The restaurants in the hotel are of high quality. The pool area is very beautiful with all facilities and service one would require.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I booked the Mandarin Oriental for my partners 50th Birthday, We booked two nights so we could wake up and have breakfast in our room with a fantastic view, and spend the whole day in the hotel as this was a treat for us. As always I email every type of accommodation we stay at to get a feel of how we will be treated. The reply emails were friendly and informative. On arrival I was nervous as I felt this hotel was out of our league, I went to the front desk to a very friendly welcome, then it seemed they could not find our reservation, then we were questioned several times if we had booked 1 room for 2 people and the bed type. After I had advised the desk I had emailed ahead we were shown to our room. We had booked the Marina Bay View Room and when the door opened I was Shocked…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Extremely pleasant and luxurious hotel which provides the guest a warm feeling of being very welcome. Provides all the facilities and services for a seasoned traveller. Very nicely located in the new center of Singapore at the Marina Bay surronded by a nice view and top end shopping opportunities and theaters. One should select those rooms with a view over the Marina Bay area which is magnificent during the evenings.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I’d like to start off this review by saying that the Mandarin Oriental is an exceptional property and definitely one of the best hotels I have stayed at in the world. I arrived around 3pm by taxi and the bellboy proceeded to take my luggage out of the trunk and instantly greeted me by name (I guess he looked at the luggage tag on my suitcase… very good first impression). He then showed me to reception where I was checked-in by Nazihah. She was super friendly, quick and professional. She assigned me a room on the 14th floor facing Marina Bay Sands and the city and promised me that the view would be amazing. The entire hotel has an atrium with glass lifts, which will take you up to the top floor. Upon entering the room, I was in awe of the unparalleled views from my window. It…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I stayed for 5 nights in April. Views across the bay are stunning, but the room itself was very standard. It could have been any 5 star room in any hotel in any city. Generic. I was traveling on business and didn't get time to use the facilities at the hotel, although I did spend a happy couple of hours in the bar on the martini night - great complimentary beef burgers were also served. The breakfast was very good, as you would expect, with a huge range of options. I always start the week with the Asian fare but soon revert to eggs and the like - you can't really start the day with noodles, rice soups, curries or fish. The fruit selection is fabulous but the mango seemed a little bland and there was no pomelo (which happens to be my favourite). The staff are very nice and…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We spent four days at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore directly after a cruise, great decision the hotel was fabulous. Staff could not be more helpful and showed great courtesy to all their clients. What we loved most through were the Restaurants within the hotel they were simply outstanding. If you are in Singapore do try the oriental

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: great service, lovely breakfast, Cherry Garden restaurant superb - the tasting menu is a very good choice, very nice rooftop swimming pool, worth paying a little more for harbour view room as the view is great and you get to watch the laser light show for free overnight!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I spent a week at the Mandarin Oriental in Sagapore from April 4th to April 10th 2015. The service overall in the hotel is exceptional. I had breakfast every morning at the buffet and I was impressed by the variety of the food selection and by how good everything I had tasted. I have rarely seen a buffet as good as this one. The room are spacious and clean: - The king size bed was very comfortable - There was a desk to work - The bathroom had a shower, a bath, 2 sinks, a make up mirror and a hair dryer - With 2 closets, there was plenty of storage for clothes and shoes - More shelving in the hallway for carry on, handbags and shoes - They had a full length ironing board with a very good iron(better that usual) The hotel is well located, within…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: I cannot speak highly enough of the staff and the service at the Mandarin Oriental. We were made to feel welcome from arrival and even got a room upgrade. The staff cannot do enough for you, and helped us both evenings by booking our dinner reservations, both from their recommendations, which were spot on! I would highly recommend this hotel, it was perfect for us!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Mandarin Oriental is always a pleasure to go back to. They make you feel like home and take good care of you. The rooms are very comfortable and the views are fantastic(ask for the Harbour view rooms). The breakfast is vast and one of the best in Singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is one place where they remember your name. The staff offer a personalized service. It's my favorite hotel in Singapore. Convenient to MRT, Matina Square and Marina Bay. Close to many attractions including Marina Bay Sans, Gardens by the Bay, Singapore Flyer. Breakfast is to die for - so many cuisines. I love my breakfast cuppa and the staff cater for your individual tastes - in my case, strong English Breakfast with fresh milk. Spend an hour or two at the swimming pool where you are automatically served with iced water. Cabanas and towels are all provided. Check yourself in for a massage - I had a Thai massage - it was rejuvenating!

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This time I got a complimentary upgrade to a suite with two rooms and a great view over the inner lake. Although this hotel is in the upper range of price it is worth it. Service is great with check in arrangement while you unpack. You can organize pick up at the airport through the hotel which is really convenient when you traveled a long time and like to get to your hotel as soon as possible.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: This is our 3rd stay. This hotel is ideally located with convenient access to shopping, MRT ( the local metro/tube which is clean fast & cheap) and nearby other hotels are all liked by a network of malls. It is more exclusive & less of a thoroughfare than the much larger& much more visible Marina Bay Sands. At 7.45 pm the trees in Marina Bay gardens light up over 15 mins display & at 8pm there is a light/laser show on the city side of the Marina Bay Sands. This is repeated at 9pm, all visible from the windows of the Mandarin Oriental. This hotel values return customers. We notice that our room view has improved on each occasion . On our first trip, we were on the 4 th floor facing the city. By this trip we are on the 19 th floor facing the ocean. There are no bad views, it just…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. As honeymooners when checking in the lady looked for the highest floor possible which was was a bonus as the views of the city and marina were incredible. Everything about this hotel is classy- great selection at breakfast , is well positioned to see Singapore and good for lazy days by the pool too

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stay at this hotel during Chingay Parade end February. The Hotel is very nice, the swimming pool wonderful, the Club Marina Bay room very well appointed and I had direct views from the room to the Chingay parade which was amazing. The Oriental Club was superb as well, foods & beverage there were excellent as well as the service. The only point was that except in the afternoon, the lounge was always crowded in the morning for breakfast and during the evening cocktails. I booked a Spa treatment and both the Spa equipment, treatment and therapist were top notch. The stay was almost perfect, the only small unpleasant thing was at arrival I didn't have a great 1st impression, because a lady took my printed reservation and started to do the check in the lobby. I had to ask her if…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Our family travel frequently and I can honestly say that this 3 weeks staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore has been absolutely first class the whole time for me, my wife and two young children. The staff have been extremely attentive to all our needs and made a real effort to get to know us and went out of their way to make us feel as comfortable as possible. I can't imaging staying anywhere else now when I return to Singapore.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed here for a week. My daughter was on business and I was here to relax and explore. We both were looked after as if family, and always felt special. Every member of staff we met, in all roles within the hotel, were extremely polite and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble and often staff would provide services without having been asked - especially in the dining rooms. I was most impressed how the chefs were able to cater well to my dietary needs. Everyone was given the same lovely attention and made to feel special. Staff took the time to ask about your day- what you had planned or had done. They were always willing to help with maps, directions and/or advice. The lifts are in a central atrium, taking the noise away from the rooms. They have a wide…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: We liked this hotel. Two children (5 & 8), we took a suite where one had a roll out bed, another slept on a really big sofa and we had a very large bed. It worked well. Breakfast is the best you will get. A really great buffet. Yes there are business people around but we were made to feel very welcome by everyone. The staff are great. The pool is big and plenty of room to lounge (when we were there). I wonder if this is also because most staying are business people. This makes it a great hotel for a family as the pool is underused for the size of hotel. We ate out in the evening but did come back one night for ice cream in what looked like a quite, adult bar. No problems. Warmly welcomed and the kids ran around a bit after (there is a corridor that circles the lifts) and…

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: Stayed here twice and the service has been consistent. Breakfast is great and so is the room. The pool and gym facilities are well maintained. Walking distance to Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands but no crowd here. The only comment with the rooms is that the bed is too soft and wifi is not free of charge though.

address: 5 Raffles Avenue Marina Square, Singapore 039797 Singapore
name: Mandarin Oriental, Singapore
reviews.text: The service was up to Mandarin standards but the hotel itself needs updating. The room furnishing are from the '80s and art art on any of the walls in the room or in the corridors of the hotels. Bland. I would not return. Excellent buffet breakfast with very friendly and efficient staff.

address: 10 Bayfront Avenue, Marina Bay, 018956 Singapore, Singapore
name: Marina Bay Sands
reviews.text: “Superb propery ... excellent location. Loved the Infinity Pool.”

reviews.text: “A MUST-stay in Singapore. What an experience! Breakfast at Spago was AMAZING! The pool was on obviously the highlight. We had an amazing stay, the room (level 39) overlooked the garden. Stunning at night!”

reviews.text: “I thought this was going to be a once in a lifetime stay. I was wrong. I will ABSOLUTELY stay here every single time I visit Singapore from now on. The views over the city from my room were absolutely SPECTACULAR. And the views from the pool.......”

reviews.text: “The staff went above and beyond to be of assistance. The facilities are immaculate. The views and rooftop are completely unparalleled. The location is excellent.”

reviews.text: “Staff was super helpful, friendly and went the extra mile for service. Room service food was great (esp. the nasi goreng and laksa!), so much so we also asked if we could buy the pickled cucumbers from the nasi goreng dish, and they were able to...”

reviews.text: “EQ is an amazing hotel at the very heart of Kuala Lumpur. The hotel beats with hospitality, comfort and all the necessities that you might need. The rooms are clean and majority of them have a gorgeous overview over the city. I cannot find a...”

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Chilled and calm with fantastic service. The perfect retreat in a hectic schedule. Great position right next to the station. Staff cannot do enough for you. If you get Omar Sharif on reception then even better… knowledgeable, courteous and would definitely stay here again.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Finally back to the KL Hilton. Wonderful staff, rooms still great and offerings in executive lounge are very solid. Breakfast at Vasco with lots of options - coffee menu could be a bit improved tough, with stronger barista espressos. Special mention to Dino who helped us to get our bags all the way to the KLIA train!

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: another wonderful stay, short but memorable. a big shout out to the A-Team: Azu, David Lopez, Nik, and Omar for their excellent services. looking forward to my next stay here. keep up the good work. cheers.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Very good customer service at level 33 afifi hafifah i will again here i love to come KL Hilton with nice view at VIP executive room my family are happy to come here for holiday break the swimming pool are very nice my kids love it so much

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Happy short vacation for our kids and us. Best pool with slide. Variety selection of breakfast and delicious. Check in with Mr Omar anc check out with Mr Azan. Both helpful and friendly. InsyaAllah will come again.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: The staffs at the Executive floor (33) were great. The Malay lady (forgot to ask her name) was so kind to us and our children. Even though we were not happy about our rooms as they gave us different floors (booked 2 rooms) and we were family and we already paid for the rooms! Plus a Hilton Honors member! The receptionist didnt give us an option to allow access to the floors. It was hard and we had to meet at the lobby or 33rd floor. Went for the massage and it was very nice!

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Human connection is always the top one priority for me. The hotel is great as always when comes to facilities and cleanliness if you are looking for a comfy stay, but most importantly it's the employee who takes care of your business. Special thanks to Faizal Abd Rani for his great assistance as always, especially this is the 2nd time I met him during my stay with the Hilton. Not to forget Syazwan, the Bellman, who always handling well of my luggage during my check-in/out the hotel. Last but not least, also thanks to Omar and Nurul Nadia who assisted me on my inquiries. Lovely and friendly staffs, keep it up the good works! I will certainly recommend Hilton to my network and continue choosing Hilton whenever I travel in the world.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Breakfast is great but nothing much different about the menu list. The menu for breakfast were all the same throughout the years we stayed here. Notwithstanding, thanks to the staffs (Ms Baida, Ms Noor, Vicknes & Ms Ramlah) for attending us with utmost warm and we are so greatful for the wonderful services and their hospitality. We are so happy n appreciate for that.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: The breakfast was good. Variety of choices from Asian to Western. Staff at Vasco are professional and courteous in their work. Highly recommended. Special thanks to Baidah, Noor, Vickness and Ramlah for their excellent service.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Maheswaren the bell man was fantastic, so friendly and gave easy to follow advice on changing money to getting a local sim. Rooms very spacious and lovely views. If you're travelling with kids the pool area with water slides is one of the best I've seen.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Thanks to Halilah and team Alif, Adriana, Hakimi & Putri for your good service & enjoy the food with nice view at executive lounge for evening apprentice level 33. Thank you for memories & experience.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Loved the service and the sweet pink theme which are my twin girl's favorite. The careful attention and prompt service provided by Sanjai and his team is one can expect from Hilton. Keep up the great job and will look forward to jext month's hi tea!

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: The cutest best tasting pastries. Great for a small celebration with friends as well as some ‘me’ time. Will definitely come back for more. Great service from Sanjai, Sheril, Charuni, Kuna and Zack!!

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Perched on a hill, the lobby overlooks the highway and a nice greenery view that stands in contrast to the modern glass setting of the lobby. High ceilings and wide frontage gives an impressive layout overall Nice ambient and attentive staff. Kudos to the Samjai, Kuna, Sharil, Charvni, Zack for their service. Would visit this place again.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I dont know how many times we have frequented Vasco..had a great buffet breakfast with a huge spread..taste was good as usual..andv staff wete exemplary..Baidah was efficient in the handling of the seating..well done..will definitely come again..

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Thank you for serving me and my friends with delicious food. Apart from the food, we love the staffs' way of approaching us and the food suggestions with clear explanation especially Mr Pravin. Keep on the good work Hilton, KL.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: I had a satisfying experience with my office mates for dinner earlier. The food and not forgetting Pravin's service with a very clear explanation. Loved the way he took care of his guests. Thank you Hilton Kuala Lumpur.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Sheril has the best services. The way she explain and review to me & my wife is so good and understanding. Im used to be a Hotelier too. She do always check on us whether the taste of the sweetness hi tea is good or not. Me and My wife love the way she is. Keep it up Sheril anida.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Sheril anida has the best Fnb service for me. Even my business partner told me the same thing. And she looks very smart with the uniform and the way she served to us. Very excellent! By that, I can get a short conversation with her eventhough the operation quite busy. The way she speaks is so professional with her sincere smile. For me, the managers should review the way she work. The best for me. Kudos and good job Sheril anida. Hope to see her again in a future 👍

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Our visit was awesome with the tremendous service by the staff. Our entrance was smooth as we’re straight away directed to our table. Chef Rasdan and Chef Jamsari was such a great help and not to forget Chef Leo Michael & Chef Kazi. But, our visit wouldn’t be such a pleasure without the tremendous service by the other staff such as Sanjai, Siti Zubaidah, Pravin and also Waran. And we really enjoyed the surprise cake for our anniversary.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Good food and service.. special thanks to Pravin, Zubaidah, Sanjai and Waran. We had a suprise birthday cake by the manager Sanjai and welcomed by all the crew. Friendly staffs especially Pravin and will be looking forward to come again.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: We came for our anniversary dinner! Love loveee the food. So worth the price. Excellent service from Mr Sanjai, Mr Pravin, Ms S. Zubaidah, Mr Waran & Ms Hanis. We even got a complimentary cake for our anniversary.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Sincerely i met hospitality at its best, the staffs and facility of Hilton KL are the best, i sincerely thank you all for making my stay enjoyable, you are truly the defination of quality hospitality.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Mr. Fauzi, baidah, Ramlah, Noor, Ellen,and Harini Without you the hotel and Vasco’s restaurant are incomplete, you are amazing. So helpful and your friendliness beyond expectation. We would definitely comeback and see you again. 👍 keep it up

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Excellent services provided by the staffs Sanjay,Jawahir,Siti Zubaidah,Pravin,Waran & Amy….we really enjoyed the delicious food….happy celebrating our son’s birthday…done by the staffs surprisingly….& overwhelming….Tqvm…

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Seafood is extremely fresh, food is delicious, variety is great. Service is amazing. Namely from Sanjay, Jawahir, Siti Zubaidah, Pravin, and Waran. They were very very helpful and welcoming to not just me, but all guests. It created a very nice ambience and overall great experience. Will definitely recommend to friends and cannot wait to come again.

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
name: Hilton Kuala Lumpur
reviews.text: Great food. Excellent service. Great customer service by Sanjai, siti zubaibah, Pravin and waran. Fresh prawns, great steak and deserts. Easy access to parking as well. Alot of choices with different styles of cooking. Ex: Indian, Malay, western, Italian and more...

address: 3 Jalan Stesen Sentral, Kuala Lumpur 50470 Malaysia
